loans.name: Berta Alicia

texts.es: Berta de 60 años de edad vive con su familia actualmente. Es un mujer muy emprendedora que siempre ha entregado todo para darle lo mejor a su familia es muy conocida por sus vecinos por ser ejemplo en su hogar ya que es una mujer trabajadora, responsable y oficiosa. Berta desde hace un tiempo posee una pequeña tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad, por su forma y manera de ser posee de clientela ya que maneja precios accesibles, ella desea incrementar sus ganancias pero no posee el capital suficiente para llevar a cabo su sueño es por eso que se acercó a INTEGRAL para solicitar un crédito y así seguir abasteciendo su tienda y comprar artículos como: huevos, leche, frijoles, azúcar, sopas instantáneas, espera contar con la ayuda que necesita y así poder seguir siendo mujer ejemplo a en su hogar.
texts.en:
Berta is 60 years old and presently lives with her family. She is a very enterprising woman who has always given her all to provide the best for her family. She is very well known among her neighbors as an example in her home, since she is a hard-working, responsible, and efficient woman.

For some time how, Berta has had a small store where she sells articles of primary necessity. Due to her nature and manner of being, she possesses her clientele, in part, because she keeps her prices accessible. She wishes to increase her earnings but lacks sufficient capital to carry out her dream. 

That's why Berta approached INTEGRAL to request a loan and thus, continue supplying her store, purchasing articles such as eggs, milk, beans, sugar, and instant soups. Berta hopes she can count on the help she needs and be able to continue being an exemplary woman in her home.

loans.use: buy articles to sell in her little store, such as eggs, milk, beans, sugar, and instant soups.

loans.name: Kanini

texts.en:
Kanini is asking for a loan to make new investments. She is happy for the support she received and the one she is hoping to receive. 

Kanini has a good testimony for the progress of her business and the well being of her family. She says that the previous loan had a positive impact on both her vegetable business and her family’s living standards. 

She wants to expand her existing business and start a business selling mats at the market. For this reason, she is asking for this loan so as to buy fresh vegetables and stocks of mats for sale. Her goal is to run several businesses in future.

loans.use: to buy fresh vegetables and stocks of mats for sale.

loans.name: Nyamvula

texts.en:
Nyamvula is making a new investment in her business. She is happy to see her business improve using the previous loan. 

She is sure that this investment will also have a positive impact. She wants to buy more utensils, and if the amount stretches, she wants to invest it in the cultivation of her farm. Nyamvula is sure to repay her loan and ask for more loans so that she can move forward.

loans.use: to buy more household utensils to sell.

loans.name: Graciela Narda

texts.es: La Sra. Graciela tiene 48 años de edad, tiene un hijo que tiene la edad de 16 años,  ella se dedica a la venta de papelería, material de escritorio,  libros etc. Ella vende variedad de productos según a la temporada, tiene ubicado su bazar librería en la zona de Pampahasi en un lugar muy concurrido de la zona Sur, ella vive en casa familiar, ella solicita el crédito para proveerse de mercadería con la compra de material escolar para su librería – bazar ya que le va muy bien ya que por la ubicación del negocio tiene una buena venta y es una persona responsable y trabajadora, agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado, ya que esta es la única actividad con la que saca adelante a su hijo, su deseo es el de ver a su hijo profesional y que pueda ejercer su profesión.
texts.en:
Graciela is 48 years old, has a child, who is 16 years old. She makes a living selling stationery products, books etc. She sells variety of products according to the season. Her bookstore is located in the area of Pampahasi in a very busy place in the southern zone. 

She lives in a family house. She is requesting this loan to purchase school’s supplies for her bookstore, Bazar. The business is going well because of its location; as a result sales are good. She is a responsible and hard-working person. She is very thankful with the institution for its support as this helps her to get ahead her son. Her desire is to see her son become a professional and to be able to exercise his profession.

loans.use: to buy school supplies for her bookstore such as notebooks, pens, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a calibrater, rectifiers, welders, a hand saw, a file, a drill, a screwdriver, and spanners, among others.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 30-year-old woman and mother of two young children. She lives with her family in the rural area of Tiribe in the coastal region of Kenya. 

For the past five years, Elizabeth has run a retail shop in her home, serving the neighborhood. Her goal is move forward in life, but her main challenges are the high prices of commodities and the lack of enough capital to invest in her business. 

She is, however, optimistic, and she is sure that this investment from the loan she is currently asking will help her grow her business. She plans to buy bales of flour, rice, sugar, and beans.

loans.use: to buy bales of flour, rice, sugar, and beans.

loans.name: Jennyfer Alexandra

texts.es:
Jennyfer es una joven de 19 años de edad, es soltera sin carga familiar, vive con sus padres, estudia la carrera de Derecho en la Universidad de su ciudad en el distrito de San Vicente, se encuentra cursando el octavo ciclo de su carrera, ella trabaja en una empresa comercial de su ciudad, como vendedora, es una chica muy trabajadora, empeñosa, estudiosa y responsable con todo lo que le encomiendan.
Jennyfer tiene más de un año trabajando como vendedora, labora de lunes a domingo y lo hace para así poder pagar sus estudios y siempre apoyar a su familia.
Jennyfer tiene un sueño culminar su carrera de derecho para así poder buscar un trabajo en el cual pueda ejercer su carrera como abogada y convertirse en una gran empresaria exitosa y darles una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.     
Jennyfer esta agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, porque gracias a su ayuda podrá comprarse una computadora con la cual podrá realizar su trabajo de Universidad.
texts.en:
Jennyfer, 19, is a young, single woman with no dependents.  She lives with her parents and is studying Law at the university in her town of San Vicente.  She’s in the 8th semester of her career.  She works as a salesperson in a local firm.  She’s a very hardworking, dedicated, responsible young woman who is a good student and takes all her responsibilities seriously.

Jennyfer has been working as a saleswoman for more than a year.  She works Monday to Sunday in order to pay for her courses and to help out her family.  Her dream is to get her law degree and be able to find a job where she can practice her profession as an attorney and become a successful businesswoman providing better quality of life for her family.

She’s grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to their help she’ll be able to buy a computer to do her university work.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Jargalsaihan

texts.en: Mr. Jargalsaihan is 39 years old, and lives with his wife and his son in Ger in Govi-Altai province in Mongolia. His wife Altanzaya, aged 37, is an interior designer. During summer she works at private construction companies as a contractor and she works for a small cafeteria during winter. His son Erdenebadrakh, aged 9 goes to primary school. Jargalsaihan had been working as a security guard in a private company since 2007 but quit the job because his wages were not enough to cover his family's expenses. He is planning to operate a firewood and coal selling business at a local market. He has estimated that the potential income and profit will be enough for his family's expenses and he is planning to save extra for his son's future education. He will purchase coal and firewood from a coal mine which is 58 km away from his town and sell to local customers at a higher price. He is now requesting 650,000 MNT to purchase a mini truck to run his newly starting business successfully without any problems. He is a responsible, honest and hardworking man.

loans.use: to purchase a mini truck to run his newly starting business of reselling coal and firewood.

loans.name: Santos Mendaly

texts.es:
Santos, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo para invertir en el negocio, ya que quiere crecer en su granja de pollos, a través del préstamo podrá realizar la compra de pollos pequeños y concentrado.
Él considera que el préstamo anterior le permitió crecer y tener más amplia la granja, en su familia sus circunstancias se mantienen y los ingresos han sido estables.
texts.en:
Santos has decided on a new loan to invest in the business, as she wants to expand her chicken farm. Through this loan she can buy young chickens and feed.

She thinks that the previous loan permitted her to grow and to expand the farm. Her family circumstances and income have been steady.

loans.use: to buy young chickens and feed

loans.name: Salama

texts.en:
Every person has the desire to obtain a life worth living and to feel responsible in the society. Salama is not an exception.  She is a married woman who takes care of her three school-aged children. 

She has a small locale at the market where she sells charcoal. She already has established a good clientele base, and she counts on good results from her business. 

Salama wants to buy more sacks of charcoal for resale. She wants to make some investments in her business so as to meet her customer needs.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Janet

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal HATUN RUMIYOC,la socia continua dedicandose a su profesion de contadora,la socia lleva años ejerciendo su carrera,la socia cuenta con un local donde realiza su trabajo asesorando a clientes que solicitan sus servicios,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicito el credito para realizar el mantenimiento de su computadora y para algunos gastos personales.
La socia se siente agradecida por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en: The member belongs to the community bank Hatun Rumiyoc. The member continues to work at her job as an accountant. The member has spent many years performing her job. The member found a location where she completes her work giving advice to clients that seek her services. The member is a responsible and earnest person and because of these characteristics the member gets her family ahead. The member seeks the loan to complete the upkeep of her computer and for a few personal expenses. The member feels grateful for the loan she was granted and she undertakes to comply with her established payments.

loans.use: to complete the upkeep of her computer and for a few personal expenses.

loans.name: Maria Toribia

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 56 años, aprobó la escuela primaria con un gran esfuerzo de sus padres, ahora está casada con José de 58 años, tienen 2 hijos de 18 y 12 años de edad, son una familia de escasos recursos pero muy unida. Viven en un sector del campo de la ciudad de Latacunga capital de la provincia de Cotopaxi, una de las provincias que forma parte de la Región Sierra del Ecuador y que los últimos años se ha desarrollado notablemente de tal forma que es considerada una de las más importantes de la región gracias a la industria florícola, minera, metalúrgica, agroindustria, agrícola y ganadera. Además existen establecimientos de negocios que generan interesantes ingresos lo que le convierte en una ciudad comercial y con varias oportunidades para salir adelante. Aunque hay un alto índice de pobreza el espíritu emprendedor de sus habitantes ha hecho que la  ciudad sobresalga. En el sector rural y urbano se puede encontrar familias destacando sus talentos para emprender con alguna idea que les pueda generar rentabilidad para conseguir el sustento diario. María y su familia forman parte de este grupo de personas que aunque no viven en las mejores condiciones, han encontrado en el campo el sustento de vida.
María cada día entre 6 y 8 horas se dedica a criar y cuidar vacas para que produzcan leche y luego de hacer el largo viaje comercializar este producto en las parroquias aledañas y en la ciudad. Tiene una gran experiencia en esta actividad, pues ha sido su trabajo durante 40 años, comenzó desde que era una jovencita, ya que ha sido una costumbre llevar a cabo este negocio en su familia. En su tiempo libre cuida a sus nietos y cuida algunos cultivos de su terreno. Por su experiencia ahora desea comprar vacas para incrementar la producción de leche y de esta forma mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia. Para cumplir esta meta ha solicitado un crédito a Fundación Alternativa quienes a través del financiamiento de Kiva han podido facilitar a María el dinero para la compra de ganado. María está muy agradecida y piensa que no será la primera vez que estos créditos sean parte de su crecimiento.
texts.en:
María is a 56-year-old woman. She completed primary school with the help of the great effort made by her parents, and now she is married to 58-year-old José. They have two children, ages 18 and 12. They are a family with limited resources but they are very united. 

They live in a sector of the countryside of the city of Latacunga, capitol of the province of Cotopaxi, one of the provinces that make up the region Sierra del Ecuador, and which in recent years has developed in such a notable way that it is considered one of the most important cities of the region thanks to its flower industry, mining, metallurgy, agribusiness, agricultural and livestock industries. There are also business establishments there that generate interest income, making it a market town with several opportunities to get ahead. Even though it has a high poverty rate, the enterprising spirits of its inhabitants have made the city excel. In the rural and urban sectors, you can find families demonstrating their talents in starting businesses with ideas that generate the profits to get them their daily bread. 

María and her family are part of this group of people that, even though they do not live in the best conditions, have found their livelihoods in the countryside. María raises and cares for cows between six and eight hours each day so that they produce milk, and then she makes the long journey to sell this product in the neighboring parishes and in the city.

She has a lot of experience in this, since it has been her job for 40 years. She started when she was very young, as it has been a custom in her family to conduct this business. In her free time she takes care of her grandchildren and cares for some of the crops on her land. Based on her experience she now wishes to buy cows to increase milk production and in this way improve her quality of life and that of her family. 

In order to meet this goal she has requested a loan from Fundación Alternativa, who - through the financing of Kiva - have been able to provide María with the money to purchase cattle. María is very grateful and this will not be the first time that these loans will be part of her growth.

loans.use: to buy cows and increase milk production

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es: Juan de 34 años de edad, reside junto a su esposa y a sus 4 hijos menores de edad, 2 de ellos están estudiando en la escuela y son muy aplicados. Es un hombre muy trabajador que siempre se ha caracterizado por ser ejemplo en su hogar ya que cada mañana despierta con nuevas ilusiones y deseos de superación para ser un buen padre de familia. Actualmente Juan tiene una pequeña tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad como leche, huevos entre otros y gracias a Dios posee de clientela ya que por la manera de ser y atender a los clientes lo prefieren esta muy contento porque día a día se ha ido superando, Lastimosamente Juan desde hace un tiempo desea ampliar su única fuente de trabajo y tener un poco mas surtida la tienda es por eso que decidió  acercarse a INTEGRAL para solicitar un crédito y así poder abastecer mas su tienda comprando más producto como queso, pan de dulce, cereales, papel higiénico, sopas entre otras. Agradece a todas esas personas que de buen corazón desea ayudarle y les asegura no defraudarlas.
texts.en:
Juan is 34 years old and lives with his wife and their 4 minor children, 2 of whom are studying very diligently in school. He is a very hard-working man who has always been characterized as an example in his home. Every morning he wakes up with new dreams and desires to get ahead and be a good father to his family.

At present, Juan has a small store where he sells articles of primary necessity, like milk and eggs, among other things.  Thanks to God, he possesses his own clientele, due to his character and the way he attends to the customers who favor his business. 

Juan is quite content because day by day he has been advancing. Determinedly, for some time now Juan has wanted to expand this, his only source of work, and have a greater variety of merchandise in his store, buying more products such as cheese, sweet bread, cereal, toilet paper, and soup, among other items.

He is grateful to everyone who, from the good of their heart, wishes to help him, and he assures them that they will not be defrauded.

loans.use: buy merchandise for his store, including cheese, sweet bread, cereals, toilet paper, and soup, among other items.

loans.name: Isabel Cristina

texts.es:
Isabel, se decidió por un nuevo préstamo, por la necesidad de invertir mas en el negocio, ella quiere comprarse con los fondos que se le presten frutas frescas como jocotes, mangos, papaya, que son su fuerte en las ventas, espera tener buenos resultados.
Ella comenta que el préstamo anterior le permitió crecer y tener lo mas necesario para atender a los clientes, sus ingresos han mejorado, en su familia considera que viven en mejores condiciones.
texts.en: Isabel decided to apply for a new loan because she needed to invest more in her business.  With the money she is lent, she wants to purchase fresh fruits like jocotes (hog plums), mangos and papayas, which are her biggest sellers, and she hopes to have good results with them.  She says that her previous loan allowed her to grow and have what was most needed to serve her customers.  Her earnings have improved, and she believes that her family is now living in better conditions.

loans.use: purchase jocotes (hog plums), mangos, and papayas.

loans.name: Ana Marlene

texts.es: Ana Marlene de 33 años de edad, vive junto a su familia es una mujer muy dedicada a su trabajo y  que siempre le ha gustado ser una mujer admirable por quienes la conocen, es responsable, atenta, amable y muy trabajadora, Ana Marlene se dedica a la venta de ropa usada, con esfuerzo y dedicación ha colocado su negocio ubicado en su hogar, es muy conocida por los lugareños donde reside y esto la hace de clientela abundante poco a poco sabe subsistir con su día a día. Su principal fuente de superación es su familia ya que nunca la han dejado sola y la han apoyado en lo debido. Ana Marlene desea ampliar más su negocio y ha buscado los recursos necesarios  pero no encuentra es por eso que se acercó a INTEGRAL  para solicitar un crédito y así comprar: camisas, pantalones, blusas, faldas u otros artículos. Confía en Dios que su negocio crecerá y agradece de ante mano por la ayuda que recibirá.
texts.en:
Ana Marlene, 33, lives with her family.  She's very dedicated to her work and always has liked being admired by her acquaintances.  She's responsible, attentive, pleasant, and very hardworking.

Ana Marlene works with effort and dedication selling used clothing.  She has put her business in her home.  She's very well known by the locals where she lives, and little by little this has given her abundant customers.  She knows how to live day by day.  Her main source of self-improvement is her family because they never have left her alone and they have supported her appropriately.

Ana Marlene wants to expand her business more and has looked for the necessary resources, but hasn't found them.  This is why she went to Integral to request a loan to buy shirts, pants, blouses, skirts, or other garments.

She has faith in God that her business will grow, and she's grateful in advance for the help she'll receive.

loans.use: to buy shirts, pants, blouses, skirts, and other garments

loans.name: Blanca Udelia

texts.es:
La señora Blanca tiene 38 años de edad, es casada y tiene tres hijos, de los cuales solo dos viven con ella. Se dedica a la sastrería desde hace 22 años, el trabajo lo aprendió confeccionando sus propias prendas de vestir, armando piezas nuevas y desarmando piezas viejas, así logro elaborarle un uniforme a su hermanita y poco a poco fue confeccionando uniformes para bandas musicales, luego aprendió a elaborar trajes de novias. Actualmente confecciona 780 prendas al año para unas escuelas y otros trabajos que realiza a particulares; tiene dos operarias que trabajan junto con ella.  Cuando termina los uniformes paga un vehiculo para trasladarlos a la escuela.

Para comprar los productos para su negocio, aborda un autobús que tarda unas tres horas hasta llegar a la agencia en donde compra, estas compras las realiza dos veces al año, ya que debido a la distancia prefiere surtirse de todo de una sola vez. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar dos novillas. Con la inversión, pretende aprovechar los residuos que quedan de las cosechas que hace su esposo e incrementara la posibilidad de producir lácteos para consumo de su familia. 

Su sueño es tener un empleo constante, ya que la confección de prendas de vestir es dos veces al año.
texts.en:
Blanca is 38 years old, married with three children, of whom only two are living with her. 

She has been working in tailoring for 22 years. She learned the work by making her own clothing, assembling new pieces and taking apart old ones, and so she was successful making a uniform for her sister and little by little she was making band uniforms, and later learned to make bridal gowns. Currently she is making 780 garments a year for some schools and other work for individuals. She has two employees that work with her. When she finishes the uniforms she hires a vehicle to transport them to the school. In order to buy products for her business, she takes a bus that takes about three hours to get to the agency where she makes her purchases two times a year, but owing to the distance she prefers to stock up all at one time.

The loan that she is asking for from Fundación Campo is to buy two heifers, as with the investment she wants to make good use of the remains left behind of her husband’s harvest and increase the possibility of producing milk for family consumption.

Her dream is to have a steady job since making garments is two times a year.

loans.use: to buy two heifers to produce milk for family consumption to supplement her tailoring work

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Meet 36-year-old Victor. He is married and has three children. He runs a drugstore and mobile money transfer shop with his father Athanasius. Victor is very proud that the very first Zoona Mobile money transfer was done at his shop in Nakonde. 

Victor stays in Nakonde, a town that is one of Zambia's major border posts in the Northern province. He and his father have been running the drugstore for 12 years. He added mobile money transfers to his business three years ago and boasts of being the very first agent to do a Zoona mobile money transfer. He says he loves the business because it's easy for customers to obtain drugs and send or receive monies to or from their loved ones and for business purposes. 

With the Kiva loan, Victor will be able to add to his working capital, so that he can serve more customers who want to send or receive large amounts of money. This will help him earn more commissions. He says the commissions will help him to save up so that he can open up another mobile money transfer shop.

Victor is convinced that the loan will give his business the boost that it needs and help him to take care of his family.

loans.use: To increase his working capital so he can serve more customers who want to send or receive money.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is a widow who lives with her four children in the town of Tiribe.  Despite the various adversities she is going through, Mwanasha does not lose heart. She knows that hard work pays; this is a slogan that always rings in her mind. 

She was able to open a vegetable stall selling fresh fruits and vegetables. Her dream is to expand her business and then go into clothes selling in future. She knows that this is possible through determination and God’s will. 

She is asking for a loan to buy more fresh fruits and vegetables like tomatoes, onions, potatoes, and kale.

loans.use: to buy more fresh fruits and vegetables, like tomatoes, onions, potatoes, and kale.

loans.name: Rene Vitelio

texts.es: Rene Vitelio de cincuenta y cinco años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida Eugenia y sus hijos; él se dedica a venta de medicina popular y natural, su negocio esta ubicado en el mercado municipal de la zona es un  lugar muy estratégico por lo que se hecho de mucha clientela, tiene varios años con el negocio y ha adquirido mucha experiencia valiosa para las ventas, todas las personas que lo visitan quedan satisfechas pues saben que todo es de primera calidad, a precios accesibles y con un excelente servicio; Rene es un hombre de hogar, dedicado a su labor, soñador y dispuesto a dar todo de si para alcanzar el éxito, últimamente ha aumenta la demanda y quiere aprovechar para aumentar la inversión pero no posee del suficiente capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar medicina natural y popular por mayor. Rene Vitelio tiene buenas referencias de pago por parte de sus conocidos es responsable y contento con la ayuda, asegura poder cancelar la deuda y al mismo tiempo  confía en poder llevar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Rene Vitelio, 55, lives with his life partner, Eugenia, and his children.  He works selling folk and natural medicines.  His business is in the town market of the area, a strategic location through which he has acquired a lot of customers.  He has had the business for several years and has acquired valuable sales experience.  Everyone who visits him is satisfied because they know that everything is high quality and affordable, and the service is excellent.

Rene is a homebody, dedicated to his job, and a dreamer who is ready to give everything of himself to achieve success.  Demand has increased lately and he wants to make the most of it to increase his investment.  He doesn't have sufficient capital, though, so he's asking Integral for a loan to buy natural and popular medicine wholesale.

Rene Vitelio has an excellent payment record among his acquaintances.  He's responsible and happy about the help.  He's certain he'll be able to repay the debt, and he also trusts he'll be able to bring economic security.

loans.use: to buy natural and folk medicines

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
Maria, vive con su esposo y dos hijos, los hijos dependen económicamente, no tiene familiares en el extranjero, Maria administra una tienda, la comenzó por iniciativa propia, la tiene instalada en su casa, no tiene un horario establecido para atenderlo.
Ella quiere invertir en el negocio con un préstamo que esta solicitando, el cual lo utilizara para la compra de arroz, frijoles, aceite, queso, entre otros productos que son necesarios para poder continuar ofreciendo a los clientes.
Su aspiración es tener una buena clientela y vivir en mejores condiciones con su familia.
texts.en:
Maria lives with her husband and two children who depend on them economically. She does not have family members livings outside the country. Maria manages a stores that she began upon her own initiative. The store is located in her home so she does not have a set schedule to attend to it. 

She wants to invest in her business with the loan that she is requesting which she will use to buy rice, beans, oil, cheese and other products that are necessary to continue offering to her clients. 

Her aspiration is to have a good clientele and live with her family under better conditions.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, oil and cheese.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more scrap metals

loans.name: Menza

texts.en: Every normal person has many challenges to overcome and this gentleman is an example. Menza is single; he is a kind and hardworking person who earns a living by selling mats.  He does not want to engage in the violent activities experienced in his vicinity. He believes that hard work pays and this is the spirit that keeps him moving. Menza has been in this business for the last two years, selling his mats at the market. He is taking out this loan to buy more stock of mats to sell and to pay transportation costs.

loans.use: to buy more stock of mats to sell and to pay transportation costs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy goats and cows and to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Mudzo

texts.en: Mudzo has been involved in buying and selling animals for the last two years, with good results. He lives in the town of Tiribe. Mudzo is currently asking for a loan to invest in the purchase of six goats for sale. He dreams of owning a bigger retail shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase six goats to sell

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 24000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell for her business buying and selling charcoal.

Letecia has been in this business for 23 years. She earns more income from buying and selling rice.

Letecia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to build a house for her family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en: Mamie, 30, lives in Airport with her husband and four children. Her children are between the ages of 4 and 17. They attend school. Her husband is a contractor. He gave her the initial capital to start in this business. She has been selling rice, palm oil, pepper, onions, vita, and cooking oil for the past ten years. She likes to do this business because she makes a profit. With the profit generated from the business, she buys more goods and contributes to the expenses of the family. She is requesting a loan to purchase more pepper, onions, palm oil, vita, and rice to increase her sales. Her plan for the future is to build a house and educate her children,

loans.use: to purchase more pepper, onions, palm oil, vita, and rice to increase her sales.

loans.name: Esmeralda María

texts.es:
Esmeralda tiene 31 años de edad, es soltera y cuenta con 2 hijos dependientes, vive en casa de su familiares, ubicada en la zona urbana del distrito de Mochumi, cuenta con servicios de agua y luz.

La actividad que desarrolla es la venta de comida, bebidas, perfumería y cosméticos. Estas actividades las realiza desde hace 7 años, el negocio esta situado en su domicilio, en zona estratégica y con los ingresos que obtiene ayuda al sostenimiento de su hogar y solventa sus gastos personales.

Esmeralda se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 3000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de insumos para la preparación de comidas, compra de más cerveza, perfumería y cosméticos en general con los que piensa ampliar su negocio. Este negocio cuenta con competencia pero también cuenta con un amplio mercado para su comercialización.

Esta es la primera vez que Esmeralda solicita un crédito Kiva, ella agradece de antemano a las personas que le apoyen en esta ocasion.
texts.en:
Esmeralda is 31 years old, single and has two children who depend on her. She lives with her family, in the urban zone of the Mochumi district.  They have water and electricity. 

She makes a living by selling food, drinks, perfumes and cosmetics. She has done this work for the past seven years. The business is located in her house, a strategic area. With the profits she earns, she maintains the home and her personal expenses.

Esmeralda is asking Edpyme Alternativafor a 3,000 PEN [$1,175] loan. She intends to buy ingredients to prepare food, buy more beer, perfume and general cosmetics with which she plans on expanding her business. This business has competition but there is also a large market for growth. 

This is the first time Esmeralda is requesting a loan from Kiva. She would like to thank in advance anyone who gives her support.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to prepare food, buy more beer, perfumes and cosmetics in order to expand her business.

loans.name: Imelda Del Carmen

texts.es:
Imelda, Se decidió por un préstamo para continuar invirtiendo en el negocio, comprándose tomates, repollo, carne, harina y leña, entre otros productos que le resulten útiles para el mejor funcionamiento del negocio.
Con el préstamo anterior tuvo un efecto positivo, le ayudo a incrementar el inventario, teniendo lo necesario para agradar a los clientes, con esto ha logrado tener mejores ingresos, sus condiciones económicas han mejorado y en su familia el número de miembros se mantiene.
texts.en:
Imelda decided to get a loan to continue investing in her business, by buying tomatoes, cabbage, meat, flour and firewood, among other products that are useful for her business to function better. 

She had positive results with her previous loan. It helped her to increase her inventory to have what the clients need. With this she has better earnings, her economic situation has improved. Her family is the same size as it had been with the previous loan.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, cabbage, meat, flour and firewood.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda, 64 years old, is married and has four children. She works hard to provide for her family. For the past 15 years, Linda has operated a general store in the Philippines. She also earns an income from food vending.

Linda has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy items such as shampoo, canned goods, groceries, etc. to sell in her general store. Linda has previously borrowed and repaid 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Liza

texts.en: Liza, 42 years old, is married and has six children, four of them in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past 8 years, Liza has operated a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell. In the future, Liza would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Herena Carolina

texts.es: Herena Carolina de treintas años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida Ángel y sus hijos, ella posee una tienda donde vende productos de primera necesidad, frijoles, arroz, pan, producto instantáneo, jabón, entre otros, tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado experiencia valiosa en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, el negocio esta ubicado en su vivienda y es muy conocido, tiene mucha clientela pues las personas la prefieren porque todo lo que comercia es de primera calidad y a precios accesibles además  del servicio inigualable siempre a la orden de los clientes; Herena es una mujer enérgica, trabajadora, y con muchas metas por delante, esta dispuesta a esforzarse al máximo pues sabe que solo así podrá cumplir sus sueños y llegar al éxito, como toda buena comerciante quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar nuevas inversiones pero no posee de suficiente capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, pan, golosinas, producto instantáneo, bebidas, jabones, etc. Herena Carolina tiene buenas referencias de pago y se siente satisfecha con la ayuda, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene fe que podrá llevar a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Herena Carolina is 30 years old, and lives with her life partner, Ángel, and their children. She has a store where she sells basic household necessities, such as beans, rice, bread, instant products, soap and other items. 

She has several years with the business, and that has given her valuable experience in sales, which allows her to obtain better earnings. The business is located in her home, and is very well known. She has a large clientele, as people prefer her because everything she sells is top quality and affordable. In addition to the unequaled service, she is always at the service of her customers. 

Herena is an energetic, hard-working woman with many goals for the future. She is ready to do her very best, as she knows that only in this way will she be able to fulfill her dreams and achieve success.

As every good business person does, she wants to see her business grow and also wants to undertake new investments. But she doesn't have sufficient working capital and that is why she is applying to Integral for a loan that will allow her to buy staple grains, bread, candy, instant products, drinks, soaps, etc. 

Herena Carolina has good payment references and is happy about the help she is getting. She is confident that she will be able to pay off the debt, and at the same time has faith that she will be able to bring financial security to her household.

loans.use: To buy staple grains, bread, candy, instant products, drinks, and soaps.

loans.name: Rosa Margarita

texts.es:
Rosa, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo, ya que quiere invertir nuevamente en el negocio, ella surtirá la tienda de productos variados como granos básicos, arroz, frijoles, azúcar, tambien pastas, papel higiénico, entre otros.
Con el préstamo anterior considera que le ayudo a mejorar sus inventarios y obtener mejores  ingresos por sus ventas, sus condiciones económicas se mantenido estables en su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa has decided to take out a new loan because she wants to invest in her business again. She will stock her store with various products including staple grains, rice, beans, sugar, pasta and toilet paper, among other items. 

She considered the previous loan helpful as it helped her to improve her inventory and obtain better earnings for her sales. She has maintained the stability of her family's economic situation.

loans.use: to buy staple grains, rice, beans and sugar.

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita is 50 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by fattening pigs in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 30000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Pacita has been fattening pigs for 2 years and also earns additional income from tailoring.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Sophen

texts.en: Sophen is 30 years old. She is married and lives with one child in Kandal Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than three years, earning approximately 5 USD per day. Her husband (who is joining her in the picture) is a driver who earns about 6 USD daily. In order to improve her family’s finances, Sophen is requesting a loan of 1,500 USD to purchase piglets to breed and resell when they gain weight. By doing so, she would earn more income for her family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and send her child to a good school. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase piglets to breed and resell when they gain weight

loans.name: Verna

texts.en: Verna, 42 years old, is a married entrepreneur of Magsaysay, Pana-on with 3 children and is earning a living from her transport service business. It has continued for almost 2 years now and she earns 4,000 PHP a month. To improve her business, she is borrowing the amount of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC microcredit which she just joined recently to obtain accessories and tires. Before long, she’s hopeful of the possibility of expanding her business.

loans.use: to obtain accessories and tires.

loans.name: Relinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Relinda works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling nipa, the woven palm mats used for house construction and repair, in the Philippines. Relinda is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy more stock to sell for her business.

Relinda has sustained her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of nipa to sell.

loans.name: Sophat

texts.en: Sophat is 55 years old. She is married and resides with a son in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in cultivating rice and fattening up animals for more than ten years, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband (who is joining her in the picture) sells round baskets, flat baskets, and a kind of two-handled basket open at one end made of straw or slivers of bamboo. He earns about $4 each day. Her son is employed in a garment factory and earns about $3 daily. In order to improve her family’s livelihood, Sophat is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase a cow to breed and produce a calf to sell. By doing so, she would earn more income to support the family financially. In the future, she would like to expand her business and rebuild her house to make it more comfortable for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a cow to breed and produce a calf to sell

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
Sabina es separada y tiene tres hijos que están en etapa escolar, vive en la casa de su papa donde cuenta con tres ambientes donde se encuentra el dormitorio, la cocina y la tienda, las habitaciones son de adobe y el piso de cemento, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona de Villa Adela de la ciudad de El Alto, donde hay centros educativos y centros médicos.
Actualmente tiene una tienda que funciona en el mismo domicilio; esta se encuentra en Villa Adela y al lado de centros deportivos que en cada fin de semana, viernes, sábado y domingo se llena de niños, adolescentes y personas mayores a practicar deporte. El esposo le da asistencia familiar  y colabora en el pago de la vestimenta y educación de sus hijos.
El crédito lo requiere para refacción de su vivienda; colocado de techos, de canaletas, y   así mejorar su calidad de vida.
El sueño de Sabina es poder tener más capital para su tienda y así tener mejor ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO Y KIVA.
texts.en:
Sabina is separated from her spouse and has three children who are of school age. She lives at her father’s house that has three spaces set aside for the bedroom, the kitchen, and her store. The rooms are made of adobe and have cement floors. This house is located in the District of Villa Adela in the city of El Alto, which has many schools and health clinics.

Sabina currently has a store that she operates out of her home. It is located in Villa Adela next to some athletic fields where activities are held every Friday, Saturday, and Sunday. The place is full of children, teenagers, and adults playing sports. Sabina’s husband provides financial support and helps with the cost of clothing and education for their children.

The loan she is requesting will be used for renovations to her home. She will repair the roof and install storm gutters so that she can improve her quality of life. Sabina dreams of having more capital for her store so that she can generate more income and improve her standard of living.

This is the first time she has requested a loan from IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to repair the roof and to install storm gutters for her home.

loans.name: Elsy Yanira

texts.es:
Elsy, se decidió por continuar trabajando con préstamo, debido a la necesidad de invertir en el negocio, ya que a través de los prestamos ha logrado mantenerse en su ventas, ella se comprara ropa para niños, niñas, adultos, lociones para ambos sexos,  esta mercadería le servirá para  mantenerse.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a incrementar sus inventarios y de la misma manera a tener mejores ingresos, sus condiciones está progresando, solamente a enfrentado algunos problemas de salud.
texts.en:
Elsy has decided to continue working with loans, due to the need to invest in the business. Through the loans, she has managed to keep her sales business going. She will buy clothing for children and adults, as well as lotions for both sexes. 

This merchandise will help her support herself. The previous loan helped her to increase her inventories, and in the same way to have better income. Her circumstances are improving, only she is facing a few health problems.

loans.use: To buy clothing for children and adults, as well as lotions for both sexes.

loans.name: Ritchel

texts.en:
Ritchel is 26 years old and single, and she works hard to support her parents.

She has a general store business in the Philippines.  She also earns additional income from food vending.  Ritchel is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock like canned goods, soft drinks, and soap to sell in her general store business.

Ritchel has sustained her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock like canned goods, soft drinks, and soap to sell in her general store

loans.name: La Alegría Group

texts.es:
El comité La Alegría es de la ciudad de San Lorenzo son 13 integrantes  muy responsables en su pago y quienes se esfuerzan por ir creciendo. Todas son  muy responsables y trabajadoras se reúnen siempre para resolver cualquier problema del grupo y también ayudan a su comunidad.
Virginia, comenta que se dedica a la venta de asaditos (Churrasco) y que tiene un buen producto, por lo que ya tiene también buena clientela. Gracias a su esfuerzo está saliendo adelante y en esto también la ayudan sus amigas del grupo.
Solicita de este crédito para poder comprar carne, condimentos, mandioca y palitos de brochet, para seguir con sus ventas.
texts.en:
The committee known as “La Alegría” (The Joy) is in the city of San Lorenzo and has 13 members who are very responsible with their payments and strive to keep growing. Since they are responsible and hardworking, the members always gather together to resolve any problems within their group and help out in their community.

Virginia says that she sells barbecue and offers a good product. For this reason, she has accumulated a good clientele. Thanks to her efforts, she has been able to move forward and also assist her friends in the group.

Virginia is requesting a loan so that she can buy meat, condiments, manioc, and barbecue skewers so that she can continue with her sales.

loans.use: to buy meat, condiments, manioc, and barbecue skewers.

loans.name: Andres

texts.es:
Andrés de 43 años, casado con Paulina de 51 años, como producto de su relación tienen a Marco su pequeño hijo de 9 años, y juntos comparten sus vivencias familiares en una casa alquilada hecha con madera. Considerado como un hombre confiable por sus vecinos y amigos, Andrés es conocido como mecánico en su comunidad. Se desempeña desde hace 20 años en un taller cuyo local lo alquila y se ubica en la entrada de su localidad. Al notar una buena demanda de vehículos logró con el tiempo contar con el apoyo de un ayudante quien es su mano derecha en todos los quehaceres y tareas. Nos cuenta además, que desde niño siempre tuvo el gusto por desarmar sus juguetes y el de sus amigos y es donde inicia su noción para la mecánica, es así que desempeñó sus estudios menores fuera de su ciudad el cual le bastaron para tener todas las conocimientos y posteriormente retornar a su ciudad para ser parte del sector comercial.
Tiene el deseo de realizar un viaje a la capital en donde plena realizar la compra de nuevas y mejores herramientas con el objetivo de lograr desempañar su trabajo de manera mas fluida para beneficio de sus clientes.
Este viene a ser su quinto crédito con MFP, agradece desde siempre por la confianza que le brindaron, se caracteriza por ser una persona cumplida con sus pagos. Comenta que le agrada mucho la manera en como trabaja con su banco comunal debido a que son muy ordenados y existe un compañerismo mutuo.
Con los 1,000 nuevos soles realizará la compra de herramientas para desempeñar sus labores con mas fluidez y de manera óptima.
texts.en:
Andrés, 43, is married to Paulina, 51.  Together they have a son, Marco, who is 9 years old.  They share their family experiences in a rented house made of wood.  Considered to be a reliable man by his friends and neighbors, Andrés is a well-known mechanic in his community.  He has been doing this work for 10 years in a rented workshop, located at the entrance to his town.  

Noting a strong demand for car repairs, he managed over time to hire an assistant who is his right hand in all of his work and tasks.  Also, he tells us that ever since he was a child, he enjoyed taking apart his toys and those of his friends, and this is where he got the idea of becoming a mechanic.  He studied outside the city, until he had sufficient training to return to the city and become part of the city's commercial sector.

He wants to make a trip to the capital where he could buy some new and better tools, with the objective of being able to perform his work more smoothly for the benefit of his customers.  

This will be his 5th loan with MFP, and as always, he appreciates the trust being place in him.  He is known to be a person who is responsible with his payments.  He comments that he really appreciates the way his communal bank works, because they are very organized and there is a mutual sense of camaraderie.  With the 1,000 Peruvian soles he requests, he will buy tools so that he can perform his work more smoothly and in an optimal manner.

loans.use: to buy more tools

loans.name: Jaqueline Elizabeth

texts.es:
Jacqueline  tiene 29 años de edad, casada, originaria de Estelí, de oficio comerciante, ella se dedica a la venta de ropas y accesorios, el cual ha sido su único negocio, ya que su esposo la motivo tener un fondo extra,  con ese dinero logro poner la venta de ropa  en su  casa. También cuenta con otros ingresos como es su salario de profesora de primaria.
Jacqueline solicita el préstamo para invertir y  comprar  ropa como blusas, pantalones, camisetas y juguetes. Se acercan la época navideña, donde las ventas de estos productos son muy buscado y no quiere perder la oportunidad de vender. De esta manera poder  mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia. Su meta futura es poder llegar a sacar su carrera para ser una persona mejor preparada, tener mejores oportunidades de trabajos para obtener mayores ingresos en su negocio.
texts.en:
Jacqueline is 29 years old, married, and originally from Estelí. She is a merchant who sells clothing and accessories. This is her only business. Her husband convinced her to generate some extra income. With the money she earned, Jacqueline was able to open a clothing store in her home. She also earns a salary working as an elementary school teacher.

Jacqueline is requesting a loan so that she can invest in the purchase of clothing such as blouses, trousers, T-shirts, as well as toys. With the Christmas season approaching, she does not want to miss out on the opportunity to sell products that are in high demand. This will enable her to improve her family’s standard of living.

Her future goal is to earn her degree so that she can become a well-prepared individual and have better work opportunities for earning more income for her business.

loans.use: to buy blouses, trousers, T-shirts, as well as toys.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en: Lucia is from Villalin, Pana-on, Misamis Occidental. She is 51 years old. Lucia is married and has 4 children. To make a living, Lucia owns and operates a business selling snack foods like banana cue to the local community. Lucia has been engaged in her business for 9 years and earns 4,200 PHP a month from these activities. In 2008, Lucia joined GDMPC. Lucia is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make her products. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make her products.

loans.name: Maria Elemena

texts.es:
La Señora María de 52 años, vive con su conyugue en casa de habitación en la comunidad de alto de la flor, en la zona sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace 10 años a su venta de arroz, frijoles, huevos, carne, embutidos, productos alimenticios, abarrotería en general, sus clientes son todas las personas que transitan por su negocio el cual esta ubicado en su casa de habitación.
Doña María esta solicitando 15,000.00 lempiras para compra de productos alimenticios como ser arroz, frijoles, huevos, jabón de baño, manteca, lácteos, maíz, embutidos, lácteos y otros productos de consumo básico ya que su clientela ha aumentado y necesita variedad de productos, Con el apoyo de este préstamo pretende tener bien surtido y obtener mas ganancias 
Doña María su sueño es mejorar su casa de habitación.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Octubre  del 2012.
texts.en:
Maria is 52 years old, she lives together with her husband in a home in the town of Altos de la Flor, in the south of Honduras. She has worked for 10 years selling rice,  beans, meats, foodstuffs, and general grocery items. Her customers are all the people who travel near her business which she runs out of her home. 

Maria is requesting 15,000.00 lempiras in order to purchase inventory items such as rice, beans, eggs, bath soap, butter, dairy products, corn, meats, and other basic consumer goods because her customer base has grown and she needs to provide a variety of goods. With the assistance from this loan she hopes to be able to provide a greater variety and obtain greater income. 

Maria's goal is to improve her home
San Lorenzo, Honduras - October of 2012.

loans.use: to purchase rice, beans, eggs, bath soaps, butter, dairy products, corn, meats, and other basic consumer goods for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers and pay for manual labor.

loans.name: Bibiana

texts.en:
Bibiana is married and a mother of six children, ages 4 to 21. They live in San Miguel, Bohol. She is engaged in buying and selling peanuts to the people in her area. This is her only source of income. Bibiana buys peanuts from the farm and sells it to the market.
Bibiana is asking for a loan to buy additional peanuts to sell, and food and clothing for the family. Through this, she will be able to increase her income and provide the basic needs for her family.
In the future, Bibiana dreams of making her business a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy additional peanuts to sell and food and clothing for the family.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en: Narcisa, 39, is married and has four children. She resides in Jimenez, Misamis, Occidental, Philippines. Narcisa owns and operates a vegetable gardening business to earn a living. She has been in this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns PHP 4,000 from her business. Narcisa has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase fertilizer. Narcisa has been a member of GDMPC for almost a year. In the future, she wants to make improvements on her house and to have her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 42 years old and married with eight children.

Virginia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, soft drinks and soap to sell in her general store.

Virginia has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from raising livestock.

Virginia aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, canned goods, soft drinks and soap to sell in her general store

loans.name: Recel

texts.en: Recel, 20, is single and lives in San Juan, Pana-on. Recel operates a retail store, selling a variety of products to local community members to earn a living. He has been doing this for two years and every month he earns PHP 5,000. He has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase new items such as candies, milo, shampoo and soaps. Recently, Recel joined GDMPC. Recel hopes to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase new items such as candies, milo, shampoo and soaps.

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en: Teddy's main source of income is his banana production business. He is 35 years old, married and has three children. He is from San Juan, Pana-on. Teddy has been in business for three years and earns PHP 3,200 a month. Recently, Teddy joined GDMPC. Teddy is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Bonswendtelgo Group

texts.fr:
Mme AMINATA est responsable du  groupe BONSWENDTELGO.  Mariée, elle est mère de 02 enfants. Le plus âgé a 11ans et le moins âgé a 07ans. Deux(02) vont à l’école et elle a deux (02) personnes  en charge.
Mme vend de gâteaux et pagnes depuis 03 ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les boutiques environnantes. Ses clients sont les boutiquiers (hommes et femmes).
Elle veut s’acheter  02 sacs de farine,  02 bidons d’huile un sac de sucre et 05 complet de pagnes.
Elle  épargne ses bénéfices. Mme ambitionne améliorer son activité et aider son mari pour les charges de la famille.
texts.en:
Aminata is in charge of the Bonswendtelgo group. She is married and mother to two children. The eldest is 11 years old and the youngest seven. They both go to school and Aminata has two dependents. 

She has been selling cakes and "pagnes" (pieces of colorful fabric) for the past three years. She gets her supplies in the surrounding shops. Her customers are shopkeepers (men and women).

She wants to buy for herself two sacks of flour, two containers of oil, a bag of sugar and five sets of "pagnes".

Aminata saves her profits and her ambition is to improve her business and help her husband out with the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy for herself two sacks of flour, two containers of oil, a sack of sugar and five set of "pagnes".

loans.name: Lamo's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été formé le 22 décembre 2009. Il est composé de 29 femmes membres ayant une bonne entente. Elles pratiquent la même activité qu'est le petit commerce. 

Debout à droite de la photo et levant la main, la vedette Bousso est âgée de 38 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 5 garçons et une fille. 

Son prêt reçu, elle va acheter du mil avec une partie et avec l'autre 2 à 3 moutons qu'elle élève pour revendre après un certain temps. 

Avec les bénéfices générés, elle renforce ses épargnes avec une partie et l'autre améliore les conditions de vie de sa progéniture.
texts.en:
This group was formed on December 22, 2009. It is made up of 29 women who get along well. They all work in small business.

Standing up at the right of the photo and raising her hand, the leader Bousso is 38 years old. She is married and mother of 5 boys and a girl.

After receiving her loan, she is going to buy millet with one part and with the other, two or three sheep, which she will raise and resell after a period of time.

With the profits generated, she will strengthen her savings with one part, and with the other, improve the living conditions of her children.

loans.use: to buy millet and sheep to resell.

loans.name: Nogaye's Group

texts.fr:
Le Banc Villageois a été crée depuis le 29 Décembre 2009 . Les membres ont une parfaite entente et habitent la commune. Leur activité est le petit commerce.

Assise à droite de la photo levant la main et habillée en jaune , Ndiaya la vedette est âgée de 49 ans  elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants dont 2 garçons .

Avec le prêt reçu , elle achète 2 à 3 futs de 100 kg d'arachide à 23000 francs le fut,2 sacs de mais à 8000 francs le sac . 

Avec les bénéfices générés elle améliore son cadre de vie , renforce ses épargnes et son activité et assure le bien être familial de sa progéniture.
texts.en:
The banc villageois was created on December 29, 2009. The members are on good terms [with each other] and live in the same area. Their business is small-scale commerce.

Ndiaya, the featured borrower, is seated on the right in the photo with her hand raised and wearing yellow. She is 49 years old, married, and a mother of 5 children, including 2 boys.

With this loan, she is going to buy 2 to 3, 100 kilogram barrels of groundnuts at 23,000 francs per barrel and 2 sacs of corn at 8,000 francs per sac. 

With the earned profits, Ndiaya is going to improve her quality of life, increase her savings and strengthen her business, and ensure the well-being of her children.

loans.use: to buy groundnuts and corn

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr:
Madame Fatoumata  est âgée de 46 ans, marié et mère de quatre  enfants. Elle réside avec son conjoint famille monogame à Torakabougou, un des quartiers de la ville de Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Après une formation en santé, Fatoumata s’est vite initiée aux activités d’achat de vente de produits pharmaceutiques depuis plus de vingt  ans. Avec une telle expérience dans ce domaine, elle jouit d’une forte réputation. Après 2 prêts individuels tous correctement remboursés, elle est à son troisième prêt qui sera utiliser pour acheter 15 cartons de produits contre le paludisme, 9 cartons produits contre les maladies respiratoires et  5 cartons d’antibiotiques. 
Sa source d'approvisionnement principale est à Bamako (capitale du Mali). Elle effectue ses ventes dans sa pharmacie à Bougouni à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, en détail et au comptant. 
Avec ce  nouveau prêt, elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 150.000 FCFA. Avec ce bénéfice réalisé, elle compte résoudre l’essentielle de ses dépenses, celles de sa famille, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Fatoumata  is 46 years old, married and the mother of four children. She lives with her husband (and is his only wife) in Torakabougou, a district of the city of Bougouni (the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). After training in healthcare, Fatoumata soon began buying and selling pharmaceutical products, and she has been doing this for more than twenty years. With such a lot of experience in this activity, she enjoys a great reputation.
Following two individual loans (both fully repaid), she is seeking her third loan - which will be used to purchase 15 boxes of anti-malarials, 9 boxes of medicine for respiratory problems, and 5 boxes of antibiotics. Her main supplier is in Bamako (the capital city of Mali).
She sells the products retail and for cash, from her pharmacy in Bougouni, to a customer base of both men and women.
With this new loan, she intends to generate a monthly profit of 150,000 FCFA. With these profits, she plans to cover her essential outgoings and those of her family, to pay the loan interest and to invest the remainder in her business.

loans.use: to purchase medicines.

loans.name: Amahoriwacu Group

texts.fr:
Thérèse fait partie du groupe Amahoriwacu et habite à Gitega. Elle a 39 ans et est mariée à Pierre commerçant et éleveur de poules. Ensemble ils avaient  3 enfants mais ils les ont perdus.

Elle fait le commerce de boutique (haricot, riz, sel,…) depuis  19 ans.

C’est son premier  crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va augmenter son capital et acheter des  souliers comme un nouveau  produit, à revendre, pour gagner plus.

Grâce  au gain de son commerce, elle satisfait les besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Thérèse is a member of the Amahoriwacu group and lives in Gitega. She is 39 years old and is married to Pierre - a trader and chicken farmer. They had 3 children together but they lost them all. 
She has been a shopkeeper (selling beans, rice, salt, etc) for 19 years. This is her first loan with Turame. With the KIVA credit she is seeking, she will increase her working capital and will buy shoes to sell, as a new product, in order to earn more income. 
Thanks to the profits of her business, she meets the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase shoes to sell as a new product, to increase her income.

loans.name: La Rose Group

texts.fr: La cliente Vunabandi  est la doyenne et représentante du collectif de crédit  « La Rose ». Cette cliente est véritable  un entrepreneur,  créatrice d’emploi, courageuse de son état, âgée de 57 ans, déplacée de guerre et qui s’est déjà intégrée dans la ville. Elle est mariée et mère de 12 enfants et plusieurs petits fils. Son mari est sans emploi officiel, toute fois, il est notable et membre d’un caucus de sages  des déplacés  de guerre ressortissant de territoire de Bwito-Rutshuru. La cliente en vedette est productrice et vendeuse de vin de canne à sucres qu’elle produit avec une technologie locale. Elle a commencé cette activité avec son fonds propre. Elle fut initiée par un ouvrier d’une congrégation de sœurs religieuses catholiques. Alors, elle donna à son formateur un cadeau d’un casier de boisson  Mutzig et une chèvre en titre de payement.  Cependant, elle vient de bénéficier son sixième crédit auprès de l’IMF Hekima. La cliente est plein d’espoir dans son activité. Ce nouveau prêt doit lui servir de s’approvisionner avec  des cannes a sucres,  des bois de chauffages, payer la main d’œuvre, la scolarité, etc. Elle remercie l’IMF Hekima pour cette initiative de soutien à l’entreprenariat féminin. Grâce à ce crédit, elle va améliorer son capital et  subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Vunabandi is the senior member and the representative of the "La Rose" mutual loan group. She is a genuine entrepreneur, a courageous job creator - 57 years old and a war refugee, she has already integrated herself into the town.
She is married and the mother of 12 children, and a grandmother several times over. Her husband has no official work, nonetheless he is noteworthy and is a member of a group of refugee elders coming from the Bwito-Rutshuru territory.
Vunabandi is a producer and seller of sugar cane wine, which she produces using local methods. She started the business with her own funds. She learned the craft from a worker in a congregation of catholic nuns; she gave her teacher a gift of a case of Mutzig (beer) and a goat in payment.
She has just received her sixth loan from the Hekima MFI. She is full of hope for her business. 
This new loan will allow her to buy sugar cane and firewood, to pay for labour and school fees, etc. She thanks Hekima for this initiative supporting women entrepreneurs.
Thanks to this loan, she will improve her capital resources and cover her family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase sugar cane and firewood, and to pay for manual labour and school fees, etc.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a stove.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase chemical fertilisers and to pay workers.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Achat des engrais chimiques et paiement des ouvriers.

loans.name: Leonardo Ernesto

texts.es:
Leonardo tiene 42 años de edad, vive en casa propia, junto a su madre, no está casado y no posee hijos, convive en el mismo terreno junto a dos hermanos cada uno en su vivienda construidas sobre el terreno que les heredó su papá.

Se dedica a trabajar como agricultor,  ya que es una tradición familiar, cultiva maíz, maicillo, yuca. Sus cosechas son buenas, están ubicadas las áreas del volcán Chaparrastique. 

Los insumos agrícolas los compra en la ciudad que esta, aproximadamente a 3 kilómetros, los que recorre  en buses del transporte público. Las cosechas las comercializa con comerciantes mayoristas y en el mercado municipal.

El préstamo será invertido para comprar una vaca, con el objetivo de aprovechar los residuos y rastrojos de las cosechas, con lo que mejorará la dieta alimenticia familiar al proveerles de leche y queso.

Su propósito, es comprar ganado bovino y dedicarse a la producción de leche y comercializarla en la comunidad donde reside, y ampliarse en el cultivo de maíz y hortalizas.
texts.en:
Leonardo, 42, lives in his own home with his mother.  He is single and has no children, and lives near his two siblings.  They all have homes built on the land they inherited from their father.  Leonardo is a farmer, which is the family tradition, and grows corn, sorghum and yucca.  He enjoys good harvests where he is located, around the Chaparrastique volcano.

He buys farm supplies in a city about three kilometers away and uses a public transport bus to get there.  He sells his produce to wholesale merchants in the municipal market.

The loan will be used to buy a cow to take advantage of the harvest waste and stubble.  The family diet will improve with a supply of milk and cheese.

His goal is to buy cattle to produce milk and sell it in his community, and also expand his corn and vegetable crop growing.

loans.use: To buy a cow.

loans.name: Timoteo Aparicio

texts.es:
Timoteo, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para la compra de mas capital de trabajo, como lo es abono y herbicidas, ya que se dispone a la siembra de maíz y frijol, esto ayudara para que Timoteo pueda comenzar un nuevo cultivo.
Con el préstamo anterior logro comprar insumos agrícolas, con la cosecha ha podido ayudar a su familia, con ello todas las condiciones en su hogar se han mantenido.
texts.en:
Timoteo is requesting a new loan to buy more work supplies such as fertilizer and herbicides since he is about to start planting corn and beans.  This will help him begin the new crop season.

With a previous loan he bought farm supplies and was able maintain the family living conditions with the income from the harvest.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and herbicides.

loans.name: Edith Del Carmen

texts.es:
Edith, solicita un nuevo préstamo, esto debido a la necesidad de invertir en el negocio, ya que quiere comprarse maíz, leña, aceite, quesillo, chicharrones, que son los materiales necesarios para la elaboración de tortillas y tambien elabora pupusas.
Con el préstamo anterior logro fortalecer el negocio y con las ganancias pudo ayudar a su familia, hasta el momento sus circunstancias se han mantenido.
texts.en:
Edith is requesting a new loan for her business, since she needs to buy corn, firewood, oil, cheese and pork rinds in order to make tortillas and pupusas (stuffed tortillas).

With the previous loan she was able to strengthen her business and maintain her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy corn, firewood, oil, cheese, and pork rinds.

loans.name: Gladys Ricarda

texts.es: Gladys Ricarda de 49 anos de edad de la localidad de León. León se caracteriza por ser una zona comercial turística, con gente trabajadora, amable, acogedora. Gladys tiene   dos hijos de 25,17 anos los cuales están estudiando en la universidad.  La Sra. Tiene por actividad económica la venta de granos básico como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, maíz, detergente, jabón. El negocio esta ubicado en un lugar especifico de su localidad. El negocio surgió hace muchos anos por la necesidad de tener una fuente de ingresos para los gastos de la casa. El financiamiento lo necesita par invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio con granos básicos. Ya que se acercan la mejor temporada como son los meses de Noviembre y Diciembre. Gladys Ricarda agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua.
texts.en:
Gladys Ricards, 49, lives in the town of León, which is known for its tourism and hard-working, kind, welcoming people.  Gladys has two children, ages 25 and 17 who are university students.  She sells basic need items such as rice, beans, sugar, oil, corn, detergent and soap.  

Her store is in a strategic location.  She started the business many years ago in order to earn extra income to cover household expenses.  She is in need of a loan to use as working capital and to stock her business with basic items for the months of November and December, when demand is at a high.  Gladys Ricarda is grateful for the support from Kiva lenders who help low-income populations in poor countries such as Nicaragua.

loans.use: To buy basic items such as rice, beans, sugar, oil, corn, detergent and soap.

loans.name: Sandra Patricia

texts.es:
Sandra, quiere surtir mas el negocio de las ventas de enchape de oro, tambien al venta de ropa y cosméticos de revistas, además zapatos, este préstamo será un aporte importante con los adquirirá lociones, cadenas, pulseras, aretes ropa nueva, zapatos.
Ella tuvo un efecto positivo con el préstamo anterior, comprándose artículos del negocio, ella trabaja a través de pedidos. En su familia su han mantenido las condiciones, su deseo es tener un local propio y tener mas mercadería para ofrecer.
texts.en:
Sandra wants to stock her gold plate  business more and also sell clothes, catalog cosmetics as well as shoes. This loan will be an important contribution. With it, she will acquire lotions, chains, bracelets, earrings, new clothes and shoes.

She saw a positive effect with the previous loan by buying items for her business. She works via orders. In her family the living conditions have been maintained. She wants to have her own locale and have more merchandise to sell.

loans.use: to buy lotions, chains, bracelets, earrings, new clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Olga Esperanza

texts.es:
La señora Olga tiene 58 años de edad, es casada y tiene cuatro hijos. Ella se dedica a la agricultura desde que era muy pequeña, lo aprendió de su padre, vive junto a su esposo quien le ayuda a cultivar 14,000 metros cuadrados de maíz, además se dedica al comercio de productos de primera necesidad. Ella junto a su esposo se levantan  a las 4:30 a.m. a ordeñar las vacas y posteriormente se dirige a la milpa hasta las 9:00 a.m. su esposo continua trabajando y ella retorna a su casa para abrir la pequeña tienda. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar insumos agrícolas para el cultivo de maíz.  De esta manera, ella obtendrá alimento para sus vacas y que estas le produzcan leche. Su objetivo, es adquirir mercadería para tener mas surtida la tienda y comprar dos vacas mas.
texts.en:
Olga is 58 years old. She is married and has four children. She has been a farmer since she was very small, learning it from her father. She lives with her husband, who helps her cultivate 14,000 square meters of corn. She also is a merchant, selling basic necessity products. With her husband she gets up at 4:30 a.m. to milk cows and then goes out to the corn until 9:00 a.m. Her husband keeps working and she goes home to open her little store.  

The loan she is asking Fundación Campo for is to buy agricultural materials to grow corn. This way, she will have feed for her cows and they will produce milk. Her objective is to acquire merchandise so she can stock her store more and buy two more cows.

loans.use: to buy agricultural materials to grow corn.

loans.name: Ana Irma

texts.es: Ana Irma de treinta y tres años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus hijos; ella se dedica a la venta de productos por catalogo cosméticos, cremas, perfumes entre otros, su negocio esta ubicado en el lugar de su residencia en una zona muy  frecuentada además comercia también de forma ambulante, tiene muchos años de experiencia ventas y eso le permite obtener muy buenas ganancias, es muy conocida en toda la zona ya tiene mucha clientela pues las personas la prefieren por la calidad, el buen servicio pero sobre todo por los precios accesibles; Ana Irma es una mujer activa, trabajadora y muy luchadora desea alcanzar cada uno de sus sueños porque para ella su vida es una lucha constante en el camino donde se abrirá puertas al éxito; una de sus mayores metas es acrecentar el negocio y ahora que aumento la demanda quiere aprovechar para la inversión pero necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar cosméticos, cremas, perfumes etc. Ana Irma tiene buenas referencias de pago, tiene la certeza que podrá cancelar la deuda en el periodo establecido y a la vez podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Ana Irma is thirty three years old. She lives with her life's companion and with her children. She sells catalog cosmetic products such as creams and prefume, among others. Her business is located in her residence in an area that has a lot of customer traffic. She also sells door to door. She has many years experience in sales and this allows her to earn good profit. She is well known in the area since a lot of people prefer her for the quality, good service, and above all accessible prices. Ana Irma is an active, hardworking woman who is a fighter. She would like to make all of her dreams come true because for her life is a constant struggle on the raod where doors to success will open. One of her biggest goals is to grow her business and now demand has gone up. She wants to take advantage of this investment but she needs capital. That is why she has asked INTEGRAL for a loan that will allow her to buy cosmetics, creams, perfumes, etc. Ana Irma has good payment references and is certain she will be able to pay off the debt on time and at the same time give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, creams, and perfumes.

loans.name: Danny

texts.en:
Danny is married, with 1 child to take care of, and he is 40 years old, residing in San Juan, Pana-on.

Danny raises crops for a living, planting and harvesting bananas for sale in the local community.  He has been in this business for 3 years.  Each month, he earns PHP 5,000 through this business.

He requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This year, Danny joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. In the future, Danny wants to save a reserve for future emergencies and to purchase additional farmland.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Las Mercedes De Katañiray Group

texts.es:
