Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LAS MERCEDES DE KATAÑIRAY”; Este banco se ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Ortencia ella es conviviente y tiene 52 años y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende diferentes tipos de productos como arroz,azucar,leche,golosinas,gaseosas entre otros, la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia trabaja en su negocio de lunes a domingo desde las 06:00am hasta las 09:00pm aproximadamente aunque este horario puede variar de acuerdo a las actividades que pueda tener en el dia,a la vez la socia se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza como cremas, perfumes, colonias  entre otros, la socia trabaja de forma independiente vendiendo a sus amistades, familiares y clientes, siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante  a su familia, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería como arroz y leche para su negocio.

Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de restaurante, crianza de animales menores, taxi, mecánica, platería,ganaderia,botica.

Las personas que salen en la foto adjunta son socias que pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members are part of the communal bank “LAS MERCEDES DE KATAÑIRAY”. This bank is located in the district of Cusco, in the Cusco province, which is in the Cusco region.

The member is Ortencia. She is 52 years old and has a partner. She has one child. She divides her time between her daily activities and her grocery store. She sells different types of products, including rice, sugar, sweets, soft drinks, etc. She has been running this business for many years and it is going well thanks to the hard work she puts in every day. She works in her business Monday to Sunday, from 06:00am to 09:00pm approximately, although her schedule can change depending on what is going on during the day. She also sells beauty products, such as creams, perfumes, colognes, etc. She does this work on an independent basis, selling to friends, family and customers. In this way she can make a better life for her family. She is a responsible and hardworking person who wants her family to do well. 

This member is requesting a loan to buy stock, such as rice and milk, for her business. 

The other members work in the restaurant business, rearing small animals, taxi service, mechanic services, silverwork, rearing livestock and pharmacy business.

The people in the smaller photo are members who asked permission to arrive late at the meeting because of work commitments.

Ortencia is grateful to those who are sharing her dream in this way. She is committed to making the payments according to the schedule.

loans.use: to buy stock, such as rice and milk, for her business

loans.name: Emmar

texts.en: Emmar is 22 years old and single. He is from Tonggo, Tudela. To make a living, Emmar grows bananas to sell, which he has been doing for 2 years. He earns 6,000 PHP a month. Emmar is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which he will use to obtain farm fertilizer. Emmar joined GDMPC this year. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to obtain farm fertilizers

loans.name: Virgenia

texts.en: Virgenia is a 57-year-old resident of Sinara Bajo, Jimenez. Virgenia provides for her 3 children from the small monthly earnings (PHP 6,000) of her piggery business.  She has been in the business for 7 years to supplement the income her husband earns.  Since 2008, she has been a member of GDMPC.  Virgenia applied for a loan of  PHP 10,000 from GDMPC to buy feeding supplies. Virgenia wants to expand her business one day.

loans.use: to buy feeding supplies

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of eight children, Betty works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling native products in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from vegetable vending. Betty is borrowing PHP 17000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of brooms, trays for vegetables and fruits, etc., to sell through her business.

Betty has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of brooms, trays for vegetables and fruits, etc., to sell

loans.name: Olga Amalia

texts.es: La Sra. Olga tiene 58 años y es viuda con hijos que ya son independientes, ella  se dedica al tejido de mantas, blusas, ropa de bebe y otras prendas artesanales que las vende de manera ambulante y también realiza a pedido, este préstamo es el Primero que tiene con la institución, la Sra. Olga va a usar este préstamo para la compra de variedad de lanas para el tejido de sus prendas ya que tiene pedidos que entregar y también para estas fiestas de fin de año ya que tiene mucha demanda,  Su razón para solicitar este préstamo es que la Sra. Olga necesita el dinero para la compra de este material que es imprescindible para sus tejidos,  ya que a fin de año incrementan las ventas y por ende sus ingresos, la Sra. Olga enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la cliente últimamente tiene problemas de salud, esto por estar todo el día tejiendo y sentada, le ha ocasionado problemas con la vista y con sus pulmones pero ya se está recuperando y utilizara los beneficios en seguir comprando insumos como lana, botones etc, para tejer prendas con lindos diseños aunque las prendas que hace son bien cotizadas debido a que su mano de obra es muy  bien calificada. Su deseo para su negocio es el de ayudar a sus hijas, enseñarles en oficio y la responsabilidad, dedicación y empeño con que se debe trabajar.
texts.en:
Olga, 58, is a widow with children who are already independent.  She makes a living weaving blankets, blouses, baby clothes, and other handmade garments she sells as a street vendor and on request.

This is Olga's first loan with the institution.  She's going to use it to buy a variety of wool for making her garments that are already ordered, and also for the coming end-of-the-year holidays because she has a lot of demand.  Olga's requesting this loan because she needs the money to buy the essential materials for her textiles.  At the end of the year sales increase and consequently, so does her income.  She'll use the profits to continue buying supplies such as wool, buttons, etc. to make garments with pretty designs.  The garments she makes are highly valued for the quality of her work. 

Olga faces challenges in her business such as health problems because she's seated and weaving all day.  This has given her problems with her eyes and her lungs, but she's recovering.

Her desire for her business is to help her children, to teach them a trade and the responsibility, dedication, and effort with which one should work.

loans.use: to buy wool wholesale for blankets, blouses, and baby clothes

loans.name: Sandra Lorena

texts.es:
Sandra, necesita otro credito para invertir en el negocio, que es la venta de productos en catalogo y revistas, se comprara lociones, maquillajes, labiales, accesorios, que se ofrecen en Esika y Avon.
Esto ayudara a que Sandra, mejore sus ventas, como el préstamo anterior le permitió pagar las facturas pendientes con las compañías y en su familia todo se mantiene igual, los ingresos que recibe de este negocio le han permitido comprar la alimentacion.
texts.en:
Sandra needs another loan to invest in her business selling catalogue products.  She'll buy lotion, make-up, lipstick, and accessories from Esika and Avon.

This will help Sandra improve her sales, as the previous loan allowed her to pay her pending business bills.  In her family everything is the same.  The income she receives from this business has allowed her to buy food.

loans.use: to buy lotion, make-up, lipstick, and accessories

loans.name: Ariunbold

texts.en: Ariunbold is 23 years old and lives with his parents and younger brother in their wooden house in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. He has been running a taxi business since 2008. Darkhan's parents are pensioners and his younger brother is 20 years old. Before the winter, his brother worked as a builder in Ulaanbaatar, the capital. But at the moment, his brother is at home and will not have a job again until next spring. Ariunbold is worried about his brother’s future. He says that working as a builder is not safe, and the salary is not enough to live on if his brother has a family, because of the seasonality of the work. So Ariunbold is planning to buy a used car that runs on gas, which his brother can use as a taxi. The loan he is taking out will be put towards the car so that his brother can improve his living conditions.

loans.use: buy a second hand car that his brother can use as a taxi

loans.name: Purita

texts.en:
For over five years, Purita, a 47-year-old married mother of four children, has made a living operating a general store that sells a variety of food and home-use products in Mialem, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She earns 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Purita joined GDMPC. She is now requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase new items such as candies, Milo, shampoo, soap, and so on. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items such as candies, Milo, shampoo, and soap.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
As the parent of five children, Elizabeth, a widow, works hard to support her family.

She has a general store in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from electronic re-loading and vegetable vending. Elizabeth is borrowing 27000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more shampoo, spices, noodles, eggs, and other items to sell in her general store business.

Elizabeth has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more shampoo, spices, noodles, eggs, and other items to sell.

loans.name: Simon

texts.es:
El socio pertence al banco comunal UNION ,FUERZA AMISTAD;el cual esta situado en el distrito de Cusco, provincia de Cusco.

El socio Simon continua con  su negocio de artesania,el socio trabaja de forma independiente distribuyendo su mercaderia a sus clientes que le solicitan como tiendas de turismo,el socio elabora zapatos artesanales el tiene un pequeño taller en su domicilio,ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio el cual le va bien siendo de esta forma que el socio saca adelante a su familia.


El socio solicita el credito para la compra de materiales como cuero y para algunos gastos personales.

El socio se siente agradecido por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member, Simon, belongs to Unión, Fuerza, Amistad Communal Bank, which is located in the Cusco district in the province of Cusco.  Simon continues with his crafts business.  He works independently, distributing his merchandise on request to his customers, such as tourist stores.

Simon makes handmade shoes.  He has a small workshop at home and has made a living with this business for several years.  It's going well for him, and he gets his family ahead with it.

He's requesting the loan to buy materials, such as leather, and for some personal expenses.

He's grateful for his loan and pledges to make his payments on time.

loans.use: to buy leather and to cover some personal expenses

loans.name: Sunny

texts.en: Sunny is 33 years old and separated with three kids. He is from Tonggo, Tudela in the Philippines. To make a living, Sunny grows bananas and coconuts to sell, which he has been doing for three years. He earns 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. Sunny is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which he will use to buy farm fertilizers. Sunny joined GDMPC this year. He plans to use the additional revenue that he generates to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to buy farm fertilizers

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: María de 35 años de edad, habita junto a su familia. Ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de  pupusas. Tiene muchos años de dedicarse a esta actividad por lo que ya cuenta con mucha experiencia y con muchos clientes fijos que cada día la prefieren más. Ella se caracteriza por ser una mujer emprendedora, responsable y muy trabajadora.  Cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales ya que para ella es muy importante que sus clientes estén satisfechos con el servicio que reciben  ya que solo de esta forma logrará mantenerlos contentos y  quedarán con ganas de regresar a su negocio.  Ella desea ampliar su negocio y es por eso que decidió solicitar un crédito a INTEGRAL e invirtiendo en la comprar de los insumos necesarios para la elaboración de pupusas como: frijoles, queso, arroz, maíz, chicharon, tomates, ayotes, repollo, etc.  Espera lograr una mayor preferencia y de esta forma aumentar sus ganancias y mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
María, 35, lives with her family.  She earns a living making and selling "pupusas" [stuffed tortillas].  She has been doing this work for many years, so she has a lot of experience and steady customers who prefer her more every day.  She's known as an enterprising, responsible, and very hardworking woman.  She has very good personal references because it's very important to her for her customers to be satisfied with the service they receive, because only this way will she be able to keep them happy and wanting to return to her business.

She wants to expand her business, so she decided to ask Integral for a loan to invest in buying the supplies she needs to make pupusas: beans, cheese, rice, corn, cracklings, squash, cabbage, etc.

She hopes to become a greater priority, to increase her profits and improve her quality of life and her family's.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for pupusas

loans.name: Diana Carolina

texts.es:
Diana, solicita un prestamo para poder invertir en el negocio, aprovechando la temporada, ella comprara ropa para niños blusas, trajes, ropa interior, tambien comprara ropa para adultos, esto le permitirá aumentar su negocio.
Ella manifiesta que el préstamo anterior le ayudo a crecer en mercadería, teniendo lo mas necesario, su situación económica se mantiene y su familia no ha aumentado en miembros.
texts.en:
Diana is requesting a loan to be able to invest in her business and make the most of the season.  She'll buy children's clothing: blouses, outfits, and underwear.  She'll also buy clothing for adults, which will allow her to expand her business.

She says that her first loan helped her to increase her merchandise and have everything she needed.  Her financial situation is stable and her family has not grown.

loans.use: to buy blouses, outfits, and underwear for children

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Srey is 23 years old. She is married and has one child. She and her family live in Takeo Province, Cambodia. 

Srey has been working in a garment factory for more than three years, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband is an excavator driver who earns about $5 daily. In order to improve her family’s finances, Srey is requesting a loan of $1,400 to purchase a cow to breed and sell its offspring. This purchase will help her earn more income to financially support the family. 

In the future, Srey would like to rebuild her house and send her child to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase a cow to breed and sell its offspring.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling fish in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell for her business.

Estrella has been in this business for 15 years. She earns additional income from motorcycle transport and vegetable farming.

Estrella has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Gaudiosa

texts.en:
Gaudiosa is 51 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Gaudiosa is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Gaudiosa has been raising pigs for three years and also earns additional income from dried-fish vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Polleak

texts.en:
Polleak is 33 years old. He is married and has two children. He and his family live with his parents in Takeo Province, Cambodia. He has been a singer at a restaurant for more than seven years, earning approximately $10 per day. His wife is employed in a garment factory. She earns about $4 each day. 

In order to improve his family’s livelihood, Polleak is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a tuk tuk (rickshaw) to run a taxi service. This purchase will enable him to generate more income for the family. 

In the future, Polleak would like to open a general store for his wife to run at home and send his children to school. Moreover, he hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase a tuk tuk (rickshaw) to run a taxi service.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida, a very hardworking mother of four children, is married to Romeo. She and her family live in the village of Santa Isabel in the province of Isabela. She dreams that someday she will be able to renovate their house and all her children can finish their studies.  

Adelaida is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy feed and piglets for her hog-raising business so that she can provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and piglets for her hog-raising business.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria, a 44-year-old  married mother of seven children, four of whom are in school, is a very hardworking entrepreneur. The operator of a fish-vending business in the Philippines for the past 10 years, she has requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell. Gloria would like to save enough money to build a house for her family in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Jayzalyn

texts.en:
Jayzalyn, a hardworking entrepreneur with a fruit-vending business in the Philippines, is requesting a loan of PHP 10000 through NWTF to purchase more boxes of fruit to sell. In this business for one year, Jayzalyn earns additional income from food vending and selling dried coconut meat from the coconuts she farms.

Jayzalyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more boxes of fruit to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wholesale goods such as creams, lotions and cosmetics, amongst other things

loans.name: Lis

texts.en:
Lis, a 49-year-old married mother of four children, resides in Takeo Province, Cambodia where she has been selling groceries for more than four years, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband is a rice farmer who earns about $2 daily. Three of her children are employed in a garment factory, earning about $9 each day.

In order to improve her family’s finances, Lis is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase more groceries to sell. This money will help her increase her stock and earn more income for her family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her youngest child achieve higher education. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is living in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is 53 years old and has two children. She owns and operates a general store that has existed for more than 19 years now, quite a long time. Every month, she earns about 9,000 PHP. 

Lydia joined GDMPC in 2006. With her loan of 20,000 PHP, she intends to purchase new items such as candies, milo (brand of malted milk), shampoo, soaps, etc. She hopes to expand her business inventory range and repair the store's look to increase sales.

loans.use: to purchase new items such as candies, milo (brand of malted milk), shampoo, soaps, etc.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years. She earns more income from fish vending.

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional items like shampoo, eggs, noodles, soap, canned goods, etc., to sell in her general store business.

Josephine has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like shampoo, egg, noodles, soap, can goods, etc to sell.

loans.name: Sheila

texts.en: Sheila is 36 years old and married. She is from Seti, Jimenez. She has two grown children who have helped her in taking care of their cassava. They have been raising cassava for 3 years and earn about 2,000 PHP a month. This year, Sheila joined GDMPC. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP from them to purchase fertilizer and pay for weeding costs. She hopes for a bountiful harvest and to expand her cultivated area.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pay for weeding costs.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to stock up on snack foods for resale.

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle is married and a mother of one dependent. She is 30 years old and lives in Poblacion, Pana-on. Michelle owns and operates a motorcycle transport business. She established the motorcycle transport business as a way of generating extra income of about 6,600 PHP per month. She has been engaged in this type of service for 2 years. 

She requested a loan of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC. She intends to use the money from the loan to purchase motorcycle spare parts and accessories. She is a new member of GDMPC. In the future, Michelle wants to purchase more motorcycles to use in her business.

loans.use: to purchase motorcycle spare parts and accessories.

loans.name: Chinfa

texts.en:
Chinfa lives in Sta. Cruz, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She has earned through providing transportation services for 2 years, so as to support the needs of her 2 children. She gets an income of about 7,000 PHP a month for this business. For a 32-year old mother, there’s nothing more that can make her happy except to see her children successful in their studies. 

Without hesitation, Chinfa is borrowing the amount of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC micro-credit to repair her transport vehicle used in her business and to provide her children a better education. She joined GDMPC this year. Her plan in the future is to hopefully improve her business.

loans.use: to repair her transport vehicle used in her business and to provide her children a better education.

loans.name: Estiveria

texts.pt:
Casada e mãe de 5 filhos, 1 ainda frequenta Escola outros já não, vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta 4 netos que vivem com ela.
É militar e tem um negócio há bastante tempo. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar produtos (massas, velas, sardinhas, doces, biscoitos e outros) para aumentar e diversificar ainda mais a sua mercadoria.
No futuro deseja investir ainda mais no seu negócio e melhorar a sua casa, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é ter fundos suficientes para ampliar ainda mais o seu negócio.
texts.en:
Estiveria is married and the mother of 5 children, 1 of whom still attends School, the others no longer do. She lives in her own house with her family and supports 4 grandchildren who live with her.

She is part of the military and has had a business for quite some time. With this loan she plans to buy products (pasta, candles, sardines, sweets, cookies and others) to increase and diversify her stock even more.

In future she hopes to invest even more in her business and improve her house. To this end she commits to duly paying off the loan in order to solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

Her challenge is to have sufficient funds to expand her business even more.

loans.use: buy products (pasta, candles, sardines, sweets, cookies and others) to increase and diversify her stock

loans.name: Ngam

texts.en:
Ngam is 44 years old. He is married and resides with a daughter in Takeo Province, Cambodia. 

He has been running the business of renting sound equipment and open sheds and other materials such as utensils, tables and chairs for wedding parties and funerals for more than seven years, earning approximately $5 daily. 

His wife and daughter are garment workers who earn about $6 per day. 

In order to improve his business, Ngam is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase materials to build more open sheds for rental. By doing so, he would earn more income for his family. In the future, he would like to expand his business and rebuild his house to make it more convenient for his family.

loans.use: to purchase materials to build more open sheds for rental.

loans.name: Laila Fay

texts.en:
Laila Fay, 32 years old, is a married entrepreneur who lives in Camansi, Sinacaban with one child.

She has run a transport service business for almost two years now and she earns 6,000 PHP a month. 

To improve business, she is borrowing 15,000 PHP from GDMPC microcredit, which she just joined recently, to obtain accessories and tires. Before long, she’s hopeful of the possibility of expanding her business.

loans.use: to obtain accessories and tires.

loans.name: Choeurn

texts.en:
Choeurn is 47 years old. He is married and resides with five children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. 

He has been running a taxi service (motor taxi) for more than ten years, earning approximately $4 each day. Additionally, he is a rice farmer. His wife is employed in the shoe factory. She earns about $4 daily. Three of his children are employed in a garment factory. They earn about $10 per day. 

In order to improve his farming, Choeurn is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase cattle to use for farming. This purchase will help him grow rice faster. In the future, he would like to build a new house and send his children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to use for farming.

loans.name: Kem

texts.en:
Kem is 34 years old. She is married and resides with three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. 

She has been working in garment factory for more than a year, earning approximately $4 daily. Her husband runs a public transportation (motor taxi) business. He earns about $10 per day. One of her children is a garment worker as well. She earns about $3 each day. 

Because the present motorcycle is old, Kem is requesting a loan of $900 to purchase a new motorcycle for her husband to run the taxi service. This purchase will help him attract more customers and earn more income for the family. In the future, she would like to purchase piglets to breed and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorcycle for her husband to run the taxi service.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.pt:
Casada e mãe de 6 filhos já maiores de idade apenas um que vive com ele vai a Escola, vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta 2 netos que vivem com ela.
É negociante e dona do seu negócio há mais tempo. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (barrotes chapas de zinco, areia, cimento, pedra e outros) para dar continuidade com a melhoria da sua casa.
No futuro deseja concluir a sua casa e mobilar para oferecer melhor conforto a sua família, assim compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é ampliar seu negócio e conseguir fundos suficientes para poder realizar os seus projectos futuros.
texts.en:
Luisa is married and the mother of 6 children who are all of age - only 1 lives with her and he attends School. She has her own house with her family and supports 2 grandchildren who live with her.

She is a trader and has owned her own business for a while. With this loan she intends to purchase construction materials (beams, zinc plates, sand, cement, stone and others) to continue the improvements being made to her home.

In future Luisa hopes to complete her house and furnish it to offer her family more comfort. To this end she commits to duly paying off the loan in order to solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

Her challenge is to grow her business and obtain sufficient funds to made her future projects a reality.

loans.use: purchase construction materials (beams, zinc plates, sand, cement, stone and others) to continue the improvements being made to her home.

loans.name: Cacilda

texts.pt:
Casada e mãe de 4 filhos, 1 já maior de idade e os restantes frequentam a Escola, vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.
É negociante e dona do seu negócio. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar produtos (fardos de roupa usada) para melhorar a qualidade da sua mercadoria.
No futuro deseja fazer crescer o seu negócio vendendo por encomenda, assim compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é surgimento de alguma doença que possa impedir a continuação do seu negócio
texts.en:
Cacilda is married and the mother of 4 children, 1 is of age and the others attend School. She lives in her own house with her family and doesn't support anyone else.

She's a trader and owns her own business. With this loan she plans to buy stock (bundles of used clothes) to improve the quality of her products.

In future Cacilda hopes to grow her business by selling to order and to this end she commits to duly paying off the loan in order to solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

Her challenge is that the appearance of some illness may stop her from continuing with her business as usual.

loans.use: buy stock (bundles of used clothes) to improve the quality of her products

loans.name: Mafalda

texts.pt:
Casada e mãe de 4 filhos, que frequentam Escola, vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta sua mãe que vive no bairro Mahubo enviando alguns bens alimentares.
É comerciante e dona do seu negócio e com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar produtos (arroz, açúcar, óleo, farinha, feijão e outros) para aumentar e diversificar os seus produtos.
No futuro pretende expandir ainda mais a sua actividade comercial e melhorar as condições de vida da sua família, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria para poder gerar mais renda e solicitar empréstimos cada vez mais satisfatórios
texts.en:
Mafalda is married and the mother of 4 children who attend School, lives in her own house with her family and supports her mother who lives in the Mahubo neighbourhood by sending her foodstuffs.

She is a trader, owns her own business and with this loan she plans to buy products (rice, sugar, oil, flour, beans and others) to increase and diversify her stock.

In future, Mafalda hopes to increase her commercial activities even more and improve her family's quality of life and to this end she commits to duly paying off the loan in order to solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

Her challenge is to increase the quantity of her stock to be able to generate more income and solicit increasing loans.

loans.use: buy products (rice, sugar, oil, flour, beans and others) to increase and diversify her stock.

loans.name: Celestina

texts.es:
Con 26 años  Celestina lleva la alegría de contar con una familia no numerosa pero si muy unida, Demetrio quien es su pareja y padre de su pequeña Yuly de 7 años, es su brazo derecho en el trabajo y juntos desean y construir una casa de material noble, pues actualmente habitan en una casa de madera. Llegada desde hace algunos años de la parte central del país, hizo su arribo a la selva con el afán de buscar una mejor vida dedicándose a la producción de productos agrícolas dentro de los cuales esta el café como su principal aliado. Es así que se desempeña desde hace 1 año como propietaria de sus parcelas que le fueron heredadas por sus padres, que con ayuda de Demetrio y de jornaleros viene sembrando, cosechando y comercializando granos de café, pues a pesar de la gran atención que requieren las plantas cafetaleras todo el esfuerzo es bien recompensado por el precio actual. No obstante una de las cosas que complican su trabajo son las constantes lluvias y la aparición de algunas plagas, que de no tomar el debido control a tiempo termina por arruinar gran parte de los cultivos.
Para realizar un debido tratamiento debe de contar con personal inmediato así como de algunos insecticidas menos nocivos para el medio ambiente y la compra de abundantes sacos de abono orgánico con el cual es posible garantizar un buen crecimiento de las plantas logrando obtener la calidad que los acopiadores suelen otorgarle buen precio.
En adelante planea reunir capital suficiente con el cual anhela aperturar una tienda de abarrotes en el pueblo donde radica, esto para generar ingresos mientras existen temporadas de lluvia constante y meses del año en donde la mano de obra es menos requerida en el campo. Este es su tercer crédito, tiene en mente seguir cumpliendo puntualmente con sus pagos para en adelante acceder a un crédito mayor. Agradece a sus compañeros de su banco comunal por la acogida que le brindaron desde su ingreso y por la manera ordenada en como vienen desempeñándose. Con los 2,000 soles otorgados realizará la contrata de jornaleros para la siembra de plantas de café así como para la compra de sacos de abono orgánico.
texts.en:
With 26 years of age, Celestina has the joy of having a small but united family. Demetrio, her partner and the father of their little 7 year old girl, Yuly, is her right arm at work and together they wish to build a house of cement and bricks since they currently live in a wooden house. Celestina came a few years ago from the central part of the country; she made her arrival to the jungle with the desire to better the quality of her life by making a living in the production of agricultural products, being coffee her main ally. Thus for a year she has been carrying out the role of proprietor for her plots, which were inherited from her parents. With the help of Demetrio and the laborers they've been sowing, harvesting and commercializing coffee beans. And even though coffee plants require a lot of attention, their efforts have been well remunerated with the current prize of coffee beans. However, one factor affecting their work are the constant rains and the emergence of certain plagues, which need to be controlled in a timely matter otherwise they end up ruining a large portion of the crops. To apply the proper treatment it is necessary to have workers on hand, as well as environmentally friendly pesticides. Also the abundant purchase of sacks of organic fertilizer will ensure the plants will grow well and be of the quality that is compensated with a good price.      
In the future, Celestina plans to save enough capital to open a grocery store in the town where she lives. This will generate income during the seasons of constant rain and the months of the year where the workforce is not as required in the fields. This is her third loan and she plans to continue to make her payments on time to later qualify for a bigger loan. She is thankful to her partners at the communal bank for being so welcoming from the beginning and for carrying out matters so orderly. With the 2,000 soles received she will hire laborers to sow coffee plants, as well as purchase sacks of organic fertilizer.

loans.use: to hire laborers and buy sacks of organic fertilizer

loans.name: Merime

texts.fr: Merime est un jeune camerounais de 25 ans célibataire. il détient une petite boutique depuis 11 ans dans un quartier  de douala où il vend des articles de ménage et de cuisine. Grâce à son dynamisme et sa compétence dans ce domaine, il s'est fait une clientèle grandissante qu'il n'arrive plus à satisfaire. Ce crédit lui permettra d'augmenter son stock de marchandises ( achat des plats, des bassines, des seaux, des verres, des rechauds à gaz). Avec les bénéfices générés, Merime compte ouvrir une autre petite boutique dans un autre coin de la ville pour satisfaire la demande et être plus proche de sa clientèle. il compte aussi fonder une famille.
texts.en:
Merime is a 25-year-old single man from Cameroon. For the past 11 years, he has been running a small shop in a district of Douala where he sells household and kitchen items. His skill and enthusiasm have helped him to build a solid customer base whose needs he can no longer meet.  

This loan will help him to stock up on merchandise such as plates, bowls, buckets, glasses, portable gas stoves, etc. 

Merime plans to use the profits earned with this loan to open another store elsewhere in the city to better meet customer demand. He would also like to start a family.

loans.use: to stock up on household and kitchen items for resale.

loans.name: Frely

texts.en:
Frely is married, 30 years of age, and lives in Siaboc, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental together with her two children. 

Frely operates a specialized retail store to earn a living. She has been in this business for more than five years and she earns 3,000 PHP every month. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase new items to expand her product offering. She joined GDMPC this year. 

In the future, Frely will use her income to support her two children in their studies until they finish college and also in their daily needs. Frely wishes that her business will grow.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering.

loans.name: Munkhzul

texts.en:
Munkhzul is a 32-year-old widow. She is living with her daughter, her mother and her brother’s family. Those six people live in a small apartment in Erdenet, the third largest city of Mongolia. Erdenet is an industrialized city. Her daughter, Oyuntulkhuur, is 10 years old and is studying in secondary school. 

Munkhzul has been working as an operator in an ore-dressing enterprise, since 1999. A few months ago, her brother started work as a millwright in Oyutolgoi, Umnugovi Aimakh, approximately 600 km from the city of Ulaanbaatar. 

It’s very difficult to live with her brother’s family in a small apartment. That’s why she started to build a house for her brother's family. Her brother’s family income is not enough. Munkhzul is a very kind person. This autumn she started to build a house in blocks. Now she needs more money to buy construction material such as roof material, double-glazed windows, doors and the necessary material for interior decoration.

loans.use: to buy construction material such as roof material, double-glazed windows, doors and necessary material for interior decoration.

loans.name: Julibeth

texts.en:
Julibeth is 42 years old and married with two children.  

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines.  Julibeth is borrowing 20,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase additional feed for her pigs.  

Julibeth has been raising pigs for 12 years and also earns additional income from fish vending.  

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed for her pigs

loans.name: Rui

texts.pt:
Solteiro e sem filhos, vive na casa própria com o seu pai e não sustenta mais ninguém para alem do pai que vivem juntos.
É motorista de uma empresa privada e nos tempos livres faz a construção civil. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (areia, cimento, pedra, portas e outros) para dar continuidade com a melhoria da sua casa.
No futuro deseja voltar a Escola para aumentar o seu nível escolar e melhorar a sua vida, assim compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é conseguir fundos suficientes para poder realizar os seus projectos futuros.
texts.en:
Rui is single and has no children, lives in his own house with his father and doesn't support anyone else except his father.

He is a driver for a private company and in his spare time he is a builder. With this loan he plans to buy construction materials (sand, cement, stone, doors and others) to continue the improvements being made to his house.

In future Rui hopes to go back to School to increase his level of education and improve his life. To this end he commits to duly paying off the loan in order to solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

His challenge is to obtain sufficient funds to be able to make his future projects a reality.

loans.use: buy construction materials (sand, cement, stone, doors and others) to continue the improvements being made to his house.

loans.name: Aguia

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 1 filho que frequenta Escola, vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta seu sobrinho e neto que vivem com ele.
É padeiro de profissão e com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (chapas de zinco, pedra, areia, cimento, blocos e outros) para ampliar a sua casa.
No futuro pretende terminar a ampliação da sua casa e casar oficialmente, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é trabalhar ainda mais e arranjar outras fontes de renda para poder liquidar mais cedo o empréstimo.
texts.en:
Aguia is married and the father of 1 child who attends School, lives in his own house with his family and supports a nephew and grandson who live with him.

He is a baker and with this loan he plans to buy construction material (zinc plates, stone, sand, cement, blocks and others) to expand his house.

In future, Aguia plans to complete the expansion of his house and get married officially. To this end he commits to duly paying off the loan in order to solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

His challenge is to work even more and find other sources of income so that he can pay off the loan early.

loans.use: buy construction material (zinc plates, stone, sand, cement, blocks and others) to expand his house

loans.name: Jesulome Group

texts.fr: JESULOME est un groupe de neuf personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. Le représentant du groupe, André (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgé de 48 ans et est marié à une couturière du nom de Félicité. André est père de trois enfants tous scolarisés et à la charge du couple. André vit ensemble avec ses enfants et sa femme. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges. André n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Il y a près de quinze ans que André mène comme activité la vente des moutons et des volailles à son domicile. André mène cette activité afin de pourvoir aux besoins du ménage. André s’approvisionne dans des régions du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, André sollicite un quatrième crédit avec les autres membres du groupe JESULOME. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits. Les crédits précédents ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The JESULOME group is made up of nine people who all live in the same neighborhood. The group's representative, André (who is raising his hand in the photo), is 48 years old and married to a seamstress named Félicité. André is the father of three children, all of whom have received schooling and live in the care of their parents. André lives with his wife and children. He and his wife both cover the family's various expenses. André did not go to school.

André has been selling sheep and poultry from home for about fifteen years now. He runs this business so that he can support his family. He stocks up in different regions in Benin.

Striving to satisfy his customers, André, along with the other members of the JESULOME group, is seeking a fourth loan. The loan will allow them to better meet the demand of their customers and earn more profit. The previous loans were correctly repaid.

loans.use: to buy sheep and poultry

loans.name: Teresa Del Carmen

texts.es:
Teresa, se dedica a la venta de tortillas, esta casada, vive con sus padres, ella se dedica al negocio como una fuente de ingreso para ayudar a su familia con los ingresos. 
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de maíz, leña y cal, que son los productos para su negocio, este préstamo le ayudara a mejorar su inventario, teniendo mas capacidad para vender.
La aspiración de Teresa es mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Teresa sells tortillas.  She is married and lives with her parents.  She devotes herself to the business as a source of revenue to help with her family’s income.

She is requesting a loan to buy corn, firewood, and lime powder.  These products are for her business.  This loan will help her to improve her inventory, and she will have a greater sales capacity.

Teresa’s goal is to improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, and lime powder.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza, 32 years old, is a married entrepreneur from Siaboc, Jimenez, with one child. 

She has been earning from her transport service business for almost two years now, and she earns 3,000 PHP a month. 

To improve business, she is borrowing 5,000 PHP from GDMPC micro credit, which she just joined recently, to repair her motorcycle. Before long, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to repair her transport vehicle.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 33 years old, married and has one child. 

She is a poultry farmer who sells meat and eggs to earn a living. She also earns a living from rental income and she is a very hardworking woman.

She wishes to grow her poultry business to greater heights and also have more rental houses. She needs a loan of 53,156.25 KES to buy chick mash and chicks.

loans.use: to buy chicks and chick mash.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy baby goats that she will graze and later sell.

loans.name: Tumursukh

texts.en:
Tumursukh is 30 years old, married, and has two children.  He lives in Kherlen, the largest city of eastern of Mongolia. He is working in a military unit. His wife is a salesperson in a local company. His family income is not enough to meet his family's expenses. Tumursukh owns a car so he is able to earn additional income by running a taxi business. 

Tumursukh is living in his parents' wooden house. He started to build his own wooden house, which he would like to finish before winter. Tumursukh is requesting a loan for 800,000 MNT, which he will use to buy construction materials such as wallpaper. In the future, he would like to buy a plot of land and live alone with his family.

loans.use: to purchase construction material.

loans.name: Lorelyn

texts.en:
Lorelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines.  

She is borrowing 17,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy more items  like canned goods, soft drinks, noodles, etc. to sell in her general store.  

Lorelyn has been in this business for 2 years.  She earns more income from buying and reselling charcoal.  

Lorelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF.  She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like canned goods, soft drinks, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Julie-Ann

texts.en:
Julie-Ann A.  is from Sto.  Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur.  She is 31 years old, married and has five children. Julie-Ann has a transportation service business. She's had her business for 9 years and earns 6,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) per month from these activities.  

In 2009, Julie-Ann joined Kiva partner GDMPC.  Julie-Ann is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle used in the business

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn is 27 years old and married with two children.  

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines.  Arlyn is borrowing 20,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.  

Arlyn has been farming rice for 7 years and also earns additional income from raising pigs.  

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Luciano

texts.en: Luciano is married and has 5 children.  He is 60 years old and lives in Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines.  Luciano operates a fishing business  to earn a living.  He has been in this business for 12 years.  Each month, he earns 4,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP).  Luciano requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets.  In 2011, he joined GDMPC.  In the future, Luciano wants to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets

loans.name: Melba

texts.en:
Melba is married and has children.  She has a fishing and fish selling business in the Philippines, which she has had for eight years.  She works hard to support her family. 

Melba is requesting a loan from NWTF for 11,000 PHP, which she will use to buy additional fishing equipment for her business.  In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment for her business.

loans.name: Nor Aina

texts.en:
Nor Aina is 34 years old, married, and has five children.  She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 10 years.  She also earns additional income from selling eggs. 

Nor Aina is requesting a loan from NWTF for 13,500 PHP, which she will use to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.  She hopes to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Boavida

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 5 filhos, que frequentam Escola, vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.
É segurança numa empresa privada. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (areia, pedra, cimento, blocos e outros) para continuar com a ampliação da sua casa.
No futuro deseja concluir a ampliação da sua casa e reabilitar o seu salão de cabeleireiro para aumentar a sua renda, assim compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é falta de fundos próprios para poder iniciar actividade comercial.
texts.en:
Boavida is married and the father of 5 children who attend School, lives in his own house with his family and doesn't support anyone else.
 
He is a security guard for a private company. With this loan he plans to buy construction materials (sand, stone, cement, blocks and others) to continue the expansion of his house.

In future Boavida hopes to complete the expansion of his home and to rehabilitate his hairdressing salon to increase his income. To this end he commits to duly paying off the loan in order to solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

His challenge is the lack of funds he needs to begin his commercial activities.

loans.use: buy construction materials (sand, stone, cement, blocks and others) to continue the expansion of his house.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 3 filhos, que frequentam Escola, vive na casa própria e sustenta os seus filhos que não vivem com ele enviando dinheiro para despesas correntes mensalmente.
É consultor médico e com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (chapas de zinco, areia, pedra, cimento, blocos e outros) para dar continuidade com a conclusão da sua casa.
No futuro deseja concluir a ampliação da sua casa e abrir um estabelecimento próprio perto da sua casa, assim compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é adquirir fundos para aquisição de uma viatura para facilitar as suas deslocações.
texts.en:
Francisco is married and the father of 3 children who attend School, lives in his own house and supports his children who don't live with him by sending money for monthly expenses.

He is a medical consultant and with this loan he plans to buy construction materials (zinc plates, sand, stone, blocks and others) to continue the building work on his house.

In future Francisco hopes to complete the expansion of his home and open his own establishment nearby. To this end he commits to duly paying off the loan in order to solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

His challenge is to obtain the funds to purchase a vehicle to ease his journeys.

loans.use: buy construction materials (zinc plates, sand, stone, blocks and others) to continue the building work on his house.

loans.name: Cruz

texts.es: Cruz de treinta y ocho años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus tres hijos; ella se dedica a la venta de productos por catalogo cosméticos, cremas, perfumes entre otros, su negocio esta ubicado en el lugar de su residencia en una zona muy  frecuentada además comercia también de forma ambulante, tiene muchos años de experiencia en las ventas y eso le permite obtener muy buenas ganancias, es muy conocida en toda la zona ya tiene mucha clientela pues las personas la prefieren por la calidad, el buen servicio pero sobre todo por los precios accesibles; Cruz es una mujer activa, trabajadora y muy luchadora desea alcanzar cada uno de sus sueños y el principal es darle a su familia una vida plena pues son lo mas importante que posee, desde hace algún tiempo su vivienda tiene algunos desperfectos y para seguridad y comodidad de los miembros del hogar desea repararlos pero  no posee de suficiente capital que la respalde por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita tejas, sementó polines para el techo etc. Cruz tiene buenas referencias de pago y tiene la certeza que podrá cancelar la deuda en el periodo establecido, además se siente muy satisfecha con la ayuda pues sabe que podrá aprovecharla al máximo.
texts.en:
Cruz, age 38, lives with her life partner and their three children.  She sells cosmetics, creams, and perfume, among others, by catalog.  Her business is at her house, which is in a busy area.  She also sells in an itinerant manner.  She has many years of experience in sales, and this allows her to get good income.  She is very well-known in the area.  She has a lot of clientele who prefer her for the quality, good service, and above all, the accessible prices.

Cruz is an active, hard-working, and very tenacious woman.  She wants to fulfill each one of her dreams.  Her main dream is to give her family a full life because they are the most important thing she has.

For some time her house has had some damage.  She wishes to repair it for the safety and comfort of her household.  However, she does not have enough capital to do so.  That is why she is requesting a loan from Integral.  The loan will allow her to buy shingles, cement, and poles for the roof, etc.

Cruz has good payment references, and she is certain that she will be able to repay the debt punctually.  She is very happy with the help.  She knows that she will make full use of it.

loans.use: to buy shingles, cement, and poles for the roof.

loans.name: Carmelito

texts.en:
Carmelito is 32 years old, married, and has three children. He is from Tonggo, Tudela. 

His main source of income comes from his gardening business. He and been three years in gardening, earning an amount of 3,200 PHP a month. 

This year, Carmelito joined GDMPC. He is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn is married and has 2 children.  She is 50 and lives in Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur: Philippines.  Jocelyn raises fish and crabs for sale to earn a living.  She's had 8 years in this business.  Each month, she earns 7,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) doing this type of business.  She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional fish to raise.  In 2011, Jocelyn became a member of GDMPC.  In the future, Jocelyn wants to build a house and to help her children complete their education.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to raise.

loans.name: Norfrederie

texts.en:
As a widow parent of four children, Norfrederie works hard to support her family.  

She has a tailoring business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling beauty accessories.  Norfrederie is borrowing 15,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy materials for her tailoring business.  

Norfrederie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for her tailoring business

loans.name: Winfred

texts.en:
Winfred is 33, married to Muange, and they are blessed with two children.  She owns a boutique in Kibwezi town where she sells things like perfumes, ladies clothes and gents clothing.  

She has been in this business for the last seven years and gets an income of 30,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) per month.  She is applying for her first loan of 100,000 KES from KADET Ltd. with which she plans to purchase more business stock like clothes and perfumes to meet the demand of her customers during this high season.  

Winfred will use the extra profit to educate her children.  She hopes to be able to open a salon and mini-super markets.

loans.use: To purchase stock like perfumes and clothes.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma lives in the Kilifi area of Coast province, Kenya. She is a married mother of three and owns rental houses. She desires to increase her income by diversifying to other sources of income. Fatuma would like to set up a clothes shop.

Fatuma learned about Milango through a friend and joined with an aim of accessing credit to improve the business operations. The challenge she is facing is delay in rent payments from some tenants.

Fatuma is applying for a loan of 21,100 Kenya shillings to buy clothes for sale. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to expand the business and pay for her children’s school fees. Her plans for the future are to start other businesses and also open stalls in different areas.

loans.use: To buy clothes for sale.

loans.name: Jhon Anderson

texts.es:
Jhon tiene 19 años de edad, es soltero y no cuenta con hijos, vive en casa de sus abuelos en uno de los caseríos que conforman al distrito agrícola de Oyotún, ubicado a hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Jhon es un joven bastante responsable y trabajador, actualmente trabaja para una empresa tabacalera de la zona y también cuenta con un pequeño negocio de crianza y venta de animales de corral. Ambas actividades las realiza desde hace un año y los ingresos que obtiene de las mismas le sirven para solventar sus gastos personales y ayudar en algo a la economía de su familia.

Jhon desea realizar algunas mejoras en su habitación, como por ejemplo colocarle piso de concreto, enlucir las paredes y adquirir algunos muebles, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

El agradece de antemano a las personas que le apoyen en esta oportunidad.
texts.en:
Jhon is 19 years old. He is single and has no children. He lives in his grandparents' house in one of the hamlets that make up the agricultural district of Oyotún, located an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo.

Jhon is a very responsible and hardworking young man. He currently works for a cigarette factory in the region and he also has a small business raising and selling farm animals. He has been doing both activities for a year now. The money he earns allows him to pay his personal expenses and to help out with family finances. 

Jhon would like to renovate his room by putting down a concrete floor, plastering the walls and acquiring some furniture. In order to do so, he believes it is appropriate to request, for the first time, a credit of 1500 nuevo soles from Edpyme Alternativa. This will help him achieve his goal. 

He gives thanks in advance to the people who support him in this opportunity.

loans.use: to pay for room renovations: to improve flooring, to plaster walls, and to buy furniture.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is from Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 50 years old and a widow who has four children. To make a living, Erlinda operates a fishing business, selling seafood products such as fish. Erlinda been in her business for 11 years and earns 3,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) a month for these activities. 

Erlinda is requesting a loan of 4,400 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. In 2008, Erlinda joined GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en: Pamela is 32 years old, married and has one child. She is a tailor and sells clothes to earn a living and has been selling clothes for 4 years. She is very hardworking and also earns an income by selling goats. She has become an independent lady since she became a member of Faulu Kenya. She wishes to own a big business. She requests a loan of 21,363.75 KES to buy materials and a sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and materials for tailoring

loans.name: Azarias

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de2 filhos ainda menores de idade, vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.

É agricultor e com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar insumos agrícolas (sementes, fertilizantes, adubos e outros) para aumentar a sua produção.

No futuro deseja desenvolver ainda mais a sua actividade alargando a área de cultivo e melhorar a sua casa, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para puder aceder a mais na Hluvuku.

O desafio é conseguir fundos de investimento na sua actividade e cuidar dos riscos que este pode correr.
texts.en:
Azarias is married and the father of 2 under age children, lives in his own house with his family and doesn't support anyone else.

He is a farmer and with this loan he plans to buy raw materials for his farming (seeds, fertilizers and others) to increase his production.

In future Azarias hopes to develop his activities even more by increasing his area of cultivation and improving his home. To this end, he commits to duly paying off the loan in order to solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

His challenge is to obtain funds to invest in his activities and take care of the risks these might incur.

loans.use: buy raw materials for his farming (seeds, fertilizers and others) to increase his production

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy fishing nets in preparation for the coming fishing season which is drawing near.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan, se dedica a la venta de medicina natural, tiene 58 años de edad, vive acompañado de su esposa, no tienen hijos, el tiene una venta en la ciudad, desde hace 10 años la aprendió de sus padres.
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de medicina elaborada a base natural, por ejemplo linaza, fibra, sueros entre otros, esto ayudara a mejorar su negocio, teniendo mas productos para la venta.
Con este crédito espera realizar una buena inversión, fortalecer mas el negocio, ofrecer a su familia una mejor vida.
texts.en:
Juan is a vendor of natural medicines.  He is 58 years old and lives with his wife.  They have no children.  He owns a shop in the city, which he has run for the past ten years, having learned the business from his parents.

He is asking for a loan to buy naturally formulated medicines, for example flax seed oil, fiber, re-hydration solutions, and others.  This will help him to improve his business by having more products on offer.

With this loan, he hopes to make a good investment, strengthen his business, and offer his family a better life.

loans.use: to buy flax seed oil, fiber, and re-hydration solutions, among other items.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Maria, es comerciante de ropa y productos básicos, vive con su familia, tiene tres hijos, no tiene familiares en el extranjero, sus hijos tienen  las edades de 18, 24, 28 años, ella inicio su negocio por la necesidad de tener un ingreso que ayudara a su familia.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de productos como pan, gaseosas, jugos, boquitas, galletas, aceite, pastas, detergentes, entre otros productos que le permitan surtir el negocio.
La aspiración de Maria es tener un negocio surtido para mejorar sus ventas, de esta manera tener mejores ganancias, con su familia espera ir mejorando su condición de vida.
texts.en:
Maria sells clothing and groceries, and she lives with her family and has three children.  She has no relatives living abroad.  Her children are 18, 24, and 28 years old.  She started her business out of necessity, needing a source of income to help her family.

She is currently seeking a loan to buy products like bread, sodas, juice, snacks, cookies, oil, pasta, detergents, and other items with which to fill her store.  Maria's goal is to have a business stocked full of groceries to improve her sales, and in this way she would make a greater profits.  With her family, she hopes to continue improving their way of life.

loans.use: to buy bread, sodas, juice, snacks, and cookies.

loans.name: Valentino

texts.en: Valentino, 44, is a married entrepreneur of San Roque, Panaon with 2 children and has a business raising livestock.  It has run for almost 9 years now and he earns 6,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) a month.  To improve business, he is borrowing 15,000 PHP from GDMPC micro credit, which he just joined recently, to purchase livestock feed & other supplies.  Before long, he's hopeful of the possibility of expanding his business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Pinky

texts.en:
Pinky is married with four children.  She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  Pinky is 39 years old and has three children who are in school.  

Pinky has a fish vending business in the Philippines.  Pinky requested a 29,500 Philippine Peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell.  

Pinky has been in this business for 10 years.  In the future, Pinky would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Tabu

texts.en:
Tabu lives in the Kongowea area of Coast province, Kenya. She is a married mother of eight children, though only the last two still attend school. She owns a green grocery stall which she has been operating for 12 years. In this business, Tabu sells greens, fruits, vegetables, cereals, etc.. The family also earns some income from farming.

Tabu learned about Milango through a Milango employee and joined with an aim of accessing credit to improve the business operations. The challenge she is facing is high cost of transportation of products from the source to her business site.  

Tabu is applying for a loan of 22,000 Kenya shillings to buy vegetables wholesale and fish, coconut, etc.. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to expand the business and pay for her children’s school fees. Her plans for the future are to start other businesses and also open stalls in different areas.

loans.use: To buy vegetables wholesale and fish, coconuts, etc.

loans.name: Ritchel

texts.en:
Ritchel is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 5 years. Ritchel earns more income from raising pigs.

She is borrowing 13,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional items like shampoo, canned goods, soap, eggs, spices, etc. to sell in her general store business. Ritchel has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, soap, eggs, spices, etc.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza is from Alindahaw, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 51 years old. Flordeliza is separated from her spouse and has 4 children. To make a living, Flordeliza provides sewing or dressmaking services. Flordeliza has engaged in her business for 5 years and earns 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Flordeliza joined GDMPC. Flordeliza is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional equipment and tools such as needles and threads. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional equipment and tools such as needles and threads

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a three wheeler vehicle driver living in Changamwe, Kenya. He is married and has one child. He has been operating the business three years. The family also earns some income from a retail shop run by the wife. He desires to improve the retail shop.

Peter joined Milango this year and is applying for a loan of 21,100 Kenya shillings to purchase additional stock of retail products like soap, vegetables etc. 
The extra income will also form part of Peter’s future savings and help him pay for his children’s school fees. The challenge currently is high cost of fuel and bad debts arising from the shop. He desires to set up a taxi business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of retail products like soap, vegetables etc.

loans.name: Laura

texts.pt:
Viúva e mãe de 3 filhos, que já frequentam Escola, vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.
É pensionista e com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (ferro, cimento, pedra, blocos e outros) para ampliar a sua casa.
No futuro pretende concluir a sua obra e mobilar para oferecer melhor conforto a sua família, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é ter fundos suficientes para terminar sua obra.
texts.en:
Laura is a widow and the mother of 3 children who already attend School. She lives in her own house with her family and doesn't support anyone else.

She is a pensioner and with the current loan she intends to buy construction materials (iron, cement, stone, blocks and others) to expand her house.

In future Laura hopes to complete her house and furnish it to offer her family more comfort. To this end, she commits to duly paying off the loan in order to solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

Her challenge is to have sufficient funds to complete the building work.

loans.use: buy construction materials (iron, cement, stone, blocks and others) to expand her house.

loans.name: Inacia

texts.pt:
Casada e mãe de 2 filhos que frequentam Escola, vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.

É docente e do quadro do Ministério da Educação também possui um negocio de venda de roupa nova e usada. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar roupas diversas para revender.

No futuro deseja apostar mais nos estudos dos filhos, sua formação profissional e expandir ainda mais seu negocio, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para puder aceder a mais na Hluvuku.

O desafio é maximizar ainda mais os seus rendimentos.
texts.en:
Inacia is married and the mother of 2 children who attend School, lives in her own home with her family and doesn't support anyone else.

She is a teacher, a permanent employee of the Ministry of Education and also owns a business selling new and second hand clothing. With this loan she plans to buy various clothes for resale.

In future Inacia wishes to bet on her children's education, her own professional education and expand her business further. To this end, she commits to duly paying off the loan in order to solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

Her challenge is to maximise her income even more.

loans.use: buy various clothes for resale.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.pt:
Casada e mãe de 2 filhos ainda menores de idade, vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém para além de seus filhos.

É comerciante tem um negocio de venda de roupa usada e com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar fardos de roupa diversa para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria.

No futuro deseja fazer crescer o seu negócio e adquirir mais experiência neste ramo, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para puder aceder a mais na Hluvuku.

O desafio é ganhar mais experiência neste tipo de negócio para poder progredir.
texts.en:
Patricia is married and the mother of 2 under age children, lives in her own house with her family and doesn't support anyone other than her children.

She's a trader and owns a business selling second hand clothing. With this loan she plans to buy bundles of clothing to increase the quantity of her stock.

In future Patricia hopes to grow her business and obtain more experience in this industry. To this end, she commits to duly paying off the loan in order to solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

Her challenge is to gain more experience in this kind of business to enable her to make progress.

loans.use: buy bundles of clothing to increase the quantity of her stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicide

loans.name: Sopheak Tra

texts.en: Sopheak Tra is 38 years old. She is married and resides with three children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than 3 years, earning approximately 4 USD daily. Her husband is a driver who earns about 4 USD each day. Due to the difficulty in her family’s transportation, Spheak Tra is requesting a loan of 500 USD to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase will help her reduce the transportation expenses. In the future, she would like to rebuild her house and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is from Militar, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 52 years old and married, with two children. 

To make a living, Teresita has managed a food vending business for five years, and she earns PHP 4,000 a month for these activities. 

Teresita is requesting a loan of PHP 9,000 that will be used to purchase raw ingredients to make products for sale. In 2008, Teresita joined GDMPC. 

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for emergencies.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients to make products for sale

loans.name: Michgona

texts.en:
You never see such wonderful national Tajik dresses as those sewed by Michgona!  She is 28 years old and a divorcee, with no children. She lives with her parents. 

To earn a living a year ago she began her own business sewing the Tajik national dresses. She has her own workshop in the centre of her region. Thanks to the good service, she has managed to gain many customers. Since she’s had her business, her family’s quality of life has been improving. 

She wants to develop her business further, but she needs to buy a new sewing machine.  Thst is why she is asking for a loan. She promises to make her payment on time. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine for developing her dress business.

loans.name: Ana

texts.pt:
Viúva e mãe de 2 filhos já maiores de idade, vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta 2 netos e 1 nora que vivem com ela..

É comerciante tem um negocio de criação de frangos de corte e com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar pintos, ração e vacina para aumentar a quantidade da sua criação.

No futuro pretende construir uma casa de aluguer para aumentar a sua renda mensal, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para puder aceder a mais na Hluvuku.

O desafio é assegurar que seu negócio desenvolva de forma a não depender de terceiros no futuro.
texts.en:
Ana is a widow and the mother of 2 children who are already of age. She lives in her own house with her family and support 2 grandchildren and 1 daughter-in-law who live with her.

She is a trader and has a business raising hens for slaughter. With this loan she plans to buy chicks, ration and vaccines to increase the quantity of her breeding.

In future Ana intends to build a house to rent out in order to increase her monthly income. To this end, she commits to duly paying off the loan so she can access more from Hluvuku.

Her challenge is to ensure her business evolves in such a way that she is not dependent on funds from third parties.

loans.use: buy chicks, ration and vaccines

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy chicks, ration, vitamins and other items so she can restart her activity.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 42 years old and married, with five children.

Susan works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and she has requested a PHP 13,500 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, soap, and snack foods.

Susan has borrowed and repaid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has operated her general store for 22 years, and she also earns an income from food vending.

Susan aspires to save enough so she can send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like canned goods, soap, and snack foods.

loans.name: Rogerio

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 3 filhos, 2 dos quis já frequentam Escola, vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta 2 irmãos que vivem com ele.
É Docente e do quadro do Ministério da Educação. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar produtos (massas, arroz, óleo, ovos, leite e outros) para aumentar a sua mercadoria.
No futuro pretende explorar a área agrícola e terminar o ensino superior, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é terminar o curso superior e liquidar o empréstimo.
texts.en:
