Rogerio is married and the father of 3 children, 2 of whom already attend School. He lives in his own house with his family and supports 2 brothers who live with him.

He is a teacher and a permanent employee of the Ministry of Education. With this loan he plans to purchase products (pasta, rice, oil, eggs, milk and others) to increase the quantity of his stock.

In future Rogerio intends to explore agriculture and finish his higher education. To this end he commits to duly paying off the loan in order to solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

His challenge is to finish his degree and to liquidate the loan.

loans.use: purchase products (pasta, rice, oil, eggs, milk and others) to increase the quantity of his stock.

loans.name: Faustino

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 2 filhos, que já frequentam Escola, vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta seus pais enviando algum valor para despesas correntes.
É Docente e do quadro do Ministério da Educação. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar produtos (peixe, caldos, massas, arroz, óleo, ovos, leite e outros) para aumentar a sua mercadoria.
No futuro pretende construir um estabelecimento comercial fora do seu quintal e iniciar a criação de frangos de corte, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é ampliar mais o seu negócio para continuara adquirir mais empréstimos nesta instituição.
texts.en:
Faustino is married and the father of 2 children who already attend School. He lives in his own house with his family and supports his parents by sending them some money for ongoing expenses.

He is a teacher and a permanent employee of the Ministry of Education. With this loan he plans to buy products (fish, stocks, pasta, rice, oil, eggs, milk and others) to increase the quantity of his stock.

In future he intends to build a commercial establishment outside his back yard and start to breed hens for slaughter. To this end he commits to duly paying off the loan in order to solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

His challenge is to expand his business to be able to continue to request loans from this institution.

loans.use: buy products (fish, stocks, pasta, rice, oil, eggs, milk and others) to increase the quantity of his stock.

loans.name: Regina

texts.pt:
Casada e mãe de 4 filhos dos quais os mais velhos já frequentam Escola, vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém para além de seus filhos.

É comerciante tem um negocio de venda de produtos diversos. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar produtos (refrescos, frangos congelados, massas, farinha, peixe e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria.

No futuro deseja melhorar ainda mais seu negócio, diversificar mais os produtos, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para puder aceder a mais na Hluvuku.

O desafio é vencer insuficiência de fundos e o elevado custo de vida.
texts.en:
Regina is married and the mother of 4 children, of which the oldest already attend School. She lives in her own house with her family and doesn't support anyone else besides her children.

She's a trader and has a business selling various products. With this loan she intends to buy products (sodas, frozen chicken, pasta, flour, fish and others) to increase the quantity of her stock.

In future she hopes to improve her business even more, diversifying her products. To this end, she commits to duly paying off the loan in order to solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

Her challenge is to earn enough money for the high cost of living.

loans.use: buy products (sodas, frozen chicken, pasta, flour, fish and others) to increase the quantity of her stock.

loans.name: Flavia

texts.pt:
Casada e mãe de 2 filhos que ainda não frequentam Escola, vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta seu cunhado que vive com eles.

É comerciante tem um negocio de venda de produtos diversos há bastante tempo. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar produtos (calcado, roupa, arroz, feijão, açúcar e outros) para aumentar a quantidade e diversificar a sua mercadoria.

No futuro deseja melhorar a sua residência e desenvolver mais seu negócio, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para puder aceder a mais na Hluvuku.

O desafio é trabalhar ainda mais para superar a insuficiência de fundos para realizar os seus projectos.
texts.en:
Flavia is married and the mother of 2 children who don't yet attend School, lives in her own house with her family and supports her brother-in-law who lives with them.

She is a trader and has had a business selling various products for quite some time. With this loan she plans to buy products (shoes, clothes, rice, beans, sugar and others) to increase and diversify her stock.

In future Flavia hopes to improve her home and develop her business even more. To this end, she commits to duly paying off the loan in order to solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

Her challenge is to work even harder to overcome her lack of funds and make her projects a reality.

loans.use: buy products (shoes, clothes, rice, beans, sugar and others) to increase and diversify her stock.

loans.name: Justina

texts.pt:
Solteira e mãe de 5 filhos 3 dos quais já maiores de idade, vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.

É comerciante e dona do negócio de venda de produtos diversos. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar produtos (peixe, caldos, farinha, arroz, feijão, açúcar e outros) para aumentar a quantidade e diversificar a sua mercadoria.

No futuro deseja melhorar ainda mais o mais seu negócio, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para puder aceder a mais na Hluvuku.

O desafio é fazer face a elevado custo de vida e conseguir financiamentos para realizar os seus projectos.
texts.en:
Justina is single and the mother of 5 children, 3 of whom are of age. She lives in her own house with her family and doesn't support anyone else.

She is a trader and owns a business selling various products. With this loan she plans to buy products (fish, stock, flour, rice, beans, sugar and others) to increase and diversify her range of products.

In future Justina hopes to improve her business even more and to this end, she commits to duly paying off the loan in order to solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

Her challenge is to stand up to the high costs of living and manage to obtain funds to make her projects a reality.

loans.use: buy products (fish, stock, flour, rice, beans, sugar and others) to increase and diversify her range of products.

loans.name: Mahouclo Group

texts.fr: MAHOUCLO est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres sont des amies résidant dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Delphine Abégnonhou (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 47 ans et est mariée à un mécanicien du nom de Calixte. Delphine Abégnonhou vit ensemble avec son mari. Delphine Abégnonhou n’a jamais été à l’école. Il y a près de cinq ans que Delphine Abégnonhou mène comme activité la vente de condiments, des poissons et divers articles à son domicile. Delphine Abégnonhou exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de contribuer aux besoins du ménage. Delphine Abégnonhou s’approvisionne dans sa région. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Delphine Abégnonhou sollicite un sixième crédit avec les autres membres du groupe MAHOUCLO. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits. Les crédits précédemment reçus ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: Mahouclo is a group of three people, who are friends that live in the same neighborhood. The representative of the group, Delphine Abégnonhou (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 47 years old and married to a mechanic called Calixte. Delphine Abégnonhou lives with her husband. She did not go to school. For almost five years now she has been selling condiemnts, fish and vairous other products from her home. She carries out her activity with passion and it enables her to contribute to the household needs. Delphine Abégnonhou gets her supplies in her region. With a view to  satisfying customer demand she is requesting a sixth loan together with the other members of the Mahouclo group. This loan will be used to respond to customer demand more easily and to make more money. The previous loans they were granted have been repaid in full.

loans.use: to buy condiments, fish and various other products.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Thelma works hard to support her family. She has a business selling vegetables in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from farming vegetables. Thelma is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional vegetables to sell for her business.

Thelma has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional spare parts for welding work.

loans.name: Ena Maribel

texts.es: Ena Maribel de treinta y dos años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida, sus dos hijos, ella posee una tienda donde vende productos de primera necesidad granos básicos, huevos, leche, jabones, etc. tiene varios años con el negocio y ya tiene mucha experiencia en las ventas, esta ubicado en una zona muy concurrida de personas y ya tiene mucha clientela, las personas la prefieren porque siempre tiene lo que necesitan, su tienda es la mas surtida con productos de primera calidad y a precios accesibles además el servicio es inigualable; Ena es una mujer enérgica, dedicada a su labor, y siempre esta buscando alternativas para alcanzar sus sueños, una de ellas es acrecentar su tienda pero necesita de capital para la inversión por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, golosinas, pan, huevos, bebidas, jabones, etc. Ena Maribel tiene buenas referencias de pago, es responsable, asegura que podrá cancelar la deuda en el periodo establecido y a la vez tiene fe que podrá llevar a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Ena Maribel, 32, lives with her life partner and two children.  She has a store where she sells staple items: basic grains, eggs, milk, soap, etc.  She has had the business for several years and has a lot of experience in sales.  It's located in a very busy pedestrian area and she has a lot of customers.  People prefer her because she always has what they need.  Hers is the store that's most stocked with top-quality products at affordable prices.  Also, the service is incomparable.

She's an energetic woman who is dedicated to her job.  She's always looking for alternatives to realize her dreams.  One of her dreams is to expand her store.  She needs capital to invest, though, so she's asking Integral for a loan to buy basic grains, candy, bread, eggs, beverages, soap, etc.

Ena Maribel has good credit references and is responsible.  She's certain she'll be able to repay the debt on time and also has faith in being able to bring financial security to her household.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, candy, bread, eggs, beverages, and soap

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: El Sr. Juan  tiene 31 años es casado con un hijo de un año,  se dedica  a la construcción y remodelación de viviendas, el es albañil contratista, el vive en la localidad de El Torno,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, el Sr. Juan va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de una motocicleta ya que esto le permitirá realizar su trabajo de manera eficiente ya que tiene contratos que cumplir, y esto le permitirá movilizarse de manera rápida a sus obras ya que son distancias largas que tiene que recorrer,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en trabajo, el  Sr. Juan va a utilizar los beneficios en comprar  muebles y electrodomésticos para su casa ya que le faltan muchas cosas para brindar comodidad a su familia, el Sr. Juan es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada  en la otorgación del crédito ya que esta es su única  actividad que le permite mantener a su familia.
texts.en:
Juan, 31, is married with a one-year-old child.  He makes a living building and remodeling homes as a bricklaying contractor.    He lives in the town of El Torno.

This loan is his first sequence with the institution.  He's going to use it to buy a motorcycle, which will allow him to do his work efficiently because he has contracts to fulfill.  This way he'll be able to get around quickly to his jobs, because he has long distances to cover.  He's requesting this loan to continue improving in his job.

Juan's going to use the profits to buy furniture and appliances for his house because he lacks many things that will give his family comfort.  Juan's a very hardworking person.  He's happy about the opportunity for the loan because this is his only job that allows him to support his family.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal UNION,FUERZA,AMISTAD,la socia continua con su negocio de tienda de abarrotes ,la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz,azucar,leche entre otros, la socia también continua vendiendo productos de belleza como cremas, perfumes entre otros, la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de leche y azúcar para su negocio.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This member is from the communal bank "Union, Fuerza, Amistad."  She is still running her business, which is a grocery store, where she sells basic necessities like rice, sugar, and milk, among others.  She also continues to sell beauty products like creams, perfumes, and more.  She has been working in this business for years, and it is going well thanks to the effort she puts into her business every day.

Teresa is a responsible and hardworking person, and therefore she is able to help her family get along.  She is asking for this loan in order to buy milk and sugar for her business.  She is thankful for the loan she is being given, and promises that she will make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy milk and sugar for her business.

loans.name: Fatima Margarita

texts.es:
Fátima, vive con sus dos hijos y su esposo, los dos trabajan para salir con los gastos del hogar, Fátima se dedica a la venta de sandalias de todo tipo, este negocio está situado en el mercado municipal, lo trabaja de lunes a domingo desde las 6:00am hasta las 5:00pm, lo realiza desde hace 3 años.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de calzado por mayor, una parte para hombres, otra parte para mujeres, para niños y niñas, esto le ayudara de manera importante ya que vienen los meses mejores en venta.
Sus aspiraciones son tener un incremento económico y poder sacarles el estudio a sus hijos, para que se superen.
texts.en:
Fátima lives with her two children and her spouse. The two of them work to make enough money to cover household expenses.  Fátima sells all different types of sandals from her business located in the municipal market.  She works Mondays through Sundays from 6am until 5pm and has been doing this for the past three years.

She is asking for a loan to buy footwear in bulk, some for men and others for women, boys, and girls.  This will help her in a great way because she is approaching the best months for sales.  Her goals are to make greater profits and to be able to give her children an education so that they will be successful.

loans.use: to buy footwear in bulk.

loans.name: Mahouklo 1 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHOUKLO 1 est formé de trois personnes qui sont des parentés appartenant à un même groupe de tontine. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Marie, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Marie est âgée de 34 ans et est mariée à Gildas, un chauffeur. Marie n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Le couple a deux enfants à charge dont un, leur propre enfant est scolarisé. Le couple vit ensemble avec les enfants et assure ensemble les divers besoins. Il y a environs quinze ans que Marie vend des vêtements pour enfants et des chaussures de façon ambulante. Ce qui lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté à ses besoins. Marie s’approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. Dans le souci de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Marie désire renforcer et diversifier son activité. Pour ce faire, Marie sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MAHOUKLO 1, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: The Mahouklo 1 group is made up of three people who are related and belong to the same "tontine" group ("tontine" is a revolving finance system whereby each member contributes periodically an agreed amount and this is passed on in rotation to different members). The representative of this group, whose name is Marie, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. It is the first time that this group has requested financial aid from Alidé with a view to increasing their business volume. Marie is 34 years old and married to Gildas, a driver. She did not attend school. The couple has two children to support, one of whom is their own child and at school. The couple live with the children and provide the various needs between them. Marie has been selling children's clothing and shoes on a door-to-door basis for around 15 years. This enables her to provide for her needs without too much difficulty. Marie gets her supplies in a town in Benin. With a view to responding better to customer demand, she would like to boost and diversify her business. To do this she is requesting a first loan from Alidé together with the other members of the Mahouklo 1 group.

loans.use: to buy children's clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Mirtala

texts.es:
Mirtala, vive con sus dos hijos y su esposa, uno de sus hijos le ayuda a realizar la ventas de tacos por las tardes en su coche, cuando sale de estudiar, Mirtala administra una tienda de productos domésticos, vende papas fritas, panes, tacos, desde hace varios años, en su casa realiza el negocio, aprovecha las ferias en los pueblos vecinos para ir a vender. 
Solicita un préstamo para surtir el negocio y tener más variedad para los clientes, comprándose gaseosas, jugos, papas, aceite, condimentos, esto le ayudara para ampliar el negocio, satisfacer las necesidades de los clientes, su riesgo puede ser la competencia.
Su aspiración es tener tienda grande, y venta de comidas mexicanas.
texts.en:
Mirtala lives with her two children and her spouse.  One of her children helps her sell tacos in the afternoon in her car.  When he leaves to study, Mirtala sells domestic products in a store she runs in her house.  She has sold fried potatoes, bread, and tacos for several years.  She makes the most of the holidays to go out and sell in neighboring towns.

She's requesting a loan to stock her business and have a greater variety for her customers.  She's going to buy soda, juice, potatoes, oil, and condiments.  This will help her expand the business and satisfy her customers' needs.  Her risk might be competition.

Her goal is to have a large store and sell Mexican foods.

loans.use: to buy soda, juice, potatoes, oil, and condiments

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is a resident of Changamwe, Kenya. He is the married father of one child and has earned a living for the last five years by working as a mechanic. He used to work in a welding shop but left to start his own business. Besides this business, Paul also runs a retail shop. He learned of Milango from our promotions and joined in order to access funds to improve and expand his business. He is applying for a loan for 41,900 Kenyan shillings to buy additional spare parts for his shop. The only challenge he faces is competition from other players in the field, but Paul is determined to carry out his operations well because he believes that this will allow him to give his child a quality education. His future ambition is to be able to open a second shop in a new location.

loans.use: to buy additional spare parts for his welding shop.

loans.name: Junelyn

texts.en:
Junelyn is 32 years old, married and the mother of 6 children. She lives in Sugod, Tukuran, where she has earned a living for the past 3 years by selling home and used products. 

She makes PHP 3,000 a month, and is applying for a loan for PHP 5,000 to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee. Junelyn joined GDMPC in 2011 as a way to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee

loans.name: Didet

texts.en:
Didet is 39 years old and married with four children. With 3 children in school, Didet works very hard to provide for them.

Didet runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like eggs, canned goods, spices, etc.

Didet has been in this business for four years; in the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like eggs, canned goods, spices, etc to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a resident of Changamwe, Kenya and has been running a food cafe for two years. He is the married father of four children, although only three have joined school. He is also employed. 

Despite the challenge of perishability and bad debts, Joseph aspires to own a larger shelter from where he can sell the food. 

Joseph learned of Milango from his friends, and is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenya shillings to purchase additional stocks of food such as beans, rice, flour, etc. He also desires to move to a new venue, carry out good business and establish a hotel in future.

Joseph believes the additional income from this loan will help him build provide a good education for his children.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of food such as beans, rice, flour, etc... for his cafe.

loans.name: Erdene-Ochir

texts.en: Erdene-Ochir, 43, is a taxi driver and has run his business since 2008 in various districts of Ulaanbaatar, the capital Mongolia. He has gained a lot of experience and wants to continue his business in the future. He lives with his wife and two sons in brother’s house. His wife recently started a new textile business with her sister, which they run from their rental apartment. Erdene-Ochir wants to move back into his own apartment, but it is in very bad shape. He is asking for a loan 1,600,000 MNT to improve the living conditions there.

loans.use: to improve the living conditions in his apartment.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en: Julieta is 42 years old, married and has three children who are in school.  She earns a living in the Philippines by raising livestock, and is requesting a loan for PHP 19,500 through NWTF to buy additional livestock to raise. She has been in her current line of work for 10 years and during that time has taken out and repaid 15 loans from NWTF. Her goal for the future is to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock to raise.

loans.name: Dina

texts.es: Dina de 53 años de edad habita en casa de su propiedad junto con sus  hijos y esposo. Ella se dedica a la producción y venta de tortillas .Dina es una mujer trabajadora,  responsable y muy valiente.  Gracias  a la gran experiencia con la que cuenta ha logrado ganarse la confianza de sus vecinos los cuales confían mucho en su trabajo y están muy satisfechos con el servicio que reciben. Además, ella tiene muy en cuenta la calidad y precios de las deliciosas tortillas ya que en este tipo de negocios es lo más importante para los clientes. Es por esta razón que su sueño es mantener activo su negocio por mucho más tiempo dado que es uno de sus principales fuentes de ingresos. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en su tortillería para la compra de los insumos necesarios como 1 quintal de maíz y  volteadores. Espera que esta decisión le permita aumentar sus ingresos y así poder mejorar su calidad  de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Dina, 53, lives in her own house, together with her husband and children. She makes and sells tortillas. Dina is a hardworking, responsible and brave woman. Thanks to the experience she has, her neighbors really trust her and her work and they are satisfied with the service they receive. In addition, she cares about the quality and price of her delicious tortillas, because this is what matters the most to customers in this business.

This is why her dream is to keep her business afloat more time, since it is one of her main sources of income. She has decided to request a loan from INTEGRAL to invest in her tortilla bakery. She will buy the supplies she needs, like one quintal of corn and turners. With this decision, she hopes to improve her income and in this way, improve her and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy the supplies she needs, like one quintal of corn and turners.

loans.name: Edith Leonor

texts.es: Edith Leonor vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus cuatro hijos en casa propia; ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas y refrescos en variedad, tiene varios años con el negocio y se ha hecho de experiencia muy valiosa que le permite elaborar las mejores tortillas y jugos, comercia desde su residencia y ya tiene mucha clientela pues las personas saben que todo lo que se prepara es de primera calidad y a precios accesibles además con el mejor servicio; Edith es una mujer activa entregada a su labor, lo que más desea en su vida es cumplir sus sueños, por eso trabaja con mucho esfuerzo sabe que así alcanzara el éxito; desde hace algún tiempo aumento la demanda y ella no quiere decepcionar a sus clientes, es así como decidió aumentar la producción pero necesita de capital que le permita invertir en insumos, por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar maíz por mayor, frutas, azúcar etc. Edith Leonor tiene buenas referencias de pago y es muy responsable asegura que saldara la deuda y a la vez le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Edith Leonor lives with her life companion and their four children in her own house.  She sells tortillas and assorted beverages.  She’s been in business for several years and has gained valuable experience that makes it possible for her to make the best tortillas and juices.  She sells from home and has a large clientele because people know that everything she makes is top quality at affordable prices with the best service.  Edith is very devoted to her work and what she most wants in life is to make her dreams reality.  This is why she works so hard because she knows that’s the way to reach success.  Demand has been increasing for some time now and she does not want to disappoint her customers so she’s decided to increase production but needs capital to invest in ingredients which is why she’s asking Integral for a loan to buy corn at wholesale, fruit, sugar, etc.  Edith Leonor has good payment references and is very responsible.  She assures that she’ll repay the loan while at the same time providing her family with better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn at wholesale and to buy fruit and sugar.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Amiran

texts.en: Amiran is 52 years old and lives in a small village located in the Khobi district with his wife, son, daughter-in-law and infant grandchild. The family earns a living by running an agricultural business. They have two horses and two milk cows, and use the milk to make cheese which they sell locally in an open market. Amiran also owns a plot of land where he grows nut-trees and has a separate 1.2 hectare plot where he sows maize. He sells this produce for a good price in their village. Each member of the family works hard to insure in a good harvest. Amiran is requesting a loan to buy building materials to renovate his shed. The existing structure is too small and doesn’t allow him to implement his plans for the future, which include buying additional livestock which he will house in this building after it is complete.

loans.use: to buy building materials for a new shed.

loans.name: Jose Felipe

texts.es:
José, se ha motivado por trabajar con préstamos frecuentes, porque quiere abastecer el negocio de mercadería para sus clientes, considera que los préstamos cambian sus condiciones personales y de comercio, él comprara arroz, frijol, azúcar, café, y otros productos de primera necesidad.
El efecto con el préstamo anterior fue obtener mejores ganancias, ya que el crédito lo invirtió en la tienda, esto le ha generado cambios positivos en su familia, con más posibilidades de crecer económicamente.
texts.en: José is motivated to work with frequent loans because he wants to stock his store with merchandise for his customers.  He feels that the loans change his personal and commercial conditions.  He will buy rice, beans, sugar, coffee and other basic staples.  The effect of his previous loan was higher profits because he invested it in his store.  This has led to positive changes in his family with more possibilities for economic growth.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, coffee.

loans.name: Delfina Marcelina

texts.es:
La señora Delfina Marcelina esta casada, tiene 53 años de edad, cursó los 3 años de educacion primaria, se dedica a la confección de blusas típicas, inicio este negocio gracias al apoyo de su hermana y hasta el momento lleva 10 años de experiencia.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de telas para confección de blusas, y así tener mas recurso para producir mas, espera en el futuro tener varios puntos de venta, mejorando así sus ganancias para el sustento de su familia, especialmente sus padres.
texts.en: Delfina Marcelina’s married.  She’s 53-years-old and completed three years of elementary education.  She works making traditional blouses.  She started the business with support from her sister and to date has ten years’ experience.  She’s requesting a loan that she’ll use to buy fabric to make blouses and have more resources in order to produce more.  She hopes in future to have several sales points improving her profits for her family’s support, especially her parents’.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Mario De Jesus

texts.es: Mario de Jesús 42 anos de edad, casado con tres hijos e 15, 11,10, todos están estudiando. Mario es originario del departamento de León lugar que esta ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Este sr. Tiene por actividad económica la venta de muebles y venta de materiales de construcción desde hace 22 anos que se dedica a dicha actividad. El negocio lo tiene ubicado en un lugar establecido de la localidad. El financiamiento lo esta solicitando para invertir en capital de trabajo y comprara madera para elaborar sus muebles y  materiales de construcción para la venta como: bloques, cemento, cal, arena, piedrín, perlines. Mario Jesús agradece la ayuda que le brindan los inversionistas kiva a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en: Mario de Jesús, 42, is married and has three children who are 15, 11 and 10 years old; all are students.  Mario is from León Department a place located in the west of the country.  His economic activity is selling furniture and building supplies.   He’s been in this line of work for 22 years.  His business is located in an established local site.  He’s requesting financing to invest in working capital.  He’ll buy lumber to manufacture the furniture with and building materials like concrete blocks, cement, lime powder, sand, gravel and roof purlins.  Mario Jesús is grateful for the help Kiva lenders provide to people of scarce resources and poor countries like Nicaragua so that they can have a way to earn a living with dignity.

loans.use: to buy lumber and building supplies.

loans.name: Rodolfo Jr.

texts.en: Rodolfo Jr. is 44 years old, married and lives in the town of St. Niño with his wife and five children. For the last four years, he has earned a living as a fisherman. In a typical month, he earns about PHP 5,000. To improve his business, he is requesting a loan for PHP 6,000 from GDMPC to repair his boat. His goal for the future is to expand his business.

loans.use: to repair his boat.

loans.name: Martina

texts.es:
Martina tiene 64 años de edad, es casada y reside junto a su esposa en uno de los caseríos que conforman la zona rural del distrito de Lambayeque, una zona agrícola situada a media hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo. La vida en su comunidad transcurre de modo tranquilo y humilde, sus pobladores con personas trabajadoras y responsables.

Se dedica a trabajar en la crianza y venta de animales. Ella cría animales menores y aves de corral en espacios acondicionados cerca a su domicilio, cuando estos han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona con frecuencia. Adicionalmente prepara y vende "chicha de jora", una bebida típica hecha a base de maíz. Los ingresos que obtiene de estas actividades los utiliza para ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia.

Martina se encuentra solicitando un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a comprar alimento balanceado para sus animales e insumos para seguir preparando chicha. Esta es su primera vez con un préstamo Kiva y agradece de antemano a las personas que le apoyen con su crédito.
texts.en:
Martina, 64, is married and lives with her husband in one of the hamlets that make up the rural part of Lambayeque District, an agricultural zone located half an hour from the city of Chiclayo.  Life in the community goes by peacefully and humbly; its residents are hardworking, responsible people.

She works raising animals to sell.  She raises small farm animals and barnyard fowl in corrals she’s set up near her house.  When they reach a good level of development she sells them to merchants who tend to visit the zone frequently.  She also makes and sells “chicha de jora,” a traditional beverage made from corn.  She uses income earned from these activities to help her husband support the family.

Martina is requesting a 1,000 new sol loan that will help her buy nutritionally balanced animal feed and ingredients to continue making chicha.  This is her first Kiva loan and she gives thanks in advance to the people who will support her with the loan.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and ingredients to make chicha.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal UNION, FUERZA, AMISTAD, la socia continua con su negocio de venta de ropa como chompas casacas entre otros, la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia viaja a la provincia de Anta para vender su mercadería, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelanté a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de ropa para su negocio como chompas y casacas para su negocio.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Marcelina belongs to Unión, Fuerza, Amistad Communal Bank.  She continues with her business selling sweaters, jackets, and other clothing.  She has been in this business for years and it's going well for her thanks to her daily effort.  She travels to the province of Anta to sell her merchandise.  She's a responsible and hardworking person, this being the way she gets her family ahead.

She's requesting the loan to buy clothing for her business, such as sweaters and jackets.

She's grateful for her loan and pledges to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy sweaters and jackets for her business

loans.name: Luís Alexander

texts.es:
Luís tiene 42 años de edad, es casado y tiene tres hijos. Él tiene 20 años de experiencia en el cultivo de maíz, desde muy joven lo aprendió junto con su papá. Debido a que esta era la única actividad productiva que su familia realizaba. Don Luís trabaja todos los días en su cultivo, realizando labores de limpieza, fertilización, control de plagas, entre otros. Para comprar los insumos agrícolas debe abordar un pick up durante cuarenta minutos hasta llegar a la ciudad en donde realiza sus compras.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar 10 sacos de fertilizantes, herbicidas e insecticidas para su cultivo. De esta forma, comprara todos los insumos de una sola vez, ahorrándose tiempo y dinero. Además, que aplicara de forma adecuada y a tiempo los insumos. Él desea comprar un pick up para transportar su cosecha, debido a que debe trasladarlos en su espalda desde el terreno hasta su casa y con el automóvil le será más fácil.
texts.en:
Luis is 42 years old. He is married and has three children. He has 20 years of experience as a corn farmer, having learned the trade from very young with his father, it being the only lucrative activity performed by his family. Luis works on his crop every day, cleaning, fertilizing, and controlling pests, among others. In order to buy the supplies he needs, Luis must ride on a pick up for forty minutes until he reaches the city, where he purchases the supplies. 

The loan he is requesting from Fundación Campo will be used to buy 10 sacks of fertilizer, herbicide, and insecticide for his crop. That way, he will buy all the supplies he needs at one time, saving him time and money. He will also be able to apply the products correctly and on time. He would like to buy a pick up to transport his crop, since he has to carry it on his back from the farm to his house, and a vehicle would make it easier.

loans.use: to buy 10 sacks of fertilizer, herbicide, and insecticide for his crop.

loans.name: Justus

texts.en:
Justus is a resident of Mariakani, Kenya. He is single and runs a retail shop from where he sells assorted retail products like spoons, combs, cooking utensils, etc. The business has been running for the last two years.

Justus joined Milango this year and is applying for a loan of 21,050 KES to purchase additional stock of retail products such as spoons, combs, cooking utensils, etc. His ambition is to purchase a plot/parcel of land in the area. The extra income will also form part of Justus’s future savings and help him plan for his future family. The challenge currently is high cost of transport since he has to go and look for retail stock.

loans.use: To buy retail products such as spoons, combs, cooking utensils, etc.

loans.name: Curie

texts.en: Curie is 49 years old, married, and has eight children, five of whom are in school. She farms sugarcane in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 26,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. Curie has been farming sugarcane for 15 years now, and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is married with two children, both of whom attend school. She is a resident of Malindi, Coast province, Kenya. For the past three years, Rose has owned a food stall where she sells cooked potatoes and buns. She learned about Milango from an employee and joined the institution with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Rose's major business challenge is her lack of funds. 

Rose is requesting a 21,050 KES loan to purchase cooking utensils and ingredients such as potatoes, wheat flour, and cooking oil. The extra income from her loan will be added to her savings to improve her family's living standard. In the future, Rose aspires to own a grocery stall and pay for her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase cooking utensils and ingredients such as potatoes, wheat flour, and cooking oil

loans.name: Thanh

texts.en:
Thanh was born in 1965. She has two children who are a teacher and an auditing employee. Her husband is a retired soldier. His pension is about 8,000,000 dong (VND). 

Thanh has a grocery store to earn a living. She makes 3,000,000 dong (VND) a month from it. Her family’s total earnings are about 15,000,000 dong (VND) per month. 

She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2007. In the last cycle, she borrowed 9,632,000 dong (VND) and repaid the loan on time. 

In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 10,080,000 dong (VND) to buy noodles, canned food, candies and biscuits for her store. She wants to use her benefit to enlarge her grocery store.

loans.use: to buy noodles, canned food, candies and biscuits for her store.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en: As a married parent of three children, Delia works hard to support her family. She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and earns some additional income from a general store. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle. Delia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Donato

texts.en: Donato works hard to support his family. He is married and has a motorcycle transportation business in the Philippines. He has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of his motorcycle. Donato has been in this business for eight years now. In the future, he would like to build and expand his business to secure the future of his family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of his motorcycle

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita is 32 years old and is married with three children. She lives in Pandahan, SND, Lanao del Norte. For the past five years, Clarita has run a fish-selling business to supplement her husband's fishing income. She earns 4,000 PHP each month from her business. Clarita joined GDMPC in 2011.

Clarita is requesting a 6,000 PHP loan through GDMPC to buy fishing materials. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials

loans.name: Felipa

texts.en:
Felipa is a married parent with four children. She works hard to support her family. Felipa runs a business buying and selling lumbang seeds, which are seeds used in jewelry, crafts, and accessories, in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from buying and selling tree seeds. Felipa has sustained her business activities with her past 15 loans through NWTF.

Felipa is requesting a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of lumbang seeds to sell. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy stocks of lumbang seeds to sell

loans.name: Bayartogtokh

texts.en:
Bayartogtokh is 23 years old and lives with his elderly mother and his brother in their small wooden house in Kherlen, the largest city of the eastern province in Mongolia. He works as a guardian at a local company and his brother works as a border guard. 

Bayartogtokh's house was built with thin walls. He said that this winter will be colder than previous years and he thought the colder winter would increase heating costs. Before the "cold air chills the chin" and in order to stop the heat loss through the walls, Bayartogtokh is planning to insulate his house walls on both sides by using energy-saving materials like foam, glass wool, and double-glazed windows. 

By doing this he can work without worrying about his mother. His elderly mother needs someone who permanently cares for her. Every son loves to take care of his mother and Bayartogtokh is no exception. He said that in the future, if his brother has a family, he will stay with his mother.

loans.use: to insulate his house walls on both sides, using energy-saving materials like foam, glass wool, and double-glazed windows

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy additional charcoal to stock and sell.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 38 years old and married with three children who are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Jocelyn has a bakery business in the Philippines. Jocelyn requested a PHP 29,500 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional ingredients for her business.

Jocelyn has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for her business

loans.name: Ngoan

texts.en:
Ngoan was born in 1963. She has two children who are door men. Her husband is a barber and a motorbike-washing worker. His income is about 3,000,000 dong (VND). Ngoan sews and fixes clothes to earn a living. She has done this job for 20 years. She makes 2,500,000 dong (VND) a month. Her family’s total earnings are about 12,000,000 dong (VND) per month. 

Ngoan has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2007. In the last cycle, she borrowed 9,632,000 dong (VND) and repaid the loan on time. 

In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 10,528,000 dong (VND) to enlarge, repair and paint her tailoring store in order to upgrade it.

loans.use: to enlarge, repair and paint her tailoring store in order to upgrade it.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy utensils and foodstuffs like potatoes, wheat flour, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Emilia Antonia

texts.es:
La señora Emilia Antonia es casada, tiene 50 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tienen 6 hijos 2 de los cuales estudian, se dedica a la venta electrodomésticos blanca, estufa, planchas, licuadoras, lavadoras, etc. Inició este negocio siendo operaria y hasta el momento lleva 7 años de experiencia.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para comprar mas mercaderías y mejorar sus ventas, en este caso va a compra lavadoras y entre otros productos, espera en el futuro tener un negocio grande, y tener varios empleados que realicen ventas en diferentes lugares.
texts.en:
Emilia Antonia is married. She is 50 years old. She did not have the chance to study. She has six children, of which two are studying. She makes a living selling electrical appliances, stoves, irons, blenders, washing machines, etc. She started this business while she was an laborer and now has 7 years of experience.

She is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise to improve her sales. This time she is going to buy washing machines, among other products. She hopes to have a large business in the future and to have various employees who will sell her products in different places.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es: Roxana  tiene  32 años de edad vive en la zona San Isidro en la casa  de sus papás, es mama soltera, tiene una hija  de la que se hace cargo de todos sus gastos, también se hace cargo de algunos gastos de sus papas. Ella comenzó a trabajar hace 5 años como vendedora de cosméticos por catalogo y gracias a sus esfuerzos logro a cubrir las expectativas de la empresa AVON por lo cual la nombraron como líder de grupo, también  vende sus productos  los días jueves y domingo en la feria 16 de Julio de la ciudad de El Alto desde tempranas horas. Como ella se hace cargo de los gastos familiares necesita capital para comprar mercadería y así poder comprar los cosméticos en cantidad, por lo cual la empresa siempre los premia con productos de regalos de los cuales las promotoras ganan el 100% y esto hace que suban los ingresos del cliente.   Y como ya se acerca fin de año y es donde la gente mas compra este tipo de productos para uso personal o regalo,  la cliente necesita abastecerse de mercadería y tener mas ingresos para así mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Roxana, 32, lives in the San Isidro zone in her parents’ house.  She’s a single mother; she has a daughter and she’s solely responsible for all her expenses.  She also takes care of some of her parents’ expenses.  She started working five years ago selling cosmetics via catalogue and thanks to her efforts was able to meet Avon’s expectations and they made her a group leader.  She also sells her products on Thursdays and Sundays in the city of El Alto’s 16 de Julio street market starting very early in the morning.

Because she’s responsible for family expenses, she needs capital to buy merchandise and to be able to buy cosmetics in volume because the firm rewards the saleswomen with gifts that they can earn 100% on and this leads to increased income for them and since the end of the year is approaching when people buy more of this type of merchandise for their personal use or to give as gifts, she needs to stock up on merchandise to earn higher income and thus improve her and her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to increase her income.

loans.name: Judith Fabiola

texts.es: Judith es una joven de 29 años  casada y tiene 2  hijos no vive con su esposo ya que él se dedico a la bebida y los abandonó, vive en la casa de su suegros los cuales la apoyaron viendo la situación en  la que se encontraba. La actividad de  la cliente es la venta de cosméticos por catalogo de diversas líneas como ESIKA , YAMBAL, AVON, LEBEL,  debido a su cumplimiento de metas y su gran cualidad de colaboración que tenia con sus compañeras promotoras la empresa AVON la nombro líder de grupo y a su cargo se encuentran varias promotoras. Muy aparte de estas dos labores también vende sus productos en la feria 16 de Julio de la ciudad de El Alto los días jueves y domingos y  ella es la persona encargada de sustentar todos  los gastos familiares,  necesita  el crédito para poder  comprar mas mercadería para fin de año donde se tiene mas demanda además que si compra en cantidad tiene productos de regalos de los cuales gana el 100% en sus ventas y así mejora sus ingresos y su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Judith, 29, is a young, married woman with two children.  She no longer lives with her husband because he started drinking and abandoned them.  She lives in her in-laws’ house who seeing the situation she was going through supported her.  Her activity is selling cosmetics via catalogue of various brands like Esika, Yambal, Avon and L’Bel.  Because she met her goals and the great way she got along with her fellow salespeople, Avon made her a group leader and there are several saleswomen under her supervision.  Aside from those two jobs, she also sells her products in the city of El Alto’s 16 de Julio street market on Thursdays and Sundays.  She is responsible for all family expenses and needs the loan to buy merchandise for the end of the year which is when demand is highest.  In addition, if she buys in volume she’s given products free that she earns 100% profit on thus increasing her income and her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Mery Marleny

texts.es: Mery tiene 34 años, es casada y tiene 2  hijos su esposo se encuentra incapacitado a causa de un accidente que tuvo, lo cual no le permite tener un trabajo estable y solo realiza trabajos esporádicos que le permiten colaborar un poco con los gastos de la casa. La actividad de  la cliente es la venta de cosméticos por catalogo de diversas líneas como ESIKA , YANBAL, AVON, LEBEL, que los realiza a personas que trabajan en distintas entidades publicas y privadas las amistades y familiares. Debido al gran sacrificio que realiza con las ventas sus metas fueron alcanzas en muchísimas oportunidad por esta razón la empresa AVON la nombro líder de grupo y a su cargo se encuentran varias promotoras, pero aun así no le es suficiente para cubrir los gasto de la casa y los estudios de sus hijos por esta razón también días jueves y Domingo  vende sus cosméticos en la feria 16 de Julio de la ciudad de el Alto. En si la sra. Mery  es la persona encargada de sustentar todos  casi todos los gastos económicos y médicos de su familia, por esta razón es que ella necesita  el crédito para poder  comprar mas mercadería para fin de año donde se tiene mas demanda además que si compra en cantidad tiene mas descuento y premios en las líneas ya mencionadas y eso le genera un mayor ingreso que mejorara la calidad de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en: Mery, 34, is married with two children.  Her husband is disabled due to an accident he had so is unable to work steadily and only works sporadically and is able to help a little with household expenses.    Her activity is selling cosmetics via catalogue of various brands like Esika, Yambal, Avon and L’Bel to people who work in various private and public firms, to acquaintances and to family members.  Because of the great dedication and sacrifice she makes to close her sales she met her goals and Avon made her a group leader and there are several saleswomen under her supervision.  Even so, she is still unable to cover all her household expenses and pay for her children’s schooling which is why she also sells her products in the city of El Alto’s 16 de Julio street market on Thursdays and Sundays.  She is responsible for all family economic and medical expenses and needs the loan to buy merchandise for the end of the year which is when demand is highest.  In addition, if she buys in volume she’s given higher discounts and prizes by the brands mentioned above thus increasing her income and her and her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Marvín Antonio

texts.es: Marvín tiene 28 años de edad, es casado  y tiene un hijo. El negocio que posee es una tortillería su esposa, es la que las elabora. El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar un granero, maíz y una plancha para elaborar las tortillas. Con la inversión podrá tener disponible los insumos para elaborar las tortillas y agilizara la producción con la plancha. Él desea continuar trabajando para incrementar su negocio y sus ingresos mejorando la calidad de vida.
texts.en: Marvín is 28 years old and married with one child. The business he owns sells tortillas. His wife is the one who makes them. He is requesting a loan to purchase a granary, corn, and a tortilla press. This investment will allow him to have supplies available to make the tortillas and the press will help expedite production. He wants to keep working to increase his business and his income, and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase a granary, corn, and a tortilla press.

loans.name: Sara Antonia

texts.es:
La señora Sara Antonia esta soltera, tiene 20 años de experiencia, esta estudiando el quinto grado de magisterio, se dedica ala tejeduría, inicio este trabajo con sus padres y hasta el momento lleva 3 años de experiencia.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de hilos y poder tejer nuevos cortes, ya que espera tener un negocio grande  y con mejores ingresos. Espera tener varios empleados.
texts.en:
Sara Antonia is unmarried, she is 20 years old, and she is studying to be a teacher at the fifth grade level. She also works as a weaver, a business she started with her parents three years ago. 

She is applying for a loan which she will use to purchase yarn and be able to weave new designs. She hopes to eventually have a large business with greater income, and to also one day have many employees.

loans.use: to purchase yarn for weaving.

loans.name: Lilet

texts.en: Lilet is from Sto. Niño, Tukuran. She is 46 years old, married and has 5 children. To make a living, she sells fish; her husband is a fisherman. She has had her business for 3 years and earns 5,000 PHP a month. In 2008, she joined GDMPC. Lilet is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets

loans.name: Bayasgalan

texts.en:
Bayasgalan is 45 years old and lives with her son in the ger district of Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. Her neighborhood has minimal roads and spotty electricity. For the past three years,  Bayasgalan has run a casual clothes stall in the bazaar. She buys a variety of products from Ereen, a Chinese border city, and resells them for a profit. Bayasgalan is a really hardworking woman who has gained valuable work experience. Her son is a student and has an old car that he sometimes uses to run a taxi service to help his mother. 

Bayasgalan is requesting a loan from Kiva to buy more clothes to increase her inventory and sales volume. This is her second loan from Kiva. Bayasgalan's working capital has increased and her daily income has increased to 40,000 MNT. She thinks that her loan is very important to her business and her dream is to help her son get a good education.

loans.use: to buy more casual clothes to increase her inventory and sales volume

loans.name: 3.14.198.thiệu Khánh Group

texts.en:
Lan is 56 years old and is married with three children. Her children are grown and she has no dependents to support. For the past 10 years,  Lan has run a retail business where she sells medication. Her business is in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province and her most critical business difficulty is the lack of capital. Lan is the group leader of the 3.14.198.Thiệu Khánh solidarity group which consists of four members. 

Lan is requesting a loan to purchase medicine to sell. She joined the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women in 2011 to improve her  business and she has successfully repaid two previous loans. In the future, Lan hopes that her children find good jobs, she maintains her successful business, and she is able to buy more business supplies and equipment.

loans.use: to purchase medicine to sell

loans.name: Fabriana

texts.en:
Fabriana is from San Carlos, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 69 years old. Fabriana is widowed and has five children. To make a living, Fabriana buys and sells a variety of fruits in the local community. Fabriana has engaged in her business for six years and earns 5,000 PHP a month from it. In 2009, Fabriana joined GDMPC. 

Fabriana is requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase more fruits to sell. She plans to use the additional profit generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits to sell in the market.

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Sopheap, pictured with her loom, and her husband are farmers. They have been married since 2002 and have one son and one daughter. Sopheap's daughter attends school and her son is still too young for school. She lives with her family in a Phnom Penh suburb.

Sopheap is requesting a 1,000 USD loan to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and pesticide. In the future, she hopes to continue her farming business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and pesticide

loans.name: Kaneez

texts.en:
Kaneez is 26 years old and the married mother of three children. Her husband works in a factory where strikes affect his daily wages. For the past five years, Kaneez has used her sewing machine, which was a gift from her parents, to do tailoring work. She has become famous in her community for her neat work and is able to contribute a lot to her family's income.

Kaneez is requesting a 30,000 PKR loan to buy more spools of thread in different colors and packs of buttons, laces, and zippers. Her loan will help her better meet customer demands. Kaneez is hopeful that her loan will help to increase her net income and provide a better future for her children.

loans.use: to buy spools of thread in different colors and packs of buttons, laces, and zippers

loans.name: Jose Samuel

texts.es:
José, se dedica a la venta de hamburguesas, tortas mexicanas, licuados, vive con su familia, tiene tres hijos y su esposa, no tiene familiares en el extranjero, el negocio lo hace desde algún tiempo, trabaja diariamente, desde has 8:00am hasta las 9:pm, tiene un empleado para atender a los clientes.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de mas insumos para la elaboración de las hamburguesas, tortas y licuados, adquiriendo panes, aderezos, carnes, condimentos, aceite, esto ayudar a ensanchar el negocio, ofreciendo mayor cobertura y variedad a sus clientes.
Su objetivo es administrar eficientemente su negocio, sacarle el mayor provecho a la inversión, ampliándolo, sueña con tener una vivienda propia y darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
José makes a living selling hamburgers, Mexican sandwiches, and shakes.  He lives with his family, three children and his wife.  He has no relatives abroad.  He has had the business for some time.  He works every day from 8 a.m. until 9 p.m.  He has an employee to wait on the customers.

He's requesting a loan to buy more ingredients to make hamburgers, sandwiches, and shakes by acquiring bread, seasoning, meat, condiments, and oil.  This will help him expand the business and offer his customers greater coverage and variety.

His goal is to manage his business efficiently, to get the most out of the investment and expand it.  He dreams of having his own home and giving his children a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy bread, seasoning, meat, condiments, and oil

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has eight children, and only one of them goes to school. She takes care of one additional family member (grandchild). She is a farmer, raising poultry and pigs. She sells her products on a retail basis from home. She has been in business for the last 30 years. She works seven days a week.  

Victoria has requested a loan of Uganda shillings 500,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy more chicks, poultry vaccines, and poultry feed.  Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to get more money to buy higher-breed pigs and to own 1,000 laying birds. She lives in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: to buy more chicks, vaccines and poultry feed.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en:
Hoa was born in 1956 and has two children who are studying at university. She is divorced. Hoa runs a beverage stall to earn a living and she earns 3,000,000 VND each month. Her family’s total earnings are about 5,000,000 VND per month. Hoa has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2008 and, in the last loan cycle, she borrowed and repaid a 9,632,000 VND loan.

Hoa is requesting a 9,632,000 VND loan to buy tea leaves, colas, chairs, and glass cups to improve and supply her beverage stall. Her dream is to help her kids have good careers.

loans.use: to buy tea leaves, colas, chairs, and glass cups for her beverage stall

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en:
Sharon is married and has two children, one of whom attends school.  She lives in Kampala, Uganda. Sharon has been selling food in the market at wholesale for four years, working three days a week. She lectures as another source of income. 

Sharon is requesting a loan from MCDT SACCO for 300,000 UGX, which she will use to stock more green bananas, cassava, and Irish potatoes. Her challenges include the high costs of transporting the food from the villages and seasonality. Her dream is to expand the business so that she can buy a delivery van to ease her transportation costs.  

Sharon joined MCDT because it is easy to pay back MCDT loans. She rents a house with access to both electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to purchase green bananas, cassava, and Irish potatoes.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a resident of Mariakani in Coast Province, Kenya. She is married and has one child.  

Lilian owns a food café, a business that she has been running for nine years. The food café mainly offers meals to the residents of the town. She started the business from the income she received while selling porridge.

She learned about Milango from a friend and joined the institution with an aim of accessing credit to improve the operations of her business. Her main challenge is lack of capital and fluctuating prices. 

Lilian is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenya shillings to buy a cooker, microwave, and foodstuffs like cereals, wheat flour, cooking oil, etc. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve on the living standard of the family. 

She aspires to own a larger restaurant providing different kinds of food and conference facilities.

loans.use: to buy a cooker, microwave, and stock of cereals, wheat flour, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Tseveendorj

texts.en:
Tseveendorj is 48 years old, married, and has two children who attend school.  They live in their small Mongolian traditional tent in the ger district, an area of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, with no running water, minimal roads, and spotty electricity. He works as a taxi driver, which he has been doing since 2007. 

The ger is built on the ground and does not have a foundation so in the winter it is cold because the frozen land can chill from below the ger.  Tseveendorj is requesting a loan for 1,000,000 MNT, which he will use to construct a foundation and to buy furniture for his family. With this loan, he and his family will be provided with improved living conditions and can overcome the winter’s cold days.

loans.use: to build foundation and buy furniture.

loans.name: Fidaim

texts.en: Fidaim is married and is the father of one child, three years old. He is working in an administrative job but with a very low salary. His wife stays at home caring for the house and child. Fidaim wants to start his own business in agriculture but he doesn’t have enough money. He plans to keep a cow in order to cut expenses for milk and dairy products. He is asking for a loan in order to fix a stable and to do some renovation in his house. This loan will help him to start his agricultural business. He is hoping in the future to expand his farm more. Fidaim is very grateful to Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To fix a stable and to do house renovation

loans.name: Duyen

texts.en:
Duyen was born in 1966. She has three children. The oldest daughter is married. Two others are learning at the 11th grade and the 4th grade. She and her husband sell gas to earn a living. Her family’s total earnings are about 6,000,000 VND per month. 

She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2007. In the last cycle, she borrowed 9,632,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. 

In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 9,632,000 VND to buy more oxygen bottles and gas bottles to sell. She wants to use the benefit to raise her children well.

loans.use: to buy more oxygen bottles and gas bottles to sell.

loans.name: Sagrada Familia Group

texts.es:
El comité  Sagrada Familia, está creciendo gracias al trabajo de sus miembros y ya se encuentran  en el Tercer ciclo, con trece  integrantes, todas amigas y vecinas de la ciudad de Curuguaty.
Miembro de este grupo y presidenta es la Sra. Valeriana, quien comenta que se dedica a la cría y venta de animales, como ser gallinas, patos, cabras y demás. Comenta que es un trabajo muy sacrificado, pero que le gusta lo que hace, ya que es un trabajo honesto.
Valeriana solicita el crédito para la compra de balanceados para sus animales, para poder tener una buena cantidad y de esa forma seguir bien surtida.
texts.en:
The "Sagrada Familia" committee is growing, thanks to the work of its members, and they are already taking out their third loan. The committee has 13 members who are all friends and neighbours from the city of Curuguaty.

One member and president of this group is Señora Valeriana, who rears and sells animals such as chickens, ducks, goats and others. She says that it is very hard work, but that she likes what she does as it is honest work. Valeriana is asking for this loan to buy feed for her animals, so that she can have a good quantity and be well stocked.

loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Nasanjargal

texts.en:
Nasanjargal is 23 years old and lives with her 2-year-old, only daughter, in her wooden house in Ulaanbaatar (the capital of Mongolia). Her house is located in a boundary area of the city, with no running water, minimal roads, and spotty electricity. Her daughter goes to the kindergarten. And her relatives who are students help her to look after the child. 

After she graduated from secondary school, Nasanjargal had started to work as a shop assistant at another person's counter, while her peers were studying at universities. Since 2010 she has been renting her own, ready-made-clothing counter, at a market in the eastern part of the city. She usually sells women's clothes. Every month she goes alone by train to the nearest border with China, to purchase her goods. 

Now before the winter she has planned to purchase more types of winter clothes. Also she has planned to rent an additional counter, in order to increase her sales points. By doing this she can increase her income and sell her goods at two points, at the same time. Nasanjargal is asking for a 3,300,000 MNT loan to increase her working capital (buying winter inventory) and to rent a new counter in a west-side market of the city.

loans.use: to increase her working capital, by buying winter clothes, and to rent an additional sales counter.

loans.name: Kristjan

texts.en:
Kristjan is 21 years old and is a hardworking young man from northern Albania. He works with goats and cows and has been working since he was eight years old. He enjoys his work, which he started with his late father, and he is the sole financial support for the rest of his family, including his siblings. “When I was younger, I always dreamed of going to university and doing something with my life, yet this remained just a dream because I never had the opportunity. Maybe, someday, I will create the opportunity for myself,” Kristjan says in despair.

Kristjan is requesting a 300,000 ALL loan to build a stable to separate his goats and cows which currently sleep altogether.  “Even though I am at a young age,” he says, “I want to thank lenders ahead of time and also assure them that, being a responsible young man, I will pay my loan on time.”

loans.use: to build a stable to separate his goats and cows

loans.name: Sammy

texts.en:
Sammy is married and lives in Mariakani area of Coast Province, Kenya. For the past three years, he has owned a shop where he sells coconuts, tomatoes, and other products. Sammy started his business with his savings and money from his relatives. He learned about Milango through friends who invited him to the group and he joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. Sammy's main business challenges are price fluctuations and the seasonal business climate.

Sammy is requesting a 21,050 KES loan to buy stock such as coconuts and tomatoes. The extra income from his loan will be added to his savings to help him buy a piece of land. In the future, Sammy plans to build rental houses and start a dairy farm.

loans.use: to buy coconuts and tomatoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more meats to resell

loans.name: Lucy

texts.es:
Lucy es casada y tiene ocho hijos; siete mujeres y un varón,  que son mayores de edad, viven en la misma casa donde cuenta con dos ambiente donde se encuentra el dormitorio y la cocina, la  habitación es de adobe y el piso de tierra, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona 16 de julio de la ciudad de El Alto , donde se realizan ferias cada jueves y domingo.
Actualmente se dedica a la compra y venta de peluches de distintos tamaños, y que el patio de su casa lo utilizan de garaje, la casa pertenece a sus padres; en la feria de la zona 16 de julio las calles son adoquinadas y actualmente siguen refaccionando, ella trabaja los días jueves y domingo de cada semana. El esposo es transportista trabaja en el interior de La Paz y ambos colaboran en el pago de los servicios, comida, vestimenta.
El crédito lo requiere para aumento de capital para comprar mayor cantidad de peluches, ya que desea tener más cantidad y variedad  y así mejorar sus ingresos.
El sueño de Lucy es poder tener un buen capital en mercaderías y así tener mejor ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO Y KIVA.
texts.en:
Lucy is married and has eight grown children, seven daughters and one son. She lives in a house with two spaces set aside for the bedroom and the kitchen. The rooms are made of adobe and have dirt floors. Her house is located in the July 16th District in the city of El Alto, where fairs are held every Thursday and Sunday.

At the moment, Lucy buys and sells plush toys of different sizes from the patio of her house that is being used as a garage. The house belongs to her parents and is located near the fair in the July 16th District, where there are cobblestone streets that are currently undergoing repairs. Lucy works on Thursdays and Sundays. Her husband works as a driver in La Paz and both of them help one another with the cost of basic services, food, and clothing.

The loan she is requesting will be used to increase her capital for buying a large quantity of plush toys. She wants to have a wide variety of inventory so that she can improve her earnings. Lucy’s dream is to have a decent amount of merchandise on hand so that she can have more income and improve her quality of life.

This is the first time she has requested a loan from IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of plush toys.

loans.name: Ana Del Socorro

texts.es:
Ana  originaria de la Comunidad de San Juan  Rio Coco, actualmente vive en Estelí, soltera, de oficio comerciante, madre de 3 hijos entre las edades de 5,6 y 9 años  de edad. Ella cuenta que trabajaba en Costa Rica pero después decidió venirse a Estelí. Ella inicio con dinero propio el cual obtuvo en su antiguo trabajo, pues  ya que buscaba mejores fuentes de ingresos, y  fue allí  cuando  decidió poner su negocio de pulpería, de la que es propietaria hace mas de 25 años ya que este ha sido su  único negocio del cual sobrevive a diario  y recibe otros ingresos como son las remesas que le envían los familiares. 
Ana solicita el crédito para comprar granos básicos: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite y gaseosa. Considera que al comprar este tipo de producto de alta demanda, aumentara la cantidad de sus clientes y podrá vender más incrementando sus ingresos, ya que sus planes futuros es superar las ventas en su negocio y sus metas son ampliar más su pulpería para convertirla en una miscelánea.
texts.en:
Ana is originally from the town of San Juan Rio Coco, but currently lives in Estelí. She is single, a businesswoman by trade, and the mother three children ages 5, 6, and 9 years old. She tells of how she was working in Costa Rica but later decided to come to Estelí. She started with her own money which she earned in her previous job, and as she searched for better sources of income she decided to open her own grocery business there in Estelí. She has now owned this location for 25 years and it has been her sole business and way of making a living, though she also receives income in the form of remissions from family relatives abroad. 

Ana is applying for the loan in order to purchase basic foodstuffs: rice, beans, sugar, oil, and soft drinks. She believes that purchasing these products in high demand will increase the amount of customers she gets and thereby increase her revenue. Her plans for the future are to keep increasing sales in her store and she hopes to expand her grocery and one day convert it into a corner store.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, rice, beans, sugar, oil, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet  lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children, all of whom attend school. She is looking after her siblings.

She has been selling charcoal from home on a retail basis for three years, working seven days a week. She also makes chapattis and fries cassava to earn extra income.

She has requested a loan of UGX 300,000 from MCDT- SACCO to be able to stock more sacks of charcoal. Her challenges include transportation and seasonality. Her dream is to expand her business so as to start selling wholesale only and also to buy a plot of land to build a house. She joined MCDT because she had little capital to support the business. She rents a house with access to both electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include paying rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Quy

texts.en:
Quy was born in 1973. She has two children who are learning at high school. Her husband sells beverages to earn a living. Quy makes and sells traditional sweet soups in a market. She has done this work for 15 years. Her family’s total earnings are about 5,500,000 VND per month. 

She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2007. In the last cycle she borrowed 9,632,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 9,632,000 VND to buy ingredients, bowls and spoons to make and sell traditional sweet soups in her stall. She wants to use the profits to raise her children well.

loans.use: to buy ingredients, bowls and spoons to make and sell traditional sweet soups in her stall.

loans.name: Koeju Group

texts.es:
Koeju es de Ciudad del Este, está en su segundo ciclo, tiene 14 integrantes, donde todas ellas trabajan y están saliendo por medio del trabajo de todas. Son mujeres muy trabajadoras y emprendedoras.
La presidenta es la Sra. Gladys quien fue electa por las integrantes del comité. Ella trabaja en confección de ropas, y gracias al buen trabajo que hace está haciendo ya tiene muy buena clientela que siempre le hace muchos pedidos.
Pide esta ayuda para la compra de telas e hilos, y así seguir haciendo las prendas para cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The “Koeju” group is from Ciudad del Este. The group is in its second loan cycle and has 14 members. All of them work and have been able to get ahead. They are hardworking and enterprising women.

Sra. Gladys was elected by the other committee members to serve as president. Her work involves making clothes. Thanks to her good work, she has been able to establish a good clientele who always place many orders with her.

Gladys is requesting assistance so that she can buy fabrics and thread. This will help her continue making clothes so that she can fulfill her customers’ orders.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and thread.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn, cheese, pork and clothes.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.pt:
Casada e mãe de 5 filhos 2 dos quais já maiores de idade, vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.
