Tula, who is 43 years old, is a hard-working woman, happy, and striving. She lives with her partner in the house of her in-laws. Together they have a 9-year-old son. Tula's work consists of the retail sale of basic food products, among which are rice, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, oil, vegetables, and other items. She runs this business in the house of her in-laws. There she tends the store every day, full time. She has been working at the business for 5 years. At the beginning she had the help of her mother, but now the business is entirely hers and she receives help from her sister when she needs to take care of other things outside of the house. She complements this business with the sale of shoes for women, and this is going very well for her. This is her third loan with MFP. She is very grateful for the credit opportunity that they offer her and for the financial backing that she needs to continue forward. She promises to make her monthly payments in a punctual manner and to continue working with great responsibility along with the members of her communal bank.

With the 2000 PEN, she will buy merchandise to sell in her store: candies, rice, sugar, bread, eggs, milk, oils, vegetables, and other items.

loans.use: to buy candies, rice, sugar, bread, eggs, milk, oil, vegetables, and other items to stock her store

loans.name: Hovik

texts.en:
Hayk is 49-year-old father of 2 children, a 20-year-old son and a 15-year-old daughter. He is a dentist and works at a local clinic in Kapan where he lives.

Hayk's son studies at Yerevan Haybusak University and is in the third course of his medical training. Hayk is the only worker in his family and it is difficult to cover daily costs and save money for his children's education. Hayk has applied for this loan to pay for his son's tuition for the first semester of the school year. The loan is important for Hayk and his family because he wants his son to become a good specialist and continue his work.

loans.use: to pay his son's tuition for a semester at a university.

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with two children, both of whom attend school. She is not looking after any other family member. She has been selling green bananas for one year at retail and works seven days a week. She also sells vegetables as an additional source of income.
Winnie has requested a loan of UShs100,000 from MCDT- SACCO to enable her buy green bananas and charcoal to resell. Her challenges include seasonality and thievery. Her dream is to expand her business and accumulate lots of profits for self-development and also to get a permanent business location. She joined MCDT because of the low interest charged on loans. She lives with her husband in a rented house with access to both electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses are school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of green bananas.

loans.name: Elmelder

texts.en:
Elmelder is 32 years old and has had a retail shop in Nakuru for seven years now. She is the single mother of two children.

This is her second loan term and she plans to use it to buy more stocks of maize flour, rice, sugar and milk to sell in her business. She will use the anticipated income to buy more goods, as well as pay school fees for her children.

She hopes to grow her business and open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to boost the stocks of goods in her shop.

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is a 45-year-old married woman, mother of three children. 

Khadija has been working in selling clothes and blankets since 2005. Her business is mobile; she uses her car to sell her products, passing through neighboring villages.

Khadija is a hard worker.  She always works on expanding her working region and increasing her merchandise. 

Khadija is applying for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua to start a new business to increase her income and improve her family's living.  She plans to open a shop next to her house where she will sell housewares, toys, and shoes, in addition to her primary business.

Khadija has been Al Majmoua's borrower for two cycles.  Her previous loan increased her income and improved her family's living.

loans.use: To start a new business selling housewares, toys, and shoes.

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es: María Cristina de 27 anos de edad, casado con dos hijos de 7,5 anos. Ella es originaria de león, lugar que esta ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. María Cristina tiene por actividad económica  una pulpería desde hace cinco anos. Una pulpería es una pequeña tienda donde venden productos comestible y en cantidades pequeñas como: sobrecitos de café, sobrecitos de shapoo, jabón, fosforo, cigarros menudeadas, gaseosas, jugos, leche, pan, frijoles, aceite. El negocio lo tiene ubicado en un lugar específico de su localidad. El negocio surgió por la necesidad de tener un medio de vida y ayudar al esposo con los gastos del hogar. El financiamiento lo necesita para invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su pulpería con productos de consumo diario para el hogar. María Cristina agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de vida digna.
texts.en:
María Cristina is 27 years old, married, and has two children, 7 and 5 years old. She is originally from León, a place in the western part of the country. María Cristina has worked the grocery store for five years. The grocery store is a small store where they sell edible products and in small quantities such as: coffee packets, shampoo packets, soap, matches, cigarettes, soft drinks, juices, milk, bread, beans, and oil. The business is run in a stationary location.

The business arose out of necessity to earn a living and to help her husband with the household expenses. The financing is needed to invest working capital and fill her store with home products of daily consumption.

María Cristina appreciates the help that Kiva investors provide people with few resources and poor countries like Nicaragua to have a means to make a dignified life.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and products such as coffee, shampoo, and milk.

loans.name: Claudia María

texts.es:
El Jicaral un bello y encantador municipio donde se dedica a deferente actividades tanto comerciales como la producción de granos básicos, es aquí donde habita la señora Claudia María.

Claudia María de 40 de edad quien se dedica a brindar su servicio como maestra de educación primaria en una de la comarca más lejana de dicho municipio.

Esta señora cuenta con 3 hijos bajo su cargo todos estudian uno en la primaria y los otras dos en la secundaria, con lo poco que ella gana a duras penas da todo su esfuerzo para que sus hijos estudien y además cubre el sustento de su alimentación diaria en su hogar.

Solicita a Kiva y Ceprodel que le financien un crédito para la compra de medicamento para el bienestar de su salud ya que ha estado presentando mucho problema, por tal razón le pide a kiva y ceprodel que ponga su mano amigable y le financien un crédito para de Compra de medicamento.

Son  sus sueños más grande llegar a preparar a sus hijo, pero para esto ella tiene que contar con una vida saludable, con el apoyo de  kiva y ceprodel podrá mejorar su salud.
texts.en:
Señora Claudia Maria lives in El Jicaral, a beautiful and enchanting city where people work in different commercial activities such as the production of basic grains. Claudia Maria is 40 years old. She works as a primary teacher in one of most outlying districts of this town.

She has three children in her care. All are in school, one in primary school and the other two in secondary school. With her little hard-earned money, she gives all her effort so that her children can go to school and in addition she provides the daily food in her household.

She is applying to Kiva and CEPRODEL to finance a loan so that she can buy medicine for the sake of her health, since she is experiencing many problems. For this reason, she is asking Kiva and CEPRODEL to lend her a friendly hand and finance a loan for the purchase of medicine.

Her greatest dreams are to prepare her children, but to do this she has to have a healthy life. With the help of Kiva and CEPRODEL she will be able to improve her health.

loans.use: Compra de medicamento to buy medicine

loans.name: Pamela

texts.es:
Pamela es soltera, vive en la casa de su mama donde cuenta con 3 ambientes donde se encuentra el dormitorio, la cocina, y el baño, la  habitación es de adobe y el piso de tierra, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona 16de julio, donde se realizan ferias los días jueves y domingo en la ciudad del Alto.
Actualmente trabaja vendiendo ositos de peluche de distintos tamaños que los compra en fardos cerrados para luego seleccionarlos; su puesto de venta se encuentra en zona 16 de julio de la ciudad de El Alto, siendo el lugar lleno de tierra y actualmente están en refacciones, ella trabaja todos los días jueves y domingo. Y se autosostiene en el pago de los servicios, comida y vestimenta.
El crédito lo requiere para aumentar comprar más mercadería (ositos de peluche), ya que desea surtir con más cantidad de peluches y así mejorar sus ingresos, pues este producto tiene muy  buena aceptación.
El sueño de Pamela  es poder tener tienda propia y así tener mejores ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la segunda vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO Y KIVA.
texts.en:
Pamela is single and lives in her mother's house which has 3 areas: a bedroom, a kitchen and a bathroom.  The house is made of adobe with dirt floors, and it is located in the "16 de julio" neighborhood of the city of El Alto.  This city has markets every Thursday and Sunday.

Pamela currently works selling Teddy bears of different sizes that she buys in sealed bales and later selects to put for sale.  Her sales post is located in the "16 de julio" neighborhood of El Alto.  This is a place that is currently full of dirt and is under repair. 

Pamela works every Thursday and Sunday, and this is how she supports herself to pay for utilities, food and clothing.

Pamela needs a loan to buy more merchandise (Teddy bears).  She wants to stock up with more stuffed bears so that she can increase her income, and because this is a product that is well-accepted in the marketplace.

Pamela's dream is to be able to have her own store, so that she could have more income and a better quality of life.

This is the second time that she has requested a loan jointly with IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more Teddy bears so that she can continue with her business

loans.name: George

texts.en: George, who is a farmer, used his previous loan of 40,000 KES to buy pigs and pig feed. Through Faulu Kenya, in partnership with Kiva, he has managed to grow the number of pigs in his farm from 15 to 60 pigs. The farming business has brought him more income which has helped him educate his children and provide for the basic needs of his family. Currently, his first-born, a daughter, is pursuing Economics at the university. His second-born is pursuing a course in Pharmacology and the third is in high school. He dreams of educating his children through the university level. George has requested a loan of 105,300 KES to pay school fees for his daughter.

loans.use: To pay school fees for his daughter.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María es casada y tiene cuatro hijos,  de cuales tres están en etapa escolar, viven en casa familiar, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona 16 de Julio de la ciudad de El Alto.
María estudió solo hasta el nivel secundario y actualmente se dedica  a la venta de cristalería para el hogar (vasos, jarras,etc.), tiene su puesto de venta en la zona 16 de julio de la ciudad del Alto y también en la zona de  La tablada de la ciudad de La Paz; le ayudan sus hijos en las ventas.
El crédito lo requiere para comprar más vasos, jarras y jarrones de vidrio y así aumentar mercadería ya que se aproximan las fiestas de fin de año, ya que presenta más afluencia de clientes.
El sueño que tiene María es convertirse en una comerciante mayorista (distribuidora a las vendedoras al por menor) en la venta de cristalería. Así podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. 
Es la septima vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la cuarta vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Maria is married and has 4 children, 3 of whom are school-aged.  They live in the family home, located in the "16 de Julio" neighborhood of El Alto.

Maria only got a high school education, and currently works selling glassware for the home (glasses, jars, etc).  She has a sales post in the "16 de Julio" neighborhood of El Alto, and also in the La Tablada neighborhood of the city of La Paz.  Her children help her with her sales.

Maria needs a loan to buy more glasses, jars, and glass vases so that she can increase her merchandise, because the year-end holidays are approaching when she will get more customer traffic.

Maria's dream is to become a wholesale glassware merchant (distributor to the retailers).  This way, she could improve her family's quality of life.

This is the 7th time that she has requested a loan with IMPRO, and it's the 4th time the loan has been financed through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more glassware to sell during the Christmas and New Year's holidays

loans.name: Rajaa

texts.en: Rajaa, a 32-year-old single woman, is the oldest of four with one brother and two sisters. They live with their mother, and their father has passed away. Rajaa is a university student majoring in Archeology. She has applied for this loan in order to pay her upcoming semester fees and get her bachelor's degree as soon as possible to find a job and help support the family.

loans.use: to pay for her upcoming semester school fees.

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana lives in Vardavanq village of the Kapan region with her husband and two children. She is a teacher at the local secondary school. Besides her work at school, Svetlana also helps her husband with agriculture. They keep livestock: pigs, chickens and cows. 

Svetlana's son is a first year student in the pedagogical department in Goris State University. Svetlana and her husband work hard in order to ensure the family's livelihood, and it is very difficult for them to save money for the education of their son. They have applied for this loan in order to pay their son's annual tuition fee.

loans.use: to pay for tuition for her son.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
El señor Daniel es viudo, su nivel de educación es licenciatura tiene cuatro hijos de los cuales todos son independientes, él vive en casa propia ocupa tres habitaciones en un acabado fino y piso de cerámica ubicada en la zona challapampa de la ciudad de la Paz.

Daniel, trabaja como Abogado por más de ocho horas al día realizando diversos trámites y además tiene un negocio independiente de venta de productos electrónicos como televisores, dvd players y radios, para apoyar a cubrir los gastos de agua, luz y alimentación.
 
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de más televisores y dvd players y así  aumentar su capital de trabajo.

El sueño de Daniel hacer crecer su negocio.

Es la segunda vez que trabaja con IMPRO y la primera con KVIA.
texts.en:
Daniel is a widower.  He has a professional degree, and has 4 children who are all independent.  He lives in his own home, occupying 3 rooms.  The house has finished walls and floors of ceramic tile, and is located in the Challapampa neighborhood of the city of La Paz.

Daniel works as a lawyer for more than 8 hours a day, processing a variety of documents.  In addition, he has an independent business selling electronic products such as televisions, DVD players and radios to help cover his bills for water, electricity and food.

Daniel needs a loan to buy more TVs and DVD players; this way he can have more working capital.

Daniel's dream is to make his business grow.

This is the second time that he has worked with IMPRO, and the first time with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy television sets, DVD players and radios to sell at retail

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to renovate his house.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a cash crop farmer in Olkalau where he plants maize, beans and potatoes. He is 55 years old and married to Rodah who is also a farmer. They have four children.

This is his first loan. He plans to buy farm supplies including fertilizer, seeds and other chemicals for use in his farm. He anticipates earning more income  to pay the school fees for his children.

He hopes to buy more land for farming and to improve his farm by planting more cash crops. By earning more income, Joseph hopes to improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Denis

texts.en: Denis is a 34-year-old married man with four children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He is a policeman and has been in service for seven years. Peace and harmony are virtues he values and he feels that the best way to experience them is being in a position to provide peace and harmony for others which is why he joined the police force. He has been able to pay school fees for his children and start a retail shop to supplement his salary despite challenges of a low salary and price fluctuations. Denis intends to use the loan to buy land for farming.

loans.use: to buy land for farming.

loans.name: Abdullah

texts.en: Abdullah is a 19-year-old single man studying to be a nurse in a government university. Abdullah is one of eight siblings. Few of them are married. Abdullah wants to help support the family, but first wants to get a bachelor degree and find a job. He has applied for this loan to pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Kagwiria

texts.en: Kagwiria is a 34-year-old married woman. She has two children and describes herself to be social. Kagwiria operates a retail store where she sells home products such as sugar, salt, wheat flour, bread, milk, maize flour, etc.. She has been involved in this business for eight years. Her business is located in a viable area for business. Her primary customers are local residents. Kagwiria describes her biggest business challenge as the high prices of home products. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy home products. Her goal is to expand her business within five years. She hopes that, in the future, she will run a wholesale shop. This is her first loan from SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy home products.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret has a beauty salon in the town of Nyahururu. She is 38 years old and married to Daniel. They have three children who all attend school.

This is her fourth loan and she plans to buy salon equipment for use in her business. The equipment includes a blow drier, hair clips, hair chemicals and shampoo. She hopes to earn more income with which she will provide for the needs of her family.

She hopes to grow her business by opening another beauty salon.

loans.use: To buy salon equipment.

loans.name: Annrose

texts.en:
Annrose is 21 years old, married to Victor and they have one child. Annrose runs a retail shop in Nakuru town. She has been in the retail business for two years now and it has been profitable.

This will be her second loan term and she plans to use the amount to buy more stock of maize flour, cooking oil, rice, wheat flour and bar soap as well as detergents to sell in her business.

She will use the generated profits to add more variety of goods to sell.

In the future, Annrose hopes to grow her business by opening other retail shops in the area. She also hopes to open a wholesale business.

loans.use: To buy more general goods to sell.

loans.name: Subhiya

texts.en:
Subhiya is a 54-year-old married woman with four sons and one daughter. 

After her husband retired they opened a mini market to have another source of income beside the retirement salary. Subhiya wants to bring more food products and goods to the store to increase their profits.

loans.use: to bring more food products and goods to the store

loans.name: Josiline

texts.en: Josiline is a twenty nine year old married woman living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She has a restaurant which was started with her returns from agriculture. Her main hardships are inadequate capital to purchase more stock for her customers and changes in seasons. She hopes to educate her children to higher levels of education and build a permanent house for them. Her business dream is to diversify and expand into new markets. The purpose of the loan is to buy more maize flour, beans, bananas, and rice to sell.

loans.use: to buy more maize flour, beans, bananas, and rice to sell.

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is a very hard working married man with 9 children who are all in school. James is a shrewd farmer who grows maize, beans and matooke to earn a living. His dream is to work hard and save enough money to buy a piece of land to expand his farm. This will help him to pay his children's school fees with ease. He wants to educate all his children up to university.

loans.use: To buy maize and bean seeds for planting

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en:
Cresencia is a 49-year-old married woman from Antequera, Bohol. She has two children. The oldest child is twenty while the youngest is six years old. 

Cresencia raises hogs. She has been in the hog raising business for ten years. Her husband is a carpenter. She is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy additional piglets and feed. She would like to expand her business by investing to other ventures to support her family and to save for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets and feed

loans.name: Nabil

texts.en:
Nabil is 28, a married man and has one child. He lives in Ibb, Yemen. He is the only provider for the family. He owns a business selling women's accessories and games for children . He specializes in treating his clients well. He has been in this business since 2004. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.

Nabil is requesting a youth loan of 80,000 YER to buy accessories and games. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy accessories and games for his business.

loans.name: Molly

texts.en: Molly is a 36 year old married woman with five children living in Masindi, Uganda. For ten years now she has been operating a retail shop and with the money earned she has been able to buy land and build a house with the help of her husband. Inefficient electricity supply hinders her business-- her dreams are to buy a generator and expand to new areas. Molly is requesting a loan to buy products such as synthetic hair and oils for the salon.

loans.use: to buy products such as synthetic hair and oils for the salon.

loans.name: Wedzine

texts.en:
Wedzine is 27 years old, lives with her partner, and has three young children. She lives together with her family in Tiribe.
For the past five years, Wedzine has dedicated herself to the sale of basic necessities and groceries through a small shop in her house. She offers her neighbors all types of day-to-day products and always provides a good welcome. The income from this activity is used to move her family forward little by little. Her husband is a motorcyclist who dedicates himself to transport services. This generates additional income.

Wedzine wishes to acquire merchandise so she can expand her sales and earnings. For this reason, she has found it helpful to ask Yehu for a loan of 50,000 KES to buy bales of maize and wheat flour, rice, beans, fats, etc.

loans.use: to buy bales of maize and wheat flour, rice, beans, fats, etc.

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en: Alaa, a 26-year-old, conservative, married woman has asked her husband to take her place in the photo. Alaa takes care of her two sons while her husband works at his workshop making sofas.  In the future he would like to employ a number of workers and expand the business. For now Alaa wants to help her husband in increasing his productivity so she has applied for a youth loan to buy more tools and foam for making more sofas and pillows.

loans.use: to bring more tools and foam

loans.name: Nour

texts.en: Nour is a 23-year-old single lady with 8 siblings. Nour works to help in supporting the family after their father passed away. She sells clothes and blankets from her home to neighbors, relatives, and friends. Now Nour has applied for a youth loan so she can buy a collection of new winter clothesto sell.

loans.use: to buy a collection of new winter clothes to sell.

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is married and through his hard work he has accumulated some wealth despite the fact that he is illiterate. His major challenge is stiff competition and crop pests which impact the yields. His biggest dream is to educate all his children because he wants them to become better people than himself. He will go to whatever heights to seem them all through school.

loans.use: To buy maize to plant

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 43 years old and a farmer in Ndunyu Njeru, Kenya. She plants cash crops such as maize, beans, and potatoes. She also keeps livestock, including cows, sheep, and goats. She is widowed and has three children.

This is her first loan term and she plans to buy sheep for rearing which she will later sell at a profit during the high season. She will use the generated income to pay school fees for her children.

She hopes to expand her farming business and become among the top farmers in the region, thereby making more income and improving the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To buy sheep.

loans.name: Francisco Gabriel

texts.es: Francisco Gabriel de 42 anos de edad, casado con dos hijos de 13 y 9 anos de edad.  Francisco tiene por actividad económica la venta de mercadería como ropa y cosméticos. El negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación y de forma ambulante. Francisco tiene 9 anos de  tener experiencia en el negocio. La rutina diaria de Francisco es trabajar una 8 a 10 horas dependiendo la ruta que trabaje. El todos los días sale a vender con el bulto de 20 kg. Bajo el intenso sol del día a día ofreciendo su mercadería a clientes fijos y eventuales. Hasta hoy esta ha sido su forma de vida y los que le ha permito sacar adelantes a su familia. Él ya ha trabajador con fundación y demostrado su responsabilidad de pago en tiempo y forma. el financiamiento lo necesita para invertir en capital de trabajo y comprar mercadería como : ropa de niño, adultos, short, fadas, blusas, ropa de cama, cosméticos  ya que se acerca la temporada navideña y las ventas se incrementa y de dicha forma poder sastifacer la demanda de los clientes y mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en: Francisco Gabriel is 42 years old, and is married with two children aged 13 and 9. Francisco makes a living by selling clothes and cosmetics. He sells from home as well as door-to-door. Francisco has 9 years experience in this business. Francisco's routinely works 8 to 10 hours per day, depending on the route that he takes. Every day he leaves home carrying a 20 kilo bag of merchandise to sell in the hot sun to both his regular and new clients. This is the way that he has been able to provide for his family up until now. He has already worked with the Foundation and has demonstrated that he is responsible and pays back in due time and proper form. He needs this loan to invest in working capital and buy merchandise such as adult's and children's clothing, shorts, skirts, blouses, bed linen, and cosmetics - especially since Christmas is coming up and his sales will increase. Having more merchandise will enable him to satisfy his client's demands and increase his profits.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock up on cosmetics, adult's and children's clothing, shorts, skirts, blouses, and bed linen.

loans.name: Vilma Eugenia

texts.es: Vilma Eugenia de 47 anos de edad de la localidad del León. Madre soltera con dos hijos de 19, 17 anos los cuales estudian en la universidad. Vilma tiene por actividad económica la tienda de ropa  y cosmético y prendas de plata y laminadas el negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación. Negocio que surgió para tener una fuente de ingresos para sacar adelante a sus hijos como madre soltera y brindarle mejoras oportunidades y que le logren cumplir uno de sus sueños como verlos realizados profesionalmente. El objetivo del préstamo es invertir en capital de trabajo y  surtir su tienda ya que se acercan la temporada navideña que es cuando se incrementan las ventas y poder  obtener mejores ganancias.  Con el préstamo comprar mercadería como: blusas, faldas, pantalones, camisas, cosméticos, prenda de plata y oro laminado. Vilma agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de vida digno.
texts.en: Vilma Eugenia is 47 years old and is from Leon. A single mother with two children ages 17 and 19 who are studying at university, she works from her store selling clothing, cosmetics, and and silver and gold-plated jewelry. She runs the store out of her home. She started the business in order to have a source of income to help her children get ahead, give them better opportunities, and see that they accomplish some of the professional dreams that she has for them. The goal of this loan is to invest in working capital and to stock her store ahead of the holiday season when sales and earnings begin to increase. With this loan she will purchase merchandise such as blouses, skirts, pants, shirts, cosmetics, and gold and silver-plated jewelry. Vilma is grateful for the assistance that Kiva lenders are able to provide to persons with scarce resources and impoverished countries such as Nicaragua in order to make possible for them a more dignified life.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock her store with merchandise such as blouses, skirts, pants, shirts, cosmetics, and silver and gold-plated jewelry.

loans.name: Alexandra Daniela

texts.es: Alexandra de 20 años de edad, tiene un hijo, no es casada pero si tienen su pareja quien la apoya en todo, ella estudia la carrera de licenciatura en administración de empresas con 50 meses de duración, su madre le ayuda con los gastos universitarios, ahora Alexandra ya está en la etapa final de su profesión por lo que solicita apoyo de crédito para poder cubrir con el pago del curso de titulación, el cual la va a beneficiar para salir adelante con su familia y ejercer su carrera.
texts.en: Alexandra is 20 years old.  She has one child and is not married, but she has a partner who supports her in everything.  She is studying for a license in business administration.  The course is 50 months long.  Her mother helps her with the university expenses.  Alexandra is now in the final stage of her profession.  She is asking for this loan to so that she can cover the payment for her courses for her degree, which will help her practice her career and help her and her family to get ahead.

loans.use: to pay for courses for a university degree

loans.name: Ana Daysi

texts.es:
Ana, necesita mejorar el negocio, ya que por las lluvias destruyeron un poco el local de venta, se comprara lámina, ladera, alambres, además comprara maíz y gas, para el negocio, esto le ayudara para trabajar.
Con el préstamo anterior tuvo un efecto positivo, mejoro sus ventas y ha tenido mas clientes, su único inconveniente ha sido el deterioro del local ocasionado por el invierno.
texts.en:
Ana needs to make improvements to her business because the rains have slightly destroyed the location of her shop.  She will buy paper, wood, wire, and also corn and gas for the business, which will help her to work.

Her last loan had a positive effect.  She bettered her sales and has had more customers.  Her only inconvenience has been the deterioration of the location of her business occasionally in the winter.

loans.use: to buy paper, wood, wire, corn and gas

loans.name: María Isabel

texts.es:
En un bello Municipio de Santa Rosa Del Peñón Ubicada en el departamento de león una bella ciudad donde se dedica al comercio es aquí donde habita doña María Isabel. 
 
María Isabel una Joven de 29 años de edad, donde tiene 9 años de laborar como maestra  en educación primaria, ella no tenía conocimiento en donde poder conseguir un crédito para el desarrollo de su familia.

Solicita un crédito a Ceprodel y Kiva para la compra de: Cemento, Arena, Piedrín y pago de mano de Obra, ella considera que este pequeño financiamiento seria de mucha importancia para ir reparando su vivienda y vivir en mejores condiciones con su familia.

De manera, solo cuenta con su honestidad, su buen record crediticio, su buena salud y su amor al trabajo, esto la hace a que pueda optar a este pequeño crédito que la ayudara a salir de su pobreza.
texts.en:
Maria Isabel makes a living in the beautiful municipality of Santa Rosa Del Peñón located in the Leon department.  She is a young woman, 29 years of age, and has 9 years of experience teaching grade school.  She previously did not know where she could find a loan to help develop her family's life.  She is seeking a loan from Ceprodel and Kiva to purchase cement, sand, brick, and labor.  She believes this small financing would be very important to continuing the reparation of her home and thus giving better living conditions to her family.  

She is only able to offer her honesty, strong credit record, good health, and passion for her work.  This is what gives her the ability to seek this small credit that will help pull her out of poverty.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, brick, and labor.

loans.name: Maria Teresa De Jesus

texts.es:
Maria, se le presenta una nueva oportunidad para invertir, por eso a través de un nuevo préstamo quiere fortalecer el negocio para la temporada que se acerca, se comprara juguetes, ropa, sombrillas, que es mercadería a diario vendida en el mercado.
Manifiesta que el préstamo anterior le incremento su negocio, adquiriendo mas productos para obtener mejores beneficios por las ventas, sus condiciones económicas se mantienen mejor.
texts.en:
A new investment opportunity has presented itself to Maria, which is why, through a new loan, she will strengthen her business for the upcoming season. She will be toys, clothing and umbrellas - the merchandise that she sells daily in the market.

She says that the previous loan increased her business. She acquired more products and got better profits on her sales. Her economic conditions have improved.

loans.use: to buy toys, clothing, and umbrellas.

loans.name: Jose Wilfredo

texts.es:
José, está realizando una nueva siembra, necesita dinero para comprarse 5 sacos de abono y una bolsa de herbicidas y pago de mano de obra, por eso solicita un nuevo préstamo para realizar la compra de los insumos agrícolas.
Considera que su rentabilidad con la producción aumento, debido al uso del préstamo anterior, ha mejorado los ingresos y vive muy bien con su familia.
texts.en: Jose is undertaking a new harvest.  He needs money to buy 5 sacks of fertilizer, a bag of herbicides, and payment for farm labor, so he is asking for a new loan in order to cover his agricultural expenses.  He expects that his profits will increase with production.  Thanks to his previous loan, he has increased his income and lives very well with his family.

loans.use: to buy 5 sacks of fertilizer, a bag of herbicides, and payment for farm labor

loans.name: Daysis Del Socorro

texts.es:
En el municipio de Santa Rosa del Peñón una preciosa ciudad dedicada en diferentes actividades comerciales es donde habita Daysis del Socorro.

Daysis necesita un financiamiento de Kiva y Ceprodel para la compra de: Zin, Madera Y pago de Mano de Obra. Dicho préstamo será de mucho beneficio ya que le permitirá vivir en mejores condiciones con su familia, bajo un techo seguro donde contara con toda las condiciones necesaria pero si le garantizara estar más seguro con su familia.  

Es madre soltera con un hijito bajo su cargo, trabaja como maestra de educación primaria, con lo poco que ella gana a duras penas mantiene a su hijo y le ayuda a su madre en la alimentación, pero debido a la necesidad que ella presenta en su hogar solicita un crédito. 

De momento solo cuenta con su buena salud, su amor al trabajo y su pequeña vivienda que la ha ido construyendo con muchas dificultades que ha presentado en el transcurso de su vida.

 Agradece a Ceprodel y Kiva  por haberle obtenido su mano amigable en crédito que le ha permitido el desarrollo en su vida y el de su familia
texts.en:
Daysis del Socorro lives in the town of Santa Rosa del Peñón, a precious city where people perform different types of jobs.

Daysis needs a loan from Kiva and Ceprodel to buy tin roofing, wood, and to pay for labor. The loan will help her because it will allow her family to live in better conditions, under a secure roof, with everything they need to be safer.

She is a single mother with a young son in her care. She works as a primary school teacher, and with her small salary she takes care of her son and helps her mother with food, but due to the need that has arisen in her house she is asking for a loan.

At this time she has good health, love of her work, and her small home that she has been constructing through the many challenges that have presented themselves throughout her life.

She is grateful to Kiva and Ceprodel for having given their friendly hand in this loan that has permitted development in her life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy tin roofing, wood, and pay for labor.

loans.name: Margarit

texts.en: Margarit is from the Dvin village of the Ararat region of Armenia. She lives with her husband and two sons. Margarit is involved in agriculture. She grows peach, apple and pomegranate trees. The income that comes from the sale of fruits helps Margarit to cover her family’s basic costs and help her husband to support the family. She has requested this loan in order to buy pears and persimmons. Margarit plans to keep fruits in the freezer to sell to wholesalers and local market traders during the winter. This will allow her to have a stable income until the next agricultural year. Margarit hopes that the loan will bring the expected results and she will be able to ensure a better future for her children.

loans.use: to buy pears and persimmons to resell

loans.name: Mulongo

texts.en:
Mulongo is taking out another loan to expand her existing mat-selling business. Also, she wants to expand her line of operations. She says that the previous loan had a great positive impact on her business. The new investment will enable her not only to buy more mats to sell but also to buy a motorcycle to offer transport services in her vicinity.
She is sure to repay this loan and acquire more loans for business purposes.

loans.use: to purchase more mats to sell and a motorcycle.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard is borrowing UGX 1,000,000 jointly with his wife to pay school fees for their three children. They have not yet completed paying the term's fees and yet exams are around the corner. Their children will not be allowed to sit for exams if they have not made full payment. Richard is a farmer and sells pork in the evening after his farm working hours. He sells it to the people at the nearby bar. He hopes to build a structure where people will sit and enjoy eating his pork, especially those that do not go to bars.

loans.use: to pay school fees.

loans.name: Ammar

texts.en: Ammar is 25 years old and in Aden, Yemen, with his one child, whom he loves. He is very friendly, hardworking and enthusiastic and he makes every effort to come out ahead. He applied for a youth loan of 305,000 YER from AMB to buy a rickshaw for transportation.

loans.use: to buy a rickshaw for transportation.

loans.name: Nahun Arturo

texts.es:
Nahun, solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos para la nueva siembra agrícola, comprando 5 sacos de abono, este material es importante para fortalecer la producción agrícola, dándole más oportunidad de tener una cosecha abundante.
El préstamo anterior le dio el recurso financiero, para poder aumentar la producción, aplicando los materiales necesarios, su grupo familiar se mantiene, están todos muy bien de salud, gracias a la inversión del préstamo Kiva, de las cosechas que obtuvo le han permitido mejorar su economía.
texts.en:
Nahun asks for a loan to buy agricultural inputs for his new planting - 5 sacks of compost. This material is important to strengthen production, giving him a better chance of having an abundant harvest.

The previous loan gave him financial resources to increase his production, applying the necessary materials. He maintains his home and they are all in good health. Thanks to the investment from Kiva, the harvests he obtained have allowed him to improve his economic conditions.

loans.use: to buy 5 sacks of compost.

loans.name: Sireen

texts.en:
Sireen is 25 years old and is a conservative lady. She asked her mother to appear in the photo instead of her.

Sireen is a mother looking after her two daughters. She helps her husband to improve their living conditions by selling kids' clothing items at home to friends and relatives. Sireen has applied for a youth loan to increase the quantity of clothes she has and to bring in a new winter collection of clothes.

loans.use: to buy a new winter collection of clothes to resell

loans.name: Nzadze

texts.en:
For several years, Nzadze has sold products used daily such as milk, rice, cooking oil, sugar, toilet paper, tuna and eggs. With the earnings from the sale of her products, she tries to cover all her expenses and improve her standard of living.

She says that her grocery business is doing well. The loans have helped her a great deal, and her store is growing little by little. Now, she is appealing to the generosity of the Kiva lenders and applying for a new loan of 50,000 KES. She will use the loan to expand her business by buying more merchandise like flour, basic grains and detergents. Her one dream is for her business to grow and have more products to offer customers, and enable her to cover her loan.
Nzadze is a responsible, dedicated and hard-working person who is concerned about helping her family get ahead in life.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise like flour, basic grains and detergent.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy is 21 years old, married and has two children, 2 and 5. She describes herself as a determined woman. She operates a retail business where she sells scarves and wallets. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a fast-growing business area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy wallets and scarves. Her business goal is to expand her business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will run a new retail shop selling home products to customers. She also hopes to educate her children with profits generated. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy scarves and wallets.

loans.name: Amneh

texts.en: Amneh is a 32-year-old woman looking after her four kids while her husband is serving in the military. Amneh started a small retail business at home selling cleaning products and babies' pampers. She has applied for this loan to increase the amount of babies' pampers and goods and products she has to sell.

loans.use: to buy more babies' pampers to resell

loans.name: G.s. Unidas En Cristo Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Unidas en Cristo esta conformado por tres integrantes dos mujeres y un hombre. María, José, Santos. Todos mayores de edad casada con 7 hijos adulto e independiente económicamente. Ellos son originarios del departamento de León, lugar que esta ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. María Auciliadora es la coordinadora del grupo solidario la que se encarga del buen funcionamiento del mismo. Ella tiene por actividad económica una pulpería y venta de cerdos. El negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación tiene 42 anos de desempeñar dicha actividad. El negocio consisten en vender productos comestible de consumo diario y en cantidades pequeñas como : sobrecitos de café, sobrecitos de shapoo, sobrecitos de salsas, arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, cuajada, tiste, pozol, jugos. Y también la venta de cerdos. El negocio lo inicio con esfuerzo propio para tener un medio de trabajo y de dicha forma ayudar con los gastos del hogar. El grupo ya ha trabajado con fundación demostrando en los créditos anteriores su responsabilidad de pago en tiempo y forma. El financiamiento lo necesita para invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio. El grupo solidario  Unidas en Cristo agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a los péquenos comerciantes de países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de vida digno.
texts.en:
The "Unidas en Cristo" [United in Christ] Solidarity Group is made up of three members: two women named María and Santos, and one man named José.  They are all of legal age and married with 7 adult children who are economically independent.  They are originally from the Department of Leon, a place that is located in the western part of the country.  

María Auciliadora is the coordinator of the group and as such is charged with making sure it functions well.  For her economic activity, she owns a convenience store, and she sells pigs.  The business is located in her home.  She has 42 years of experience in this activity.  The convenience store sells edible products for daily consumption in small quantities like:  sachets of coffee, shampoo, salsas, rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, gelatin, traditional drinks like "tiste" (a powdered beverage made of cornmeal and cocoa powder) and "pozol" (drink made from fermented corn dough), and juices.  María began the business with her own effort to have a means to work and the happiness of helping out with household expenses.  

The group has worked with the Foundation, demonstrating their responsibility to pay on time and in full with previous loans.  María needs this financing to invest in working capital to supply her convenience store.  The "Unidas en Cristo" [United in Christ] Solidarity Group is grateful for the help of Kiva lenders that offer a way for small business owners in poor countries like Nicaragua to have a dignified life.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and to supply her convenience store with products like sachets of coffee, shampoo, salsas, rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, gelatin, traditional drinks like "tiste" and "pozol," and juices.

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en: Chizi is a very hard-working person. She is grateful to Yehu for the support it has given her. Chizi has had a business selling goats for meat. She is requesting a loan from Yehu because she wishes to make a new investment in her business. She will use the loan to buy more goats to sell. By doing so Chizi hopes to greatly improve her income.

loans.use: to purchase more goats for resale.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac, a 39-year-old father of five children, is a farmer in the town of Ndunyu Njeru. He is married to Ruth who is also a farmer. He plants maize and beans as well as keeps livestock.

This will be his first loan term and he plans to use the amount to buy farm inputs, including fertilizer and seedlings for planting in his farm. He also plans to buy livestock feed. He anticipates making more income from the harvest with which he will pay school fees for his children. Isaac also hopes to buy a lorry with which he'll transport his farm produce to the market.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seedlings and livestock feed for his farm

loans.name: Hakiri

texts.en:
Hakiri is 41 years old and takes care of three relatives who are children. He owns a business selling various goods such as lotions, soap, toothpaste, rice, sugar, etc. He has four years of experience. His business is open every day each week from 6 a.m. until 5 p.m. except for Sundays. 

Hakiri has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to buy various goods such as lotions, soap, toothpaste, rice and sugar for resale. Through this expansion, Hakiri will be able to earn more profit which will be used to expand his general store, save for his future and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to buy various goods such as lotions, soap, toothpaste, rice and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Concepción De María

texts.es:
La Señora Concepción de María trabaja para una institución pública del estado en el municipio de La paz centro desde hace 4 años como conserje, es casada tiene dos hijos,  con dicha actividad laboral que desempeña es con la que ha sacado adelante su familia brindándole estudio, alimentación y demás necesidades básicas del hogar.

Actualmente es su cuarto crédito que tiene con nuestra institución y lo requiere para iniciar otra fuente de ingreso económico que es la venta de ropa nueva entre sus compañeros de trabajo y así brindarle una mejor condición de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Concepción de María has worked as a janitor for a public state institution in the municipality of La Paz Centro for four years. She is married with two children. The aforementioned job has helped her family to get ahead - providing them with an education, food, and other basic home necessities.

This is currently her fourth loan with this institution and she needs it to establish another source of income, namely the sale of new clothes to her coworkers, in order to provide her family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to start her own business (selling new clothes)

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is applying for his second loan of KES 15,000 from KADET LTD after servicing his previous loan well and in good time. He is now 27 years old, is single and supports his mother. Besides pig farming, he has also started mushroom planting and crop farming as well.

He plans to use the entire loan amount to buy seedlings and prepare a cold room. He will plough the anticipated profit into the farming business through buying farm inputs.

In the future, Stephen hopes to grow his business and be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and prepare a cold room for his farm

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel, 32 years old, lives together with her husband. They both work hard to get ahead in life. She works from home. She has a store in which she sells perishable and essential goods. She has a few loyal customers.

Because she has lacked the money, Rachel has not been able to restock her business. Restocking is very important to improving her profits and stability, because it will attract more clients.

Rachel is requesting a loan from Yehu with which she will be able to buy the products she needs including soap, detergent, beverages and basic grains. This will guarantee the continuation of her business.

loans.use: to buy products for her general store including soap, detergent, beverages and basic grains.

loans.name: Phelomena

texts.en:
Phelomena is 53 years old, in a common-law relationship with her husband and has five grown children. She and her family reside in a rural community in the town of Mwambalazi.

Phelomena has been selling food products and groceries for five years. She sells basic grains, soft drinks, hygiene and cleaning products, flour, and snack foods. 

She is requesting a loan in the amount of 30,000 KES so that she can invest in the purchase of flour, dairy products, sugar, condiments, soft drinks, and detergents. She says that if her business is well-stocked, then she will gain more customers and increase her earnings. Her goal is to expand her shop and offer more products to her customers.

loans.use: to purchase flour, dairy products, sugar, condiments, soft drinks and detergents.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 40 years old, married and has three children, ages 1 to 7. He sells goats and currently employs one person to help him. He has 15 years experience in this work. 

Emmanuel has requested a loan from Kiva lenders, via Vision Finance Company, to buy more goats for resale. He plans to use any profits generated from this loan to satisfy his family's basic needs and to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To purchase more goats for resale.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 31 years old, married and has three children, who are dependents. She lives with her husband and children in one of the rural communities that comprise the rural district of Msambweni, located in Kenya's Coast Province.
Her business is selling groceries, beverages and snacks, and basic grains. She has done this for over two years approximately, in a store she has set up in her house. She is open every day and she currently has a well-established clientele. She's very well-known in the area. She uses the profits she gets from her business to help her husband support their family's finances.
Janet is requesting a loan from Yehu for the fourth time. It is for 20,000 KES, which she plans to invest in the purchase of merchandise such as rice, sugar and oil to stock up her grocery store.
She gives thanks in advance to Kiva lenders for supporting her at this time.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of merchandise such as rice, sugar and oil.

loans.name: Alima

texts.en:
Alima is 49 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has six children. She lives with her family in the town of Mwambalazi.
Five years ago, she started her business of selling coconuts. Alima came up with the idea to establish this business because she wanted to help her partner with the family expenses.

At the moment, she wants to restock with more products that are in great demand. For this reason, she is requesting a loan in the amount of 20,000 KES. She hopes to invest her earnings in the growth of her business and in the expenses for her family.

loans.use: to buy more coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Tambi Emmanuel

texts.fr:
Mr T. EMMANNUEL est célibataire avec 03 enfants. Le plus âgé a 17ans et le moins âgé a 10ans. Ils vont à l’école  et  il a 03 personnes  à sa charge.

Il est étudiant en classe de Master I professionnelle à l’ESTPO (Ecole Supérieure des Travaux Public de Ouagadougou) depuis 04ans. Parce que L’ESTPO est une école de référence en matière de formation en génie civil dans notre pays.

Mr veut financer ses études supérieures.

Il fait des stages pratiques  pendant les vacances pour acquérir une expérience professionnelle. Il compte après ses études, travailler d’abord, ensuite créer son propre entreprise et éduquer ses enfants.
texts.en:
Emmanuel is single and he has three children.  His oldest child is 17 years old, his youngest is 10.  All three go to school. Emmanuel has three people in his care.

For the past four years Emmanuel has been enrolled at the ESTPO or "Ecole Supérieure des Travaux Publics de Ouagadougou" (Ouagadougou Graduate School for Public Works), where he is a graduate student.  The ESTPO is a top civil engineering school in our country.

He wants to finance his graduate studies.

During school breaks he does internships in order to acquire professional experience.  After graduation he would like to find employment and then create his own company.  He also wants to take care of his children's education.

loans.use: to finance his graduate studies.

loans.name: Wend Pagnangde Ghislain

texts.fr:
Mr  WENDPAGNANDE GHISLAIN est célibataire sans enfant.

Il  est étudiant en classe de Master I  professionnelle à l’ESTPO (Ecole Supérieure des Travaux Public de Ouagadougou) depuis  2ans. Parce que L’ESTPO est une école de référence en matière de formation en génie civil dans notre pays.

Mr  veut financer ses études supérieures.

Il fait des stages pratiques  pendant les vacances pour acquérir une expérience professionnelle et réussir brillement à l’école.  Après les  études, il compte  avoir du boulot et avoir des enfants.
texts.en:
Mr. WEND PAGNANDE GHISLAIN is single and has no children.

For two years, he has been a first-cycle Master’s Degree student in an applied science program at ESTPO (Ouagadougou Graduate School for Public Works). ESTPO is one of the schools of reference for public works in our country.

He wants to finance his graduate studies.

During the holidays, he did practical internships to gain professional experience and to succeed brilliantly at school. After his studies, he is planning on finding work and on founding a family.

loans.use: to finance his graduate studies.

loans.name: Z . Hyacinte B

texts.fr:
Mr  Z HYANCINTE B est célibataire sans enfant.
Il est étudiant en classe de Master I professionnelle à l’ESTPO (Ecole Supérieure des Travaux Public de Ouagadougou) depuis  2011.
Mr veut financer ses études supérieures.
Au terme de ses études, son ambition  serait de décrocher un travail pour participer au développement de son payer. Fonder un foyer et surtout intervenir dans l’humanitaire
texts.en:
Mr. Z. Hyacinte B. is single without children.
He has been a graduate student at the “Ecole Supérieure des Travaux Public de Ouagadougou" (Ouagadougou Graduate School for Public Works) since 2011. He would like to finance his graduate studies. After finishing his studies, his goal is to obtain a job  contributing to the to the development of his country,  start a family, and certainly be be active in humanitarian work.

loans.use: to pay for his graduate studies.

loans.name: N. Philippe

texts.fr:
Mr  NONGWENDE PHILIPPE est célibataire sans enfant.
Il est étudiant en classe de Master I professionnelle à l’ESTPO (Ecole Supérieure des Travaux Public de Ouagadougou) depuis  3ans. Parce que L’ESTPO est une école de référence en matière de formation en génie civil dans notre pays.
Mr veut financer ses études supérieures.
Il fait des stages pratiques  pendant les vacances pour acquérir une expérience professionnelle. Il envisage après les études, oeuvrer pour la nation en participant à la réalisation des infrastructures à leurs gestions et  leurs entretiens.
texts.en:
Nongwende Philippe is single and has no children. 

He has been a student of the professional Master I at Ecole Supérieure des Travaux Public de Ouagadougou (Ouagadougou Graduate School for Public Works) for 3 years. Because this is a reputed school in the country for training in civil engineering, he would like [to continue] to finance his higher education. 

Nongwende Philippe does internships during the holidays to acquire work experience. After his studies, he hopes to work for the country to develop infrastructure, as well as [be involved in] their management and maintenance.

loans.use: to finance his higher education

loans.name: Jean Marie

texts.fr:
Mr JEAN MARIE est célibataire avec 02 enfants. Le plus âgé a 08ans et le moins âgé a 10mois. Un va à l’école  et  il a 08 personnes  à sa charge.

Il est étudiant en classe de Master II professionnelle à l’ESTPO (Ecole Supérieure des Travaux Public de Ouagadougou) depuis 04ans.

Mr veut financer ses études supérieures.

Il compte après ses études créer une entreprise afin de subvenir à  ses besoins et celui de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Jean Marie is single and has two children - the youngest of whom is 10 months old and the oldest of whom is 8 years old. One goes to school, and he has 8 dependents total.

For the past four years, he has been enrolled at the "Ecole Supérieure des Travaux Publics de Ouagadougou" (Ouagadougou Graduate School for Public Works) where he is completing the second year of coursework for his Masters degree. He would like to finance his education.

After his studies, he would like to start a business in order to meet his needs as well as the needs of his family.

loans.use: to finance his education.

loans.name: Bozorgul

texts.ru: Бозоргулу 35 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 4  детей.  Бозоргул всегда старается обеспечить своих детей со всеми не обходимыми средствами, так как ее муж тракторист и у него маленький доход. Более 4 года она занимается купле продажей женской одежды. Она имеет торговую точку на местном рыке. Ее товар привлекает много клиентов, так как Бозоргул всегда обновляет ассортимент своего товара. Она должна купить товар для нового сезона, но не имеет достаточного средства для этого. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1500 сомони  для покупки товара для нового сезона. Она ждет вашу доброту и обещает погашать займ своевременно.
texts.en: Bozorgul is 35 years old. She is married and is raising four children. Bozorgul always tries to provide her children with all the necessary means as her husband is a tractor driver and has a small income. She has been in the business of buying and selling women's clothing for over four years. She has a vendor location on the local market. Her merchandise attracts a lot of customers because Bozorgul always renews the variety of her inventory. She needs to buy new inventory of goods for the upcoming season, but does not have enough means to do so. She is asking for a loan in the amount of 1,500 somoni to buy merchandise for new season. She awaits your kindness and promises to pay off the loan on time.

loans.use: to buy new variety of clothes for new season.

loans.name: Gbehigbenan Group

texts.fr: Le groupe « GBEHIGBENAN» est composé de deux personnes qui sont des amies. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Nicole est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Nicole est âgée de 35 ans et vit au Bénin. Nicole est mariée à un transitaire du nom de Sébastien. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés, et tous à leur charge. Nicole vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Nicole supporte ensemble avec son mari les diverses charges familiales. Pour y parvenir, Nicole vend des produits vivriers dans une ville du Bénin. Nicole achète ses produits dans un marché du Bénin. Nicole désire satisfaire un plus grand nombre de clients par ses produits, mais Nicole ne dispose pas suffisamment de moyens financiers pouvant lui permettre de rehausser le niveau de son activité. C’est pour ce faire que Nicole sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe « GBEHIGBENAN». Le crédit reçu précédemment a été bien remboursé.
texts.en: The Gbehigbenan group is made up of two people who are friends. The representative of the group, whose name is Nicole, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. Nicole is 35 years old and lives in Benin. She is married to a freight broker called Sébastien. The couple has three children to support, some of whom are at school. Nicole lives with her children and husband. She and her husband cover the various household expenses between them. In order to do this, Nicole sells food products in a town in Benin. She buys her products in a Benin market. She wants her products to provide satisfaction to a greater number of customers, but does not have sufficient financial means to increase her business volume. It is for this reason that she, together with the other member of the Gbehigbenan group, is requesting a second loan from Alidé. The previous loan was repaid in full.

loans.use: to buy food products.

loans.name: Abdulai

texts.en:
In the photo is Abdulai. He is a small-scale businessman based in Kenema, a city in Eastern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan this entrepreneur is accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, Abdulai will be able to expand his businesses, make more profit and consequently improve his standard of living. 

Abdulai was born in Tongo, a town about 15 miles from Kenema city. Abdulai is single with one child who is attending primary school. He has been a businessman for six years now. He sells mobile phones and mobile phone accessories. With the help of this loan, he is going to buy mobile phones and mobile phone accessories to add to his current ones.

loans.use: to buy mobile phones and mobile phone accessories to add to his current ones.

loans.name: Patrician's Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are staff members in one of the leading communications companies in Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to borrow the sum of 7,600,000 Leones in order to meet their immediate financial challenges. At the end of each month, they will repay the loan using their monthly salaries. 

Patricia is the leader of this group. Patricia is 48 years of age. A native of Kenema city, she is divorced and has three children – one in college and two who are not of school-going age. Patricia has had 16 years of work experience. She has requested this loan in order to pay college fees for her child.

loans.use: to pay college fees for her child.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 47 years old, married and has four children in school. He runs a butcher shop to earn a living. He has been in the business for 12 years and employs one person. He also does farming for more income generation. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has experienced a lot of growth in his business. He thanks Faulu Kenya for training him on business management skills. He has also gained from the financial support from Faulu Kenya.

Stephen desires to practice large-scale farming in the future. He has requested a loan of 36,053.10 KES to buy a water tank. He will use the water tank for water storage on his farm.

loans.use: To buy a water tank.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
This is Rose, 41, a resident of Caloocan, Philippines. She is married to Romeo, a construction foreman and is a mother to her children. Together with her husband, she manages her household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Rose operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings where all of the family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to use cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands costs less than raw food. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 24,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings and frozen food products. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Rose hopes that her business will expand soon and dreams of giving her children a good and quality education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Deonila

texts.en:
This is Deonila, She previously accessed an 30,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, house hold and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 32,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Deonila hopes to be able to expand soon and dreams that her children will be successful in life She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Ansumana Samuka's Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are teachers in one of the primary schools in Kenema, a city in Eastern Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to borrower the sum of 8,000,000 Leones in order to meet their immediate financial challenges. At the end of each month, they will repay the loan using their monthly salaries. Their school’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayments and making the payments on their behalf.

Reynolds is the leader of this group. Reynolds is 59 years of age. Born in a place called Sami Felluma, in Eastern Sierra Leone, Reynolds is married to a businesswoman and the couple has seven children – three in primary school, three in secondary school and one in college. Reynolds has had 38 years of experience in the teaching profession. 

He has requested this loan in order to buy house-building materials like iron, corrugated zinc, cement, rods, nails, etc. to construct a family dwelling house.

loans.use: to buy house-building materials like iron, corrugated zinc, cement, rods and nails to construct a family dwelling house.

loans.name: Jinnah E.'s Group

texts.en:
Jinnah is the featured leader of this group of school teachers. He was born in Gbeika village, in Eastern Sierra Leone 50 years ago. He is married to a nurse and the couple has four children who are attending primary and secondary schools. Jinnah has served in the teaching profession for 33 years now. Jinnah will use his share of the loan to pay school fees for his children. 

SMT/Kiva lenders loans designed specifically for teachers are very helpful as they enable them to buy or invest in items that their mere salaries cannot let them do. But with the help of this loan, some of them will be able to invest in business, pay school fees for their children, buy household furniture or house-building materials, etc. and at the end of each month, they repay the loan, using their monthly salaries. It is their school’s bursar who is directly responsible for doing the deductions and making the repayments on their behalf.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam is a 20-year-old married woman from Antequera, Bohol. She has no children yet. She is engaged in making native products like baskets made of nito (palm). She has been in the business for one year. 

She is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase materials for additional start-up of her basket-weaving like nito (palm) and wicker (a hard woven fiber formed into a rigid material, usually used for baskets or furniture. Wicker is often made of material of plant origin, but plastic fibers are also used.) 

Miriam would like to expand her business by investing into other business ventures so she can make a better living.

loans.use: to buy nito (palm) and wicker.

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es:
La señora Martha Lorena tiene un negocio de venta de calzado ubicado en uno de los mercados de la ciudad de León, lo inició de forma ambulante con ventas de ropa, actualmente tiene su puesto fijo con venta de calzado de toda índole donde ha logrado obtener mayor clientela, sale de su casa a las 6:00 am abriendo su negocio a la 6:30 y finalizando a las 5:00 pm  con este mismo horario de lunes a sábado, realiza este trabajo desde hace ocho años para el sustento de su hogar.

Sus compras las realiza al por mayor a comerciantes de la ciudad de Masaya. Es madre soltera de cinco hijos los cuales todos son mayores de edad y ninguno está a su cargo.

Martha Lorena solicita este  crédito a CEPRODEL  para compra de sandalias y zapatos de diferentes estilos para  aprovechar la demanda por  aproximarse la navidad, La señora Martha sueña con que su negocio siga creciendo.
texts.en:
Martha Lorena has a business selling footwear. Her business is located in one of the markets in the city of León. She started as a street trader selling clothes. Now she has her own stall selling all types of footwear and she has increased her number of customers. She leaves her house at 6:00am, opening her business at 6:30 and finishing up at 5:00pm. This is her work schedule from Monday to Saturday. She has been doing this work for eight years in order to sustain her family. 

She buys stock wholesale from traders in the city of Masaya. She is a single mother of five children, all of whom are grown up. None of her children are dependent on her. 

Martha Lorena is requesting this loan from CEPRODEL to buy sandals and shoes of different styles. She plans to make the most of the increasing demand coming up to Christmas. Martha hopes that her business will continue to grow.

loans.use: to buy sandals and shoes of different styles

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for maintenance of her machines.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more products from Avon to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.es:
De 50 años de edad, Saturnina tiene por pareja a Pedro con quien tiene 6 hijos casi en su totalidad mayores e independientes. Cuenta gracias al apoyo de toda su familia con su propia vivienda hecha con material noble. Hallándose en una buena oportunidad  de iniciarse en el rubro comercial, logró desde hace 8 años inagurar una tienda de abarrotes en el único ambiente amplio y acogedor de su vivienda. A medida que iba desempeñándose como tal decidió complementar su negocio con la venta de chicharrones al paso por ser uno de los productos mas consumidos por los pobladores. Considera  su negocio muy rentable ya que posee actualmente una gran cantidad de amigos y vecinos quienes son como sus fieles compradores. Dado el buen momento que lleva desea realizar la compra de mercadería para su tienda ya que ha visto por conveniente seguir incrementando de a pocos el tamaño de su negocio con el afán de a futuro convertirlo en un gran negocio completo y abastecido.
Uno de sus objetivos en adelante es el de lograr darle el acabado respectivo a su local comercial así como la ampliación del mismo con andamios y vitrinas grandes. Este viene a ser su crédito número 16 , a pesar de tener ciertas dificultades siempre fue puntual con el pago de su préstamo, le agrada el hecho de que su banco comunal sea una grupo numeroso , ya que el trabajo colectivo es una trabajo muy reconfortante para ella. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles  complementará su capital para la compra de mercadería para su negocio dentro del cual se encuentran los productos de primera necesidad como arroz , azúcar, conservar , entre otros.
texts.en:
Saturnina, 50, has six children together with Pedro, her partner. Most of them are independent adults now. Thanks to her family’s support, she owns a house made with solid materials.

Eight years ago, an opportunity arose to start a business. She opened a grocery store in the only spacious and inviting room in her house. With time, she decided to start selling chicharrón [fried, crunchy meat] on the go as a complement, since it is one of the products that locals consume the most. She considers her business to be a profitable one, because many of her friends and neighbors are loyal customers. Now that the business is experiencing a good period, she wants to buy supplies for her store, as she considers that expanding her business step by step is convenient so that in the future it can become a larger, complete and well-stocked business. One of her goals for the future is to be able to improve her store’s appearance and to add shelves and big showcases.

This will be her sixteenth credit. In the past, even if she faced some difficulties, she was able to pay back on time. She likes the fact that the communal bank is composed of numerous members, because collective work is comforting for her. With the 1000 soles [PEN], she will have enough capital to buy merchandise for her store. She will buy essential supplies such as rice, sugar and canned food.

loans.use: to buy essential supplies, such as rice, sugar and canned food.

loans.name: Rosa Argentina

texts.es:
La señora ROSA ARGENTINA  es madre  soltera de cinco  hijos  y se dedica a la venta de atol y pan, desde hace once años con la que ha desarrollado a sus hijos.

Rosa inicia a preparar su riquísimo  atol de  9:00  a 10:00 am posteriormente se traslada a venderlo a uno de los mercado de la ciudad de León Nicaragua  y finaliza a las 3:00 pm,  de 4:00 a 6:00 pm se dedica  a la venta pan de forma ambulante en las calle de dicha Ciudad.

Una de las necesidades que atraviesa  son  los gastos de graduación y estudio universitario de su hija, debido a esto visitó a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito y así  poder asegurarle  el futuro profesional de su hija.

Rosa Argentina  sueña con la preparación profesional de sus Hijos y obtener su propia vivienda ya que habita donde su Mamá.
texts.en:
ROSA ARGENTINA  is a single mother of 5 children and sells bread and atol (a traditional corn starch based drink). She has done this for 11 years and with it has raises her children. 

Rosa starts to make her delicious atol at 9:00 a.m.  At 10:00 am she takes it to sell at one of the markets in the city of León Nicaragua and finishes at 3:00 p.m. From 4:00 to 6:00 p.m. she sells bread as a street vendor in the streets of the city. 

One of the things she needs is to pay for her daughter's graduation  and college education costs. That is why she visited Ceprodel to get a loan and thus ensure her daughter's professional future. 

Rosa Argentina dreams of all of her children having professional careers and of owning her own home, since she lives with her mother.

loans.use: to pay for graduation costs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Doraliza

texts.en:
This is Doraliza. She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities of fish and vegetables to expand her product inventory. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, house hold and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan for her to loan to pay for fish, meat and vegetables supplies she needed in her business. The more fish, meat and vegetables displayed at her stall the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Doraliza dreams of having more business and hopes to give her family a good life through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more varieties of fish needed in her business.
